_source.complaint_what_happened:
I am writing to file a complaint against Bank of America because they made a arbitrary and unjustified decision to reduce my credit limit with no basis in fact for the change. I sent a letter to Bank of America on XX/XX/XXXX. asking them to restore my credit limit or provide additional information explaining the decision. Because of the potential for this change to have a substantially negative impact on my access to credit I am not willing to wait for Bank of America to respond. 

I received a letter dated XX/XX/year>, that lists three reasons that Bank of America elected to decrease my credit limit : Current or past delinquency on one or more of your accounts with us and/or our affiliates Recent trend in balance on one or more of your accounts, with us and our affiliates, compared to past balance Strength of payment on one or more of your accounts with us and/or our affiliates. 

As the letter advised, I immediately reviewed my credit report from XXXX XXXX. Based on the report as of XX/XX/year>, no evidence supports any reasons for reducing my credit limit. There is no indication of any late payments on the credit report, no irregular or rapid increase or decrease in my balance owed, and my payments have been consistent and automatic for many years. When my promotional rate on a portion of my balance recently expired, I ensured that my automated payments increased to cover the new minimums. 

The only recent change that occurred in my relationship with Bank of America or their affiliates was the expiration of my promotional balance transfer rate on a portion of my balance. The expiry is likely the real reason my credit limit decreased. There is no evidence on my credit report supporting the reasons given. As mentioned above, I needed to adjust my payments, and I did so before the XX/XX/XXXX due date, which was more than XXXX days after the date of the XX/XX/XXXX letter informing me of the decision to lower my credit limit. 

Because the decision to lower my credit limit will harm my ability to obtain credit and be used as a basis to either increase my interest rate or further decrease my credit limit. The justifications listed in the XX/XX/XXXX letter do not stand up to even the most cursory inspection of my credit report from XXXX XXXX or any of the other XXXX credit reporting agencies. 

This decision to reduce my credit limit is arbitrary and an attempt to manipulate my financial reputation. At worst, it is a cynical attempt to undo the promotional balance transfer rates Bank of America has previously offered. 

I have attached my most current credit reports and the letter I sent to Bank of America.
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

_source.complaint_what_happened: I did a balance transfer 1 year ago. I mistakenly wasnt aware how to transfer funds to an external account to pay BoA and so the check was returned. Upon communication with the external bank I proceeded to transfer funds to pay Bank of America before the interest took effect. I went online and thought I sent {$20000.00} to Bank of America. Within minutes I called Bank of America after noticing the mistake once again and called in a {$20000.00} payment, which would leave approximately {$4200.00} left to pay on my card. I called them almost everyday and told them to stop trying to draft from the external account and to only use the payment method to which I called in. In speaking to collections, they told me that it was a bank error and didnt see where the {$20000.00} had gone through, which is why they closed my credit card account. She even asked me if it was taken from my external account to which I stated that it showed it posting on XXXX. She investigated and told me to call a number and tell them to refer to the notes to have my card reinstated. Bank of America without totally investigating told me they could not reinstate the card. Where is the grace? I have a 27 year mortgage with them to which I have never been late in 22 years. I have a checking account that has never been in the negative. I also have had this credit card for 30 years and have never been late. I dont feel that they properly investigated and have closed my longstanding account because they didnt take the time to value and appreciate and put forth effort to understanding the needs of a longstanding customer. This is my longest standing account and will greatly affect my credit score, which is unfair. I consistently called concerning this error. My credit score is excellent and I have never been late in paying anything.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Subject : Urgent Request for Documentation and Action Regarding Unauthorized Inquiry and Security Interest Dear Bank Of America, I am writing to address a concerning matter regarding an inquiry reported by Bank of America, which lacks permissible purpose and, as such, constitutes potential identity fraud. Per my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Sections 604 and 605B, I am requesting immediate action to rectify this situation. 

Firstly, I require documentation proving that I provided express written consent for Bank Of America to report the inquiry in question. As there is no evidence of such consent or a court order, I must assert that this inquiry lacks legitimacy and is thus subject to removal. 

Per the FCRA Section 605B, a consumer reporting agency must block the reporting of any information resulting from alleged identity theft when identified by the consumer. Therefore, I am formally notifying Bank Of America to remove this inquiry from my file within four business days. 

Furthermore, it has come to my attention that Bank Of America neglected to inform me of my right to rescission, as outlined in the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), specifically Regulation Z ( 12 CFR 1026.23 ). This allows me to revoke any rights waived, particularly those related to the security interest. I am requesting the CUSIP number associated with the security interest provided to Bank Of America. Failure to provide this information will leave me with no alternative but to initiate a level XXXX audit on my account. 

I expect prompt compliance with these requests to avoid further escalation of this matter. Failure to do so will be regarded as willful noncompliance and may result in legal action. 

Please provide confirmation of receipt of this letter and a timeline for resolution of these issues.
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
_source.sub_issue: Reporting company used your report improperly

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Subject : Demand for Removal of Unauthorized Credit Inquiry from XXXX Report I am writing to formally dispute and demand the immediate removal of an unauthorized credit inquiry from my XXXX credit report. My report lists an inquiry from Discover Financial Services that I did not authorize under the conditions disclosed to me : Discover Financial Services XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX This inquiry was the result of a preapproval promotion which explicitly indicated that only a soft pull would be conducted. Contrary to this representation, a hard pull was made on my credit report, which is a clear violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and a deceptive practice. 

The presence of this unauthorized hard inquiry is damaging my credit score and unjustly impacting my financial standing. I demand that this inquiry be removed from my credit report immediately. I expect prompt action on this matter and will not tolerate any delays. Failure to comply with this request will leave me with no choice but to escalate this matter further, including seeking legal action to protect my rights. 

I trust you will treat this matter with the urgency and seriousness it deserves. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution. 

Sincerely, Me
_source.sub_issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize

Then they site these reasons as why they place the holds in the first place. When a deposit is made you are advised of the hold date with a note that you can request the funds be released early. When you ask for them to be released early usaa tells you they can not and will not. They do not site any real information or reason, just thier policy. _source.complaint_what_happened: On XX/XX/year> I received multiple texts from USAA stating that they suspected fraud on my checking account. I tried to login to my USAA app but my PIN had been changed and I could not login with my password either. I had to reset the password and then the PIN and finally got in the account. I called USAA and was told that the department I need to speak with was not available and that I need to call back. I found out through looking at my account that someone had connected several online companies to my account and I disconnected them all when I saw this. I called USAA again and was told that they were exercising their right to discontinue banking with me due to suspected fraud. I asked what kind of fraud and was told that because I deposited one check and moved the money to another account of mine that it looked like fraud. This is something I have done before and I do not understand how this is fraud. My VA XXXX payment is direct deposited into this account and was told they will close the account within 90 days and then mail me any funds in the account. I depend on my XXXX payment to take care of my kids and pay bills. My XXXX was just deposited on XX/XX/year> and I have spoke to multiple departments because they are not legally allowed to withhold any type of VA benefits from a Veteran, yet they still have my money in this account and refuse to let me access it or move it to a different bank. I have called multiple days in a row and repeatedly asked to speak with a manager and have been told a manager will contact me but this is the 3rd day and I have not received a call. I need my VA XXXX payment released to me immediately.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I have had numerous issues with Discover Card over the past two years, including three false charges that I disputed that were kept on the acconunt. The third and most recent one is for {$500.00}. When the charge was present I overpaid the account to cover the charge. I then stopped using the account as I was extremely dissatisfied with the lack of customer service and lack of investigation into my issue. Thus, I am owed this money since I paid the account to keep it current during the dispute. 
I have contested this dispute and provided dozens upon dozens of documents and files with information ; NONE of which were reviewed - my queries were responded to by a chatbox immediately, without sufficient time for a human to read the text or open the documents. I submitted additional information. I have filed complaints before and Discover does NOT return my phone calls as they promise. I have been calling for over half a year at this point and have not gotten a SINGLE phone call back to discuss this issue. Instead, upon my last complaint, Discover closed my account, without refunding me any of the false charges from the past two years - the most notable one of which this {$500.00} that was charged in a scam. The fact that Discover keeps allowing scam charges to appear on accounts and expects people to pay them is straight up theft. Further, Discover reported this incorrectly to the credit bureaus, which now shows up on my report. In 30 years I have never so much as carried an account balance, let alone paid late or missed a payment, hence my perfect credit score - this must be Discover 's attempt to make money off of people they wouldn't otherwise be able to make money from. I am beginning to wonder if Discover is a partner of these scam artists as this is the only way they seem to make money off someone who always pays their bills. Now that my account is closed there is no way to log in or see account info and I am still owed money, yet Discover is inaccurately reporting it as delinquent. AGAIN, I HAVE CALLED AND WRITTEN TO DISCOVER AND CAN NOT GET A SINGLE RESPONSE TO MY CALLS, QUESTIONS, QUERIES, OR COMPLAINTS. The very few times I got someone on the phone after hours of holding they said someone would call me and no one has. They have also given my account information to other users who were removed as authorized users years ago and they claim they were not.

_source.product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

I am writing to dispute a fraudulent charge on my Account Number XXXX with USAA I am a victim of identity theft, and I did not make this charge. I request that you remove the fraudulent charge and any related finance charges from my account. Please send me an updated and accurate statement. I also request that you stop reporting this inaccurate information and report the correct information to all the nationwide credit reporting companies ( CRCs ) to which you provided it. 
In accordance with Law 15 USC 1681B, the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) section 605B stipulates that it is unlawful to report information without my consent. Additionally, under USC 15 section 1681, there is an obligation to ensure accuracy, fairness, and privacy in the reporting of assembled personal information. 
Failure to remove negative items upon dispute may result in a liability of {$1000.00} per item, as outlined in 15 USC 1681n ( Civil Liability )

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Billing Disputes XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, DE XXXX Re : My AAdvantage Aviator Red World Elite XXXX credit card account ending in XXXX Case ID : XXXX Dear Sir or XXXX : Several weeks ago, I disputed three charges on my account from XXXX for {$120.00}, for {$55.00}, and for {$55.00}. 

Your dispute department first attempted to convince me that I should not bother disputing these charges with you, but instead should work on my own to address these unauthorized transactions with XXXX because the dispute process takes months. I insisted on disputing the charges with your team, after which the group reluctantly took a record of these disputes. 

Now I have received a letter stating that you require additional information, and when I called the number listed in your letter to provide it, the representative informed me that my claim is closed because I was not able to pick up two telephone calls from unknown numbers on XX/XX/23 and XX/XX/23. She stated that the only way my claim will be reopened is if I send a signed and dated letter stating that I did not receive any merchandise in connection with these transactions. She would not accept my personal statement to that effect. 

Let it be known : I did not receive any merchandise in connection with the above-referenced transactions, as I stated ( in a recorded call ) the very first time I filed these disputes. 

You can confirm the validity of this representation by the documentation Target provided to you in connection with the dispute, which clearly shows that this merchandise was ordered ( using my credit card ) by XXXX XXXX, of XXXX, who resides at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, NC XXXX. Again, you can find this information in your own records for the dispute I filed, as you have now mailed me copies of these same records clearly substantiating that I did not order nor receive these goods. 

Based on my experience with this claim, I must conclude that Barclays desires to dissuade cardholders from proceeding with even valid charge disputes, as this is by far the most difficult time I have ever had disputing a charge. Moreover, for you to hold records in your possession demonstrating that the charge is fraudulent and still refusing to refund the money unless I jump through various hoops mandates a careful review of your processes to avoid consumer abuse. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Delaware Attorney General, Consumer Division

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Hello, I am a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  in XXXX NC. I use XXXX ads to advertise my home listings. On XX/XX/year> my XXXX ads manager account was compromised. First they changed my daily spending limit to {$5000.00}. Then the fraudsters created a T Shirt ad for their product to sell. They attempted to charge my credit cards on file 125 times of which 34 transactions were charged for a total of {$21000.00} on XXXX different Mastercard 's that are on file in my XXXX ads manager account. One was a Barclays Mastercard account ending in XXXX and the other was a XXXX Mastercard ending in XXXX. There was also one charge to my XXXX account. Total charges were Barclays Mastercard- {$18000.00} XXXX Mastercard- {$3600.00} and XXXX- {$230.00}. XXXX and XXXX both deemed the charges fraudulent and refunded the charges back to my account. 

Barclays Mastercard refuses to refund {$18000.00}. There 5 internal investigations " determined that the charges were valid based on a previous purchase history with the merchant '' ( XXXX ). 

In the attachments I have emails from XXXX support who ran there own investigation and concluded that my account was compromised. XXXX also states in the email ... '' We've refunded all the fraudulent purchases back to the original source where the charges are taken out so you need to talk to your credit card provider '' XXXX only refunded 1 charge for {$170.00} back to the Barclays Mastercard account. 

After more than 14 months later neither Barclays nor XXXX has resolved this issue and refunded the fraudulent charges of {$17000.00}. I am making monthly payments on the Barclays card with very high interest rates, By paying the minimum amount it will take me 29 years for a total of {$55000.00}. 

Attached I am providing .... 

XXXX ) XXXX ( XXXX ) Charges that were paid by my credit cards. 
XXXX ) XXXX XXXX emails confirming my account was compromised and the charges would be refunded. 
XXXX ) Barclays 5 different investigations results letters. 
XXXX ) Police Report In conclusion .... I also know of 2 other people in my town who have had the exact same situation happen with XXXX and their credit card company. XXXX person who happens to be my boss was able to get the charges resolved through a complaint with the CFPB.
_source.issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I opened a BanK of America credit card earlier this year and I travelled XXXX  to engage in my normal lime of work as a XXXX  XXXX with a XXXX XXXX. During the travels, I used the Bank of America credit card several times, after which the card was frozen. 

I called Bank of America several times to get the freeze lifted which they could not do. Eventually the card was closed. 

Not wanting to damage my credit ( yet locked out of my account ) I paid the remaining balance of {$1300.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, and hoped all would be well. And it was, until Bank of America 's autopay also withdrew the very same final balance amount of {$1300.00} on XX/XX/XXXX from my checking account. 

Thus, my account was overpaid by {$1300.00}. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I was back in the North Carolina area and I visited a bank branch to verify my identity and sort out this situation. The manager promised that my {$1300.00} would be returned within 10-14 days.

That did not happen, and since then I have been calling Bank of America representatives weekly to try to troubleshoot the situation. Some say I should just be patient. Others say there is still a fraud alert on my ( closed ) account and perhaps that is why the cash is not being returned. 

Every company representative I call - about 10 so far - has promised to help and vows to get the money returned to me in 10-14 days. Yet nearly 2 months later I am unable to find anybody capable enough of resolving this situation.
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Bank of America disclosed my credit card information to XXXX without authorization. I do have a relationship with XXXX but I am not contractually obligated to XXXX. As a result of an unrelated fraud event, my credit card was replaced. 

XXXX attempted a charge and the charge was declined. Subsequently, Bank of America provided the correct credit card information to XXXX and they charged my account. 

Bank of America is pointing to the terms and conditions as reason for the unauthorized disclosure. However, I am not contractually obligated to XXXX and there is no agreement for continued services.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Bank of America did not close my account after explicitly instructing them to close it. Instead they locked my account and now I can not pay my credit card through them with my other linked checking accounts. Calling to resolve this took over an hr on the phone and multiple transfers with few clear answers. 
The bank charged monthly service fees after my account switched from a student account. Due to my busy schedule I did not have time to close the account. Because of this Bank of America would only refund one month 's fee. I asked them to close the account and leave the - {$12.00} dollar balance as is. I was told this wouldn't be an issue and would only need to pay the amount if I tried to open a new checking account. My biggest issue the bank not closing my account after being instructed to. Padding their account numbers falsely.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
My name is XXXX XXXX I applied for the Barclays XXXX XXXX XXXX credit card. 
I got approved XX/XX/XXXX. When I receive my card, I activated it and I begin to use it. The first time I used it, it got declined. It told me to call so I called. They wanted to verify it was me. I passed a verification. The card was good to go. I use the card. XXXX got approved that same day. I used it again the same thing happened. I had to call, they wanted to verify my identity again I did that transaction Got approved so the next day, which was XX/XX/XXXX I used it again. Everything was good then I used it on XX/XX/XXXX for a cash advance. I took XXXX out the ATM I want it XXXX but the ATM only did XXXX at a time so I did another XXXX it got declined. So then I had called and they told me I needed documents to unrestricted my account so I faxed over documents around XX/XX/XXXX. I called on the XXXX. They said my documents were blurry But my utility bill or bank statement was approved and readable and they told me all I needed to do was resend my Social Security card and my drivers license then I submitted more documents. They receive them on XX/XX/XXXX I called a couple days later they said they were still on the review and I asked, a account specialist if they could verify that my documents were clear and they said yes they are readable so you should be good to go, but we are not the department that verifies them. The next couple days I was calling I was getting hung up on Representatives were telling me different things that I was notified that my account was at the highest level of security and they couldnt tell me why they told me it takes 7 to 10 business days to approve my documents or review them But I decided to send documents by mail also just to be on the safe side so they couldnt say that it was blurry again so then Around XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX I was told that my documents were approved Buy two different departments, but the highest level of security department a representative name XXXX  believe said I needed a Utility bill or bank statement because I only sent my ID or drivers license and my Social Security card. But XXXX said that my ID and Social Security card were approved I informed the lady that the utility bill document have already gotten approved at the end of XXXX. Also XXXX  informed me that no theres a note here that says you sent a credit card statement as the proof of address I said maam, that is my first time hearing this, I said, can you double check the notes and look further and she said OK so she put me on hold for about five minutes then she comes back and she says she found the bank statement that I sent that had gotten approved already so Im getting excited thinking that theyre about to remove the restriction so then Im going to resubmit all your documents back for a second review call back Monday. See if everything got approved already. She really had no explanation so I said you know what I just called back Monday So I decided to call back later that day to see if someone else give me a different answer so I called back a lady name A lady named XXXX answered the phone and she basically says your documents are still under review. They never been approved. I said maam I called earlier they told me that they were approved. She said so why didnt they remove the restriction? I said maam I do not know thats what XXXX trying to find out, she she hung the phone up on me and she was rude. Also, this isnt the first time that XXXX hung the phone up on me. I also filed a complain about her. So I called back a third time to get another answer the same day another representative said basically your documents had been submitted for a second review so now this is going on 30 days I submitted documents and I keep getting the same answer refusing to remove my restriction off my card, I havent use my card since XX/XX/XXXX. Mind you my my account was already good to go around XX/XX/XXXX or the XXXX because different departments told me everything looked good. I just need it for a certain department to remove the restriction so I requested for this to get escalated because this is really out of hand and unprofessional for all the lies that they keep telling me about my account I dont know what it is, but I did everything they asked me to do, so I have this credit card on my credit report that I cant even use and they block me for access to my online account so I cant see anything thats going on so something needs to happen because I cant even get in touch with a manager because they dont take inbound calls I requested for several callbacks. They did call me back once or twice left voicemail, but I was unavailable to answer at the time I dont know whats going on with this detention department or security department that they have but theyre doing whatever they want to do and its not fair and every time a representative read the notes on my account. They treat me differently because of what they read I dont know what they put in my notes, but it has to be something unprofessional and for them to treat me a different type of way when I call because every time they read the notes, they hang the phone up on me or they tell me that my documents are still under review 10 business days is it the 30th business day and theyre still under review

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX I wrote a check for {$19000.00} to XXXX XXXX using an account with XXXX XXXX. Several days later XXXX XXXX contacted us and said their bank, Bank of America, said the check was no good and had been returned. I checked the account balance to verify funds and then contacted XXXX to ask why they returned the check. XXXX checked account and said no check had been received, there was nothing in our account that showed a returned check or that any check had been received. 

I contacted XXXX XXXX who verified BOA stated the check was bad. We explained the check had never been sent to XXXX by BOA. XXXX  XXXX then stated BOA said it was and invalid check. I contacted BOA and they confirmed it was an invalid check and they hadn't processed it because it was no good. 

I got certified check for XXXX XXXX but this was very embarrassing and I still have no idea why BOA determined the check was invalid.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NC XXXX XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau- cfpd Subject : Dispute of Credit Report Error Dear Sir/Madam , I am writing to dispute an error I found on my XXXX credit report formally. Please, address the following incorrect information. 

The information I am disputing is as follows : Account Name : Barclays Bank Delaware Account Number : XXXX Description of Error : validate fair credit reporting act In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act, the creditor has violated my rights under 15.USC.1681, section 602 - states I have the right to privacy. 
And, 15 USC 1681, section 604a section 2- states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions. 
Also, 15.USCS.1666b- a creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open or closed consumer plan as late for any purpose. 

This information is inaccurate because this account is closed. The continued reporting on my credit report validates my consumer rights. I kindly request that you investigate the matter and correct the error as soon as possible. 

I would appreciate written confirmation once this error has been corrected. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NC XXXX
_source.issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
_source.sub_issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report

_source.complaint_what_happened:
My information was sold and bought illegally because I was a victim of the + XXXX-data breach. I want these items Deleted from my credit reports effective immediately. I am attaching proof that XXXX has admitted that! was in fact a victim of this data breach. 
According to 15 USC 1681e ( b ) it states this ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 
So I then asked them to provide me a description of the investigation according to 15 USC 1681 ( 7 ) : ( 7 ) Description of reinvestigation procedure A consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer a description referred to in paragraph ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) by not later than 15 days after receiving a request from the consumer for that description. 
But they did not do that as well either. 

They are also breaking these laws as well below : According to 15 USC 1681 ( 5 ) it states this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 
According to 15 USC 1681s-2 it states this. ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 
( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( i ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate.
_source.issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
_source.company_public_response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
_source.sub_issue: Debt was result of identity theft

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Received an email invitation to open account with First Progress card, Synovus Bank. Filled out application for what was " advertised '' as a credit card. Deposit of {$200.00} was required which I paid. When I received the card, the only " credit '' I had available was the {$200.00} I paid less a {$49.00} membership fee. Effectively, I was sent a " debit '' card, NOT a credit card so it was false advertising from the start. I did use the card but was only able to use it once for a lyft ride and then several times at XXXX, a local grocery chain. Other locations didn't recognize the card at all. 
Since it was effectively my money, I don't understand why I am being charged interest and late fees upwards of {$150.00}. The card was cancelled in XXXX of this year. I have a " supposed '' credit balance of {$43.00} on the card which the company refuses to refund. I have no intention of paying these late fees and interest as I know I have been misled, and taken advantage of from the very beginning. I expect to have this debt of {$150.00} stricken and removed from my credit report. This was a card billed as a way to help build my credit rating, not damage it. I think the whole thing is a sham.
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

_source.complaint_what_happened: I opened a 10 month promotional CD account with Marcus Goldman-Sachs on XX/XX/XXXX to be closed on XX/XX/XXXX. The routing information to return the funds ( over XXXX ) was incorrect as it was for wiring and Marcus sent it as an ACH deposit ( not clearly mentioned on site I believe ). The funds were rejected by XXXX ( my savings account ) and sent back to Marcus. Since then, I have had much trouble with getting my money back. I spoke to their specialists several times and provided the correct ACH routing number each time as advised by XXXX, but the funds are always sent via a different routing ( wire ) number than what I provided. I even deleted my external link on the account before and corrected it on my end but the money keeps getting bounced back into their CD account. It is XX/XX/XXXX today, and I called XXXX who again states that Marcus has incorrectly sent the funds via wire routing number instead of ACH routing number I have already provided many times. I am appalled that my money is being held hostage by Marcus Goldman-Sachs almost 3 weeks after it was supposed to be returned to me. This almost seems criminal given that no one has been able to resolve the issue and my money is still not deposited into my bank account. Very unacceptable.
_source.sub_issue: Funds not received from closed account

me, and I have not granted permission for XXXX to access my credit information. Additionally, I want to explicitly state that I have not given the XXXX XXXX permission to furnish negative information to my credit report. 

I must bring to your attention that the inclusion of unauthorized inquiries and negative information constitutes a serious breach of my privacy rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically under Section 1681b ( c ). FCRA Section 1681b ( c ) prohibits obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or without a permissible purpose, and its violation constitutes fraudulent activity. This is not only a breach of statutory obligations but also a serious infringement on my privacy rights. 

As part of the investigation into the validity of these inquiries, I demand that you, XXXX XXXX, produce a contract between us, the consumer, BEARING my signature. This contract should clearly show that I gave explicit permission for you to furnish any information on my behalf. In the absence of any such documentation bearing my signature, I formally request that these fraudulent inquiries be immediately deleted from the credit file you maintain under my social security number. 

If, after your investigation, you find that these inquiries are indeed unauthorized and fraudulent and that negative information was furnished without my permission, I request their immediate removal from my credit report to ensure the accuracy and integrity of my credit history. 


I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and request that you provide a written response within the 30-day period as required by the FCRA. If the investigation determines that these inquiries are indeed unauthorized and fraudulent and that negative information was furnished without my permission, I expect their removal and an updated credit report to be sent to me. 

Thank you for your cooperation in resolving this matter. If you require any additional information, please do not hesitate to contact me through email XXXX Thank You XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX/ Agent, Beneficiary Without Prejudice All Natural Inalienable Rights Reserved

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I initiated a dispute with ASPEN NATIONAL COLLECTION to request verification and cessation of all collection and reporting activities until the debt 's validity is confirmed. However, to date, I have not received any correspondence from them. 

In addition to the verification request, I also highlighted several inaccuracies within the account, which I believe constitute a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, wherein the furnisher of information is obligated to report accurate information to ensure FCRA compliance .

Among the inaccuracies are the absence of information from XXXX and XXXX, as well as a lack of details from XXXX, including monthly payments, number of months, credit limit, past due amounts, and payment history. These inaccuracies and incomplete information are crucial in disputing the validity of the account. 

Most significantly, I did not receive any notice from ASPEN NATIONAL COLLECTION within five days of allegedly receiving this account. This lack of notice prompted me to file a complaint, as I am unaware of this debt and did not receive proper notification. _source.complaint_what_happened:
Around XXXX on XX/XX/year>, I received a call from XXXX, which is typically USAA bank number. When I answered the man over phone asked me if I could verify a charge on my account, and I said that I do not verify the charge. He then said that because of the charge he would have to give me a whole new account number for both my checking AND savings. He asked me to verify my identity through a text link ( which USAA normally does ), and when I did he then had access to my account where he had moved all the money over himself. I never told him any of my information over the phone. 

The man over phone said that I would need to wait XXXX business days before I could have access to my funds again. I said that I can not do this, because rent is due soon. He then said that I could go to a local XXXX bank and he could walk me through the steps of taking money out of my account, to move over into another account. He said that USAA is affiliated with XXXX Bank, and that the bank will let me open a new joint account through them. He gave me a virtual debit card over the phone to enter in my XXXX wallet. I was afraid that if I did not comply I would loose access to my account with my bank, or that the bank would shut down my account. 

While the man was on the phone with me, he told me to do a cash advance of {$10000.00} ( though I only had {$6500.00} in my savings ) and that he would initiate this amount from my all my accounts, to my checking. I went to the teller at XXXX bank and entered my Debit card to their card reader. Then he told me to enter that {$10000.00} cash through the XXXX bank ATM using the XXXX card on the mobile wallet. After multiple tries, the ATM took the {$10000.00}. Throughout the process asked him if I could just do this through the counter and he said " no ''. 

After the {$10000.00} was entered, the XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) came over to me asking me what was going on and I told her. She said that XXXX is not affiliated with USAA bank, and that I was being scammed. I did not know how to feel, because this scammer did everything a normal USAA agent would do and I trusted that this was a real person with the bank, I immediately hung up and called the bank itself. I only found out on the night of XX/XX/XXXX, that the scammer had taken over my account and opened a new checking under my name. I filed a complaint with my state government the afternoon of XX/XX/XXXX. 

The morning of XX/XX/XXXX, I saw that the scammer tried to take out {$5000.00} from my other bank, XXXX XXXX Bank ( that I connected to USAA years ago ). This put that checking account in the negatives. I called XXXX and fortunately they said the XXXX charge would be dropped the next day, and it was. This {$5000.00} is what the scammer tried to put with my savings, to get the {$10000.00}. He could not see how much was in my XXXX bank, through my USAA because that joint link had not been updated in months. I filed a fraud claim with both USAA and XXXX bank on XX/XX/XXXX.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I tried to make a transfer from my Marcus account to another bank that was offering a higher APY. Marcus locked my account when I initiated this transfer. I called to find out the issue and kept being hung up on. I finally spoke to a supervisor, and they said they would send me an affidavit to verify my identity. I received the affidavit two weeks later and got it notarized virtually using an app called XXXX that charged {$25.00} for a virtual service. I could not physically make it into a store to notarize because my husband works and uses the car, plus I have XXXX babies to take care of. After I got the affidavit notarized, I paid {$30.00} for certified mail so they could receive it the next day. My tracking receipt shows they received the form on XX/XX/2023. 
When I called to confirm, they said it was under review and would take seven business days to review. I called back on XX/XX/2023, and was on hold for three hours. Then the representative said it was notarized by someone in Texas and needed to be done in North Carolina, where I reside. I told her I paid {$25.00} for a virtual video service to get this done. Hence, people work from virtually anywhere to help get documents notarized asap if they can not physically make it to a location. She said they would be sending out another form so it could be done in NC. I then asked to close my account. After all, I am no longer interested in banking with a bank holding my money hostage for over a month, all because I wanted to transfer some of my funds. She said she would send a code to the phone number I have on file to close the account. The code never came, and she asked if I had an alternate number. I told her I only use one number on my account and have not had issues using this number in the past for my account. She put me on hold for another hour and said my account was in review to be closed, but I will need to call back for updates. This has been the worst banking experience I have ever encountered, and I would like to close this account asap. They are holding onto my money and will not let me access or close my account.

i have had a Checking and Savings Account with USAA Bank for over 10 years without any negative or overdraft in either of those accounts since opening. My checking account been at a XXXX balance since the the end of XX/XX/2024 with no current activities in four months. this account checking was being used primarily for when the VA pays XXXXXXXX XXXX this is the account they uses for electronic payments and I also had my XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX account linked to this USAA Bank account where i sometimes transfer funds. I checked my USAA account in XX/XX/2024 to see have a VA Electronic Payment had reached my account and found that my Checking Account had been involuntary closed without my knowledge. At this time I called a bank representative to see why my account was closed. He informed me that a letter was sent out after 45 days with no activities that the account would be closed in 30 days if the account have not been used and information was posted on my app that the account would be closed. I told him i haven't used the app but I haven't received a letter from USAA as notice of my account would close on XX/XX/2024. He looked back to verify the time the letter was sent out and found that the only documentation that was noted was on XX/XX/2024 when they closed my account. Not sure how a bank can take such drastic step to close a consumer account without any written notice in short time frame. As i stated i last used my account at the end of XX/XX/2024 so I'm not sure what was the urgent need to close my account without any written notification. I've submitted several complaints concerning unfair treatment while banking with USAA Banking and Insurance. it seems as if they single certain consumers out an harass them to stop banking with USAA. I've also seen where they discriminates with unfair loan practices.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I opened my Apple Wallet, which displayed XXXX due today, and submitted a split payment for my Apple Card between Apple Cash for XXXX and my bank account for XXXX. Approximately 2 hours later, I received a notification that my payment for the full original amount was processed, and upon opening Apple Wallet, a payment for the full amount was displayed as occurring 1 hour before my payment that had not been displayed previously. 

The automatic bank payment could not be canceled, but I was able to cancel the smaller second payment. The Apple Cash payment, however, was not visibly applied to my balance, even though I expected to see a positive balance of XXXX. 

Upon contacting Goldman Sachs support, I was informed that my Apple Cash payment was applied to the final installments in my installment series, and that a refund could not be issued. This may be a violation of 1026.11 ( which requires refunds of positive balances within 7 days ), and is a violation of the Credit Card Accountability, Responsibility, and Disclosure Act of 2009 ( CARD act ), specifically the requirements to apply payments to the highest interest balance first. 

I assert that the last-due installment payments ( approx 16 months at 0 % interest ) are a lower interest balance than the first-due installment payments ( less than 30 days before due ), as no rational customer would ever pay off a later-due installment when they could pay off a sooner-due installment, as one can always pay off a later-due installment at an earlier date, but can not pay off an earlier-due installment at a later date. Therefore, Goldman Sachs is in violation of the CARD act for failing to apply my payments above the minimum in the most consumer-friendly-fashion ( choosing to apply them to the lowest interest balances that I would never rationally pay first ) In addition, installment plans can reasonably be considered a separate " account '', as they can be paid off individually and are added in discrete units to the revolving credit account. Therefore, Goldman Sachs should not automatically apply payments to installments, and should hold them as a credit balance on the account to apply against the next payments, or to allow for a refund.
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

When I owe them money the funds are immediately withdrawn. I asked them to expedite the process since I was experiencing a hardship. They refused to accommodate my request. 
This blatantly unfair to me the consumer. I suspect they are playing games with my money and holding on to it so they can make more money. It simply is not in their interest to promptly do a refund.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act XXXX XXXX XXXX Sec XXXX - " there is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality and a respect for the consumers right to privacy '' XXXX and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies and I am the Consumer. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is backed by 15USC 6801 which states " It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the customers nonpublic personal information. GOLDMAN SACHS BANK is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " in general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. GOLDMAN SACHS BANK the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to XXXX, XXXX, GOLDMAN SACHS BANK whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked.

15 USC 6802 states that a financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless- the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise the non-disclosure option. GOLDMAN SACHS BANK never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 5 ) states " except as authorized under subsection ( b ) no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information.

Any other adverse item of this information, other than records convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law.

15 US Code 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) States " a person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has any reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 15US Code 1681 states " every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title '' XXXX and XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures.

Also, 12CFR 1016.7 states " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I am opting out of your reporting services.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I, XXXX XXXX XXXX, am writing to file a formal complaint against the three major credit reporting agencies : XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. This complaint is in regard to multiple violations of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), particularly concerning the privacy and accuracy of my credit information.

Violations Include :. Privacy Rights Violation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681, Section 602 ) : All three agencies have mishandled my personal and financial information, compromising my right to privacy as protected under the FCRA.

. Unauthorized Distribution of Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b, Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) ) : XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX have all furnished information about my account without receiving my explicit written consent, a direct contravention of the FCRA mandates. 

. Incorrect Late Payment Reporting ( 15 U.S.C. 1666b ) : Despite my diligence in making timely payments, the reporting agencies have inaccurately reported late payments on my credit profile, which is misleading and damaging to my credit standing. 

These actions by XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX not only violate specific provisions of the FCRA but also inflict undue harm on my credit reputation and overall financial well-being. 


I expect a prompt and thorough resolution to this matter and request to be kept informed of the progress. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to these serious concerns. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX
_source.sub_issue: Reporting company used your report improperly

I was told that only the information I provided regarding my income and housing payment would be asked, and I assumed it was a factor for deciding the credit limit. I was denied an increase immediately and have not received any disclosure as to why. I have sent a letter asking for an increase of {$10000.00} for my credit limit as I know that Discover is able to do so with the access they have under federal law. I have been discouraged from applying for another card or another increase with Discover because of the events that have taken place.

_source.complaint_what_happened: I am writing to formally request a thorough investigation into the discrepancies and verification presented in the recent communication regarding an account allegedly opened in my name. I have serious concerns about the accuracy and legitimacy of the information provided, and I believe it is necessary to ensure compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and North Carolina credit laws. Upon reviewing the statement received from Discover, I have identified several discrepancies regarding the addresses and phone numbers associated with the account. I would like to clarify that I have no knowledge of the mentioned addresses, nor have I ever resided at or received mail at these locations. Furthermore, the phone numbers listed as verification are unfamiliar to me, and I have no record of ownership or usage of these numbers. In light of the discrepancies mentioned above, I also wish to address the statute of limitations for debt collection in North Carolina. As per North Carolina credit laws, the statute of limitations for most types of debt is three years. It is crucial to determine whether the statute of limitations has expired in this case, as it may affect the creditor 's ability to pursue legal action to enforce the debt. I request that you thoroughly review the relevant dates and account history to assess compliance with the statute of limitations. In accordance with the FCRA and North Carolina credit laws, I kindly request that you initiate a comprehensive investigation into the validity and accuracy of the information provided by Discover. This investigation should include verification of the aforementioned addresses, phone numbers, and any other associated details. I also request that you obtain and review any supporting documentation provided by Discover, such as written documents or records, to substantiate their claims. Furthermore, I kindly request that Discover provides me with a detailed report of the investigation 's findings within the statutory timeframe of 30 days, as outlined by the FCRA, which they have yet to do. Additionally, I would appreciate their assistance in clarifying how their actions, as outlined in their communication, comply with the requirements of North Carolina credit laws, including the options for repayment assistance directly through Discover and not a third party. I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and your commitment to upholding the provisions of the FCRA and North Carolina credit laws. Thank you for your assistance in resolving this matter. I look forward to your prompt response.
_source.issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

_source.complaint_what_happened: I live in XXXX XXXX XXXX  for a short period of time. The unit I had was infested with bugs. Myself along with the property manager agreed that it was best for me to move out. The property manager at the time waived all fees. They said I was good to go because I had a guarantor called XXXX XXXX where I paid a double deposit. They have now sent this balance to a collection agency that threatened to sue me for a balance thats older than three years old. I want this balance closed out and this collection removed from my credit report. This balance has prevented me from being able to get an apartment or purchase a house. This company is now illegally threatening to sue me when I can not be sued because I am a nc resident. XXXX XXXX needs to remove these charges because they agreed to allow me to break the lease. XXXX made an agreement and this should be waived I dont owe anything the unit was not livable.

I resided at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, for a XXXX period while employed as an XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Throughout my tenancy, I consistently fulfilled my rent obligations ahead of schedule without default. Unfortunately, upon the abrupt termination of my XXXX XXXX  in XXXXXXXX XXXX, I promptly notified the apartment management of my circumstances. To my surprise, I was informed that I had XXXX  days to vacate the premises due to my inability to maintain payment, citing it as a legal requirement. I was never informed of any lease-breaking fees associated with my situation. 

Subsequently, I vacated the apartment within the stipulated timeframe, only to receive a demand for payment months later. Despite my attempts to seek clarification from the management office, I received no response. Instead, I was contacted by a collection agency, which aggressively pursued payment, threatening adverse effects on my record and XXXX XXXX. Despite explaining the circumstances surrounding my departure, the collector remained obstinate and unyielding. 

Furthermore, the amount demanded, totaling {$4400.00} for XXXX months ' rent, is both inflated and dubious. Despite my efforts to dispute this unjust claim and rectify the situation, it persists as a blemish on my credit report. 

Given the protracted nature of this ordeal, I respectfully request your intervention in resolving this matter. Your assistance in addressing this unjust situation would be greatly appreciated. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

_source.complaint_what_happened: I was affected by covid and lost my employment. I was not able to pay my mortgage and reached out to the XXXX  for assistance in XX/XX/2022. The XXXX has reached out to XXXX XXXX ( my mortgage holder ) over 6 times via their portal. And XXXX XXXX has refused to respond. When I call XXXX XXXX they keep hanging up on me or when I am able to get someone they say they are trying to collect a debt when I ask about anyone reaching out to them they say they don't see it in the system and the XXXX person that works those cases in the portal has not received it. I am trying to keep my home I have nowhere to go with my children that is safe and that I can afford. I have a great job now that pays me well. I can more than afford my mortgage. But it is like they are trying to take my home. Please help me.

Check stolen in the mail. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an invoice with a late notice for over 60 days. I wrote the check to the law firm XXXX XXXX XXXX for {$1200.00} and noted in the memo line the invoice # XXXX and the attorneys name, XXXX XXXX, and I put it in the mail to send on XX/XX/XXXX. In XXXX, I received a call from the law firm asking me to check my account to see if my check cleared because they never received my payment but also that XXXX XXXX was a new attorney with the firm and due to that and the holidays the check may not have been attached to the invoice. I did check my account and it showed the check cleared. I never heard any further issue until I received the late invoice on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I contacted my CPA and got a copy of the cleared check and sent to the law firm. They made inquires within the firm about the specific endorsement on the cleared check and they learned no one by the name XXXX XXXX has ever worked at the firm. I immediately alerted my bank, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ). XXXX XXXX gave me an Affidavit of Forgery and told me the specific endorsement is clearly fraudulent on its face. She also learned the stolen check was processed by Bank of America in XXXX, VA. Bank of America refused to provide any further details without a subpoena. I have no way of suing the thief nor filing a police report bc I have no information about where the check was presented. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is insured by XXXX. Bank of America is insured by FDIC.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
A fake company made three charges across three of my credit cards, totaling {$2200.00}. A {$500.00} charge went to my Discover card. I have attempted to resolve this many times with Discover, over the period of a year and a half at this point. Discover first told me to contact the merchant ; however, since it is a fake merchant, the website, emails, and phone numbers have all been disconnected, and the address given is a vacant office ( I have spoken to the realtor leasing it, who confirmed the fake company are scammers and not the company they pretended to be ). No services were offered, rendered, or completed, and the fake merchant said that " services can be canceled for a refund. '' So even though no services were rendered I asked for a refund. The other two cards had the competence to cancel these fake charges yet Discover keeps putting it back onto my card. 
Not only does it keep reappearing on my card, now it is accumulating late fees and interest, even though the amount is larger than my balance, which I paid for all actual charges. So now Discover owes me money - I stopped using this account when I was unsatisfied with the lack of customer service. I have submitted documentation that has not been reviewed and I have called over twenty times over the last several months since XXXX- each time someone tells me they need to put me on hold to review my information, then either disconnects the call or transfers me to someone else who seems to have no idea what's going on and wants to start over. Today alone I have been on the phone for more than two and a half hours without any resolution as they keep saying someone will call me back but never does. 
This is shameful that a company can operate like this and put people 's perfect credit scores in jeopardy. 
Lastly, there are no authorized users on my account and have not been for several years, but Discover keeps emailing my account information to a former authorized user who should have no access to my credit info or account info whatsoever yet has access to my balances and everything. This is a very serious breach of privacy and security. 
Please fix this as I will never pay for a fraudulent charge. 
I used to use this card a lot for points but in the past two years I have had THREE FAKE CHARGES on my account and Discover has not fixed any of them. This is absolutely disgraceful.
_source.issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

_source.complaint_what_happened: Auto lease was purchased by BMO from Bank of the West. They couldnt locate our account and said they would look into this and have someone get back to me, even asking if Im sure the account is with BMO. This was in XXXX. My last payment to Bank of the West was XXXX. After a couple weeks at no return call from BMO, I reached out again. I got the same response from customer service and again, waiting for someone to call me back. Another couple weeks go by and now we need to escalate this because we dont want any dings on our credit. This time I called several different numbers with BMO and asked for higher ups to help get us some answers and was referred to the collections department who was able to locate our account but why was it in Collections? After speaking a few times with someone the collections department we finally got a PO to mail an actual check to, since BMO is not set up to service lease accounts and we couldnt make our payments online or over the phone. So we started sending checks but continued to ask that the situation with our account get fixed as we had no way to track our account or even follow up to verify our payments were being credited, properly. After many unanswered attempts to contact the only person in the company that seemed to be able to find our account ( the COLLECTIONS department ), I was frustrated that our calls and emails were not being answered any more and no way to track our payments and our credit scores have both plummeted. I am running out of room to continue this but the summary is. Our payments were not credited. Our account has been charged off and sent to recovery. Credit scores lost over XXXX points. Still not resolved.

Here are the key details : Collection Agency : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Original Creditor : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Date Assigned : XX/XX/2023 Original Amount Owed : {$23.00} Status : UNPAID Creditor Classification : Rental or Leasing Date of First Delinquency : XX/XX/2023 This debt is not valid. I have never been notified of this alleged debt, and I have confirmation from the original creditor, XXXX XXXX  XXXX, that I do not owe them anything. I am concerned about this incorrect reporting as it has negatively impacted my credit score. 

I am currently in the process of buying a house, and the appearance of this invalid debt on my credit report is causing significant issues with my mortgage application. It is critical that this matter be resolved swiftly to correct my credit report. 

Enclosed with this letter is an email from XXXX XXXX XXXX confirming that I do not owe any debt, plus the rental lease I signed for your records. I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and ensure the removal of this incorrect debt from all credit report bureaus.
_source.issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

_source.complaint_what_happened:
BMO took my deposits and charged me a fee, refused to pay my bill, and is preventing me from using my funds. 

I opened a BMO checking account on XX/XX/year>. On XX/XX/year>, I made my initial deposit of {$18000.00} followed by deposits of {$68000.00} for a total of {$86000.00}. BMO showed that the funds were available for an important upcoming bill payment. 

On XX/XX/year>, I signed up for BMO XXXX XXXX. On XX/XX/year> I added my payee for that important bill and, using BMO XXXX XXXX, paid that bill on XX/XX/year>. I was charged an expedited payment fee of {$15.00}. The check was made and overnighted to the payee and delivered on XX/XX/year>. 

On XX/XX/year>, BMO did not honor the check that they created through their XXXX XXXX service. In effect, XXXX XXXX suspected themselves of fraud. Again, they created the check they returned. Without notice to me, after returning the check, BMO restricted my funds leaving me with no access to my deposited funds which resulted in an inability to pay an important bill and reputational damage. I may lose the contracted services and pay a penalty due to BMOs actions. 

Upon my inquiry, I was told of the restriction and asked to submit additional verification documents, which I did immediately. Upon my further inquiry, I was told it could take up to 30 days to review my account and I had no other options. BMO has never initiated any communication and seemingly has no desire to allow me access to my funds. 

After my request for escalation or expedited review of my identity documents, BMO refused to help and is holding my funds, paying no interest, and causing me financial and reputational harm with seemingly little care. To add insult to injury, they also refused to refund the expedited payment fee for the check they both created and returned. 

It seems very deceptive to advertise and incent account opening and XXXX XXXX sign-up to gain deposits and then prevent use of those deposits. There seems to be very little recourse to gain access to those funds and be made whole.
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

_source.complaint_what_happened:
XX/XX/XXXX - I received email from Bank of America that I had messages to review. When I logged in and opened them, it had to do with insufficient funds. But there was over $ XXXX in the account. 

When I called in, I was told the account was on " hold '' due to an ACH transaction I had initiated with another already-verified institution that I was told could not be " verified ''. I was told the " hold '' began on XX/XX/XXXX. After several conversations with the Fraud department at BofA, I was told the only resolution was to bring a copy of my bank statement from the other financial institution showing I owned the account. 

WHY WAS I NOT CONTACTED DIRECTLY BY THE BANK?? INSTEAD, I HAD TO CALL THEM. 

XX/XX/XXXX - I worked with a banker ( XXXX XXXX at the local BofA branch to accept the statements and he made copies while I was there and I was told it should take XXXX hours for the " hold '' to clear. 

XX/XX/XXXX - I called BofA Fraud department and was told the " hold '' was still in place. 

XX/XX/XXXX - I called BofA Fraud department and was told the " hold '' was still in place. After asking for escalation I was then informed that no one received the paperwork and was told I would need to revisit a branch and provide the forms again. 

XX/XX/XXXX - I visited a branch and again provided the statements that were asked for. I was told that as long as the information looked correct, that I should expect my " hold '' to be removed by the end of the day. 

XX/XX/XXXX - I again called BofA Fraud department and after escalating to a manager was told that they could legally have a " hold '' on my account for up to 30 days while they go through the verification process.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I am writing to lodge a formal complaint against Bank of America regarding an incident that has caused severe inconvenience and financial hardship. As a valued client of Bank of America for the past 20 years, I am disheartened by the treatment I have received in light of this situation. 

In XXXX, my Bank of America account experienced a sudden and unexpected reversal of funds from a claim that was filed in XXXX of the same year. This reversal led to my account balance being deemed insufficient, which has had significant repercussions on my financial stability. 

I wish to highlight that over the course of my two-decade relationship with Bank of America , I have filed only three claims, reflecting my responsible and diligent use of their services. Despite this long-standing association and my infrequent need for claims, the bank 's decision to reverse the credited funds in XXXX came as an unexpected blow. 

The claim in question was related to transactions made with an online casino, whose information was stored in my memory and also conveniently saved in the credit card details on my phone app 's wallet. As an experienced and loyal customer, I believed that Bank of America 's robust security measures would safeguard against unauthorized transactions. Moreover, I had taken measures to protect my credit card information through secure means. 

Given my extensive tenure with Bank of America, I genuinely expected a more proactive and supportive approach from the bank in handling this matter. The reversal of the funds has caused me immense stress and financial strain, as it left my account in an insufficient state, resulting in additional charges and fees. 

I urge the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to intervene in this matter and ensure that Bank of America thoroughly investigates the circumstances surrounding the reversal of funds from my account. Additionally, I seek fair compensation for the distress caused, as well as reimbursement for any associated fees or penalties incurred due to the insufficient account balance. 

I trust that the CFPB will address this complaint with the utmost diligence and attention it deserves. As a long-standing client of Bank of America , I hope to see a resolution that not only rectifies the immediate situation but also reinforces my faith in the bank 's commitment to customer satisfaction.
_source.issue: Problem caused by your funds being low

XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX or XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. The balance of {$1000.00}. The account was opened in XX/XX/XXXX. The account was opened fraudulently. I have completed the following steps to resolve the account with the account : First, I contacted the creditor without success. After being unsuccessful in contacting the original creditor. I have also disputed it several times with the credit bureau due to it being fraudulent during a pandemic. 
- The original credit bureau was contacted on - XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX- The credit bureaus have been contacted on - XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX At this time, I have been unsuccessful in getting the fraudulent account removed from my report. I am reaching out to obtain assistance with getting the account removed from my credit reports. 

Discover Card reported a late payment which is also incorrect. I have had this account for several years, and have never been late with a payment. The payment was incorrectly reported, because of an issue with the website. I have attempted to have the situation corrected by contacting the creditor by phone in XX/XX/XXXX. I have also contacted the credit bureau without success via phone in XX/XX/XXXX and by letter.

I purchased an XXXX on XXXX online store using Apple Card. Total amount {$1000.00}, with a trade-in worth {$400.00} I was only charged {$690.00} plus taxes. 

Soon I returned the device and cancelled the trade-in, XXXX refunded me, on my card showing they refunded me {$690.00} plus taxes, still fine at this point. I asked them why they said they refunded me {$1000.00} plus taxes, not {$690.00} plus taxes on the date of return. Dispute was rejected and they are still overcharging me at the moment.

REQUEST FOR ACCOUNTING! 
U.C.C. 9 210 and other applicable laws. 




Reference accounts # XXXX Dear Bank of America CFO This communication is with reference to the alleged contractual relationship, I have a right to an authenticated record of accounting. I am not requesting a statement of account, for an authenticated record of the accounting. _source.complaint_what_happened: I was tricked into thinking I was sending {$2500.00} to my friend but his account was hacked. I thought I was talking to my friend but it was the scammer. I was trying to buy his used car but it was a scam thru XXXX. I filed a police report and 2 inquiries with PNC Bank and they wont return my money or cancel the transfer to the fraudster. Its all I have and I was tricked.

I located a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX through XXXX by the name of XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ; telephone number XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX ; and email XXXX. I received a reference and decided to move forward with the purchase. 

On XX/XX/2024, I signed a dog deposit contract that required {$400.00} deposit and {$200.00} for transportation, I have the signed Dog Deposit Contract dated XX/XX/2024 and the Bill of Sale dated XX/XX/2024. The payments were made through XXXX XXXX with my Bank of America XXXX XXXX. There were XXXX payments sent via XXXX XXXX to phone number ( XXXX ) XXXX ( see below ) : XXXX : {$1.00} ( test to make sure payment was accepted ) XXXX : {$390.00} XXXX : {$200.00} The XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX  was supposed to be delivered on XXXX, XX/XX/2024. The puppy  was never delivered and I attempted to contact the breeders. The XXXX site, the private message with the breeder and the reference individual ; and the phone numbers were all disconnected. 

I filed XXXX dispute claims with Bank of America on XX/XX/2024. They paid the {$1.00} transaction however they said they are unable to pay the {$390.00} and the {$200.00} transactions because XXXX XXXX is a third party who's responsible for transferring the money from your account to the recipient.They recommend I contact the recipient directly for further assistance with my dispute. I provided Bank of America with copies of the contracts and informed them these individuals were fraudsters so I am not able to contact them to obtain a refund or my money back. 

Under Regulation E, it is my understanding that XXXX XXXX transactions made with a financial institution debit card ( Bank of America ) are covered. In the FAQs in the Transactions section it states that P2P payments can be considered EFTs under Regulation E, and states that any P2P payment that meets the definition of EFT is covered by the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) and Regulation E. Additionally, this section makes clear that P2P payments that use a consumers debit card to transfer funds, credit-push P2P payments that transfer funds out of a consumers deposit, prepaid or mobile account, and P2P debit card pass-through payments are all considered EFTs which are subject to Regulation Es requirements. 

I can provide you copies of the contracts and copies of the XXXX XXXX transactions if needed. I have been a customer of Bank of America for XXXX  years and have never filed a dispute. Everything seemed legitimate based on the contracts, references etc. I just want my money back and based on Regulation E, I believe Bank of America should pay these claims. I have absolutely no way to contact the merchant, since they were fraudsters! Thank you.
