_source.complaint_what_happened:
Back in XXXX of this year, Bank of America began charging me fees of {$25.00} a month for my " advantage with tiered interest checking '' account. I have had this account since XXXX and never paid fees, it existed prior to their preferred rewards program. When I called to resolve this issue, the representative said she would be able to reverse the fees. I immediately saw a {$50.00} credit, but she said she had made an error on the third fee, but had resubmitted it and I should see it process in 2-3 business days. 


Their explanation for the appearance of the fees was that my average daily balance had dipped below the $ XXXX required for the preferred rewards program and without that, I no longer qualified for waiving the maintenance fee. 


I questioned why my account would have a maintenance fee for falling below $ XXXX when the terms for an " advantage with tiered interest checking '' it states : " {$5000.00} or more average daily balance in checking or linked Regular Savings '' This particular checking account does not often have $ XXXX in it, but I have several other accounts at BofA and combined, they are always well above that threshold. 


I made a followup call inquiring about the remaining {$25.00} that was not refunded and eventually spoke to a supervisor who assured me they would review the phone transcript and refund the {$25.00} if the representative had indeed promised I would get the refund, this was XX/XX/XXXX. 


Today, I was checking to see if there was any change in the account and see that the account was changed from " advantage tiered checking '' to " advantage relationship banking ''. This was not a change that was discussed with me and I did not authorize it. This is an account type that is no longer available and I am upset that it was changed without my consent because the required daily balance to avoid fees for " relationship banking '' is double ( $ XXXX ) that required for " advantage tiered checking '' ( $ XXXX ). 


In addition, they are telling me that they " reviewed '' the case and will not be refunding the {$25.00} fee from XXXX, despite the supervisor on XXXX and the rep on XX/XX/XXXX telling me they would refund it. The supervisor also told me that in his system, my account has been advantage relationship banking as far back as XXXX, which is completely false. I downloaded my three most recent statements that show " advantage tiered checking '' as account type. 


link to their fees page : https : //www.bankofamerica.com/deposits/account-fees/ I uploaded screenshots showing the change in my account type compared to what appeared on my statements.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
A check sent Bank of America using bill pay to a business was fraudulently cashed. It has been almost four months and I still do not have the funds back in my checking account. 

I have been trying to reclaim the funds since XXXX of XXXX. The check was scheduled to arrive on XX/XX/XXXX Here is my timeline : XXXX I sent them the information, again. I first provided contact information in an online inquiry on XX/XX/XXXX, then again in a message on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX I sent another message asking for an update. Received a reply that they have not been successful in obtaining the required information from XXXX ( XXXX ) and if I could provide them with contact information XX/XX/XXXX I sent a message asking for an update. Received a reply to allow for sufficient time for the process and that they will send me a message as soon as they have more information or resolution. 
XX/XX/XXXX XXXX received the documents from BofA, needed to find a notary, I recommended she go to the bank, they frequently have them on staff. Not long after she mentioned she had mailed them, I dont have that date. 
XX/XX/XXXX received an update in the online message center that they have sent XXXX some required document that is needed in order to recover the money. Sounds like they first get their money, then I get mine. I replied asking when it was sent and that if they have not received it yet there will be a delay in response due to the XXXX XXXX trip XXXX called XXXX, that was the number in the email, on hold for 16 minutes, wrong dept, when I gave him the case number he said that this case numbers generally start with letters and that I was calling the wrong area, transferred me and gave me this number : XXXX After another 34 minutes - XXXX from Texas, This was the wrong area hes going to transfer me back to XXXX XXXX XXXX I requested to speak with a supervisor, he said he would file a complaint on my behalf and get a manager / supervisor on the phone too XXXX in Arizona - gave her the case number, she confirmed that it is now being handled by the back office, I can not reach them directly, the last status in my case is from them trying to get a phone number. 
I should expect a call or update within the messaging within 3 5 business days otherwise call XXXX She is also filing a complaint on my behalf XXXX sent a note from the online banking center asking for a status. Received a reply on XXXX that I needed to call XX/XX/XXXX called for an update on the case, guy put me on hold to review the case. Came back and asked me who he could help. I was clear I wanted to know the status and when I would receive the money back. Then said he needed to check to see if a fraud case had been started and put me on hold again. Got dropped back into XXXX and told I would be called back in about 20 minutes Spoke with XXXX from Tennessee ; she can not see if there is a claim as she does not handle billpay Called back, spoke with the same gentleman, he tried calling the Fraud dept, was on hold for another XXXX minutes ; I had to drop for a meeting, he sent me a note that they are in the process of assembling information XX/XX/XXXX gave a copy of the cashed check I received from the bank to XXXX XX/XX/XXXX called to confirm the signatures were not a match, they need to talk to the gym, get an affidavit out to the gym, have them sign and return, then the investigation starts. Also told standard practice is to mark it lost if not received within 5 days, had that been done, this could all have been avoided. Since I called when it was 18 days overdue XX/XX/XXXX requested copies of the checks, gentleman agreed the signatures for XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX were not a match XX/XX/XXXX called to follow up on the XX/XX/XXXX from and told the check had been cashed XX/XX/XXXX filled out a form online that the check never arrived XX/XX/XXXX Initially called on XX/XX/XXXX about the check not being received. Told there was a delay in mailings due to voting ballots being sent from XXXX and to wait a week

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I was working with XXXX XXXX of Bank of America to get approved for a home loan in XXXX and XXXX of 2024. I asked countless times to get preapproved before making an offer on a home and was continuously prompted to only get prequalified. My pre-qualification covered the loan amount so I put in my offer and it was accepted. 

After being required to pay for an inspection, appraisal, earnest money, due diligence money AND home owners insurance, totaling over {$4500.00}, I was denied for my loan with Bank of America and forced to lose those funds. 

The XXXX did not tell me there were issues with being at my current job for less than 12 months. He did not disclose that Id have to spend more money upfront to get my XXXX ratio down, he did not warn me of any of these circumstances as any good LO would have done. 

This was all in an attempt to utilize their XXXX XXXX programs to help borrowers like me realize their dreams of owning a home. The grants were expected to cover XXXX in downpayment, and XXXX in closing costs. I was still asked to spend $ XXXX out of pocket for downpayment and less than XXXX of the closing cost grants were actually applied to my closing costs. 

The total cash to close was going to be well over $ XXXX even with these grants. This has been the worst experience trying to get a loan of any kind. Do not recommend.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
The intro bonus offer for the cash back rewards card was denied after meeting the terms and qualifications of spending {$1000.00} during the first 3 billing cycles upon opening the account. 
On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I called PNC customer service at XXXX to inquire on why I had never received my promotional offer. The service agent stated that i had signed up for the card during a promotional black out date that began XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX. This is nowhere stated on the terms and conditions upon signing up. The website is currently unchanged and the terms still do not reflect such verbiage ( XXXX ). I requested to escalate the conversation and speak with a manager, which then resulted in me speaking with an American woman who then stated she could not find a sign up code and that I indeed signed up on a supposed " black out date. '' However, upon her verification of the PNC Website, she confirmed the offer had not changed and there were no black out dates stated. My issue was then written up to be forwarded to higher. On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I recieved a follow up call from PNC ( XXXX ) and was greeted by a service representative who wanted to know if my problem had been resolved to which I replied " No, the problem has not been resolved and I am still waiting on confirmation that my complaint has been reviewed for the issue of not having received my promotional bonus upon meeting the guidelines ''. At or around XXXX on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, I received another call from PNC stating that my claim had been denied without further explanation, no confirmation either written or emailed after my request. The representative apologized and stated that due to length of time in which the promotion was due to be given was too far off, that I would not be receiving it whatsoever. My response was " the reward should have been automatically applied to my statement, since it is not my job to do PNCs job. '' The integrity of this bank is reflecting poorly by the way it has handled this situation. Many other customers may have applied for this card just as I did via the PNC website with the intent to apply for a card with a bonus offer, however, it seems that they may have been defrauded of their time, mental well being, and money.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
USAA never issued me a XXXX for a charge off reporting on my credit report showing a charged off balance of {$11000.00} opened XXXX closed XXXX. I try logging in to my usaa account about this and they will not allow me to log in using my username. i tried to reset my password through my phone and email but there is nothing they will do. 

Generally, a creditor must file a Form 1099-C if : ( 1 ) debt in the amount of {$600.00} or more has been discharged ; ( 2 ) the creditor is an applicable entity; and ( 3 ) an identifiable event has occurred. A Form 1099-C must be filed in the year following the calendar year in which the identifiable event occurs ( XX/XX/XXXX to debtor ; XX/XX/XXXX to the IRS if paper-filed, and XX/XX/XXXX to the IRS if e-filed ) XXXX Finally, the only cancelled or discharged debt that must be reported on a Form 1099-C is the principal amount of the debt owed ; however a creditor may report the interest and penalties forgiven if it so chooses.

The pertinent Treasury Regulation defines indebtedness for Form 1099-C reporting purposes as any amount owed to an applicable entity, including stated principal, fees, stated interest, penalties, administrative costs and fines. The amount of indebtedness discharged may represent all, or only a part, of the total amount owed to the applicable entity. Treas. Reg. 1.6050P-1 ( c ). An applicable entity includes government agencies ( including the Small Business Administration ) and applicable financial entities, which consist of financial institutions ( their subsidiaries ), credit unions, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, and any organization a significant trade or business of which is the lending of money. IRC 6050P ( c ).

An identifiable event generally triggering a Form 1099-C reporting obligation includes : ( 1 ) a bankruptcy discharge ; ( 2 ) a cancellation/extinguishment that renders a debt unenforceable in a receivership, foreclosure, or similar proceeding ; ( 3 ) a cancellation upon the expiration of the statute of limitations for collection of an indebtedness or upon the expiration of a statutory period for filing a claim or commencing a deficiency judgment proceeding ; ( 4 ) a cancellation pursuant to an election of foreclosure remedies by a creditor that statutorily extinguishes or bars the creditor 's right to pursue collection of the indebtedness; ( 5 ) a cancellation that renders a debt unenforceable pursuant to a probate or similar proceeding ; ( 6 ) a discharge pursuant to an agreement between an applicable entity and a debtor to discharge indebtedness at less than full consideration; and ( 7 ) a discharge pursuant to a decision by the creditor, or the application of a defined policy of the creditor, to discontinue collection activity and discharge debt. 

The failure by a creditor to file a Form 1099-C may result in penalties under IRC 6721 and 6722. The amount of penalty for the failure to file a correct Form 1099-C by the due date ( IRC 6721 ) is based on when the Form 1099-C is filed :
_source.sub_issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt

_source.complaint_what_happened: I have an Apple Card that is serviced by Goldman Sachs. I have had the card for almost a year, and made all payments on time. For my XXXX payment, I accidentally paid the installment balance & interest charge twice, because I didn't receive confirmation of the first payment ( so I submitted the payment again ). I later saw two payments posted to my account. I was unable to cancel the pending payment from the Apple Card app, so I contacted the support team. The support team told me they were unable to cancel the payment when it was pending, so to reach back out once it had posted in a few days. I waited a few days and then reached back out once the payment was posted. The support team then told me they were unable to cancel the payment once it was posted, and I would need to contact my bank to cancel the charge. I contacted my bank, and they said they couldn't cancel it and I would need to go back to Goldman. I went back to Goldman again, and they said they could file a request to refund my payment, and that it would take ten business days. It has now been ten business days and I contacted them again, to which they have said the process will take up to 30 days. I am confused and frustrated as to why my additional payment is still being held by Goldman and I keep getting misinformation about the process. I think this is a deliberate attempt by Apple and Goldman to make the process intentionally confusing so that people give up and don't bother getting their money back after an accidental over payment.
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX we had unauthorized charges come through our checking out, via my debit card. I was notified by text of three of these charges and marked them as fraudulent. I then followed up with the bank the same day to confirm that those charges were not going through and then they closed that debit card and sent me a new one. Later that afternoon I received a few notifications from XXXX stating that orders that I did not place had be shipped. I then called PNC back and asked why these charges still went through - they said that since it was my debit card, I would have to wait until the charges posted before I could file a dispute. 
Over the next few days I tried calling XXXX to cancel or refuse the orders that had been placed in my name and there was nothing they could do about it. The charges showed up on my account and said that the products were delivered to me but nothing was ever delivered. 

To define these charges/orders : - They all happened on the same day - at the same time - For the exact same product- in the exact same amount We filed one dispute and it took the full 90 days for us to get a response. The response detailed that 3 of the 14 charges were found as fraud but the other 11 were found as legitimate orders. The provisional credit was taken back and PNC closed our checking account AND my credit card without any notice. This is an account that all of our bills come out of, power, mortgage etc. These payments are auto-drafted and because the account was closed without notice we incurred various fees due to returned payments. 

It then took us a full 3 weeks to receive the cashiers check for the remaining amount in our account, to open a new account at a different bank, and for all of those funds to be available since it was a large deposit. 

I then filed a complaint with the CFPB regarding this situation and was placed with an agent at PNC. They filed a separate dispute XX/XX/XXXX and within 25 days we received notice that the NEW dispute went nowhere. I have provided a police report and a letter from XXXX stating that the 3rd party company that the fraudulent orders were placed with has since been removed from the platform for " quality reasons. '' In the meantime, my PNC representative stated that XXXX tried to issue the refund for the remaining funds but because they had closed our account, the funds were rejected. 

My representative at PNC then instructed me to call XXXX and see if they could reissue the refund. Since that instruction I have gone back and forth with both PNC and XXXX trying to find someone who can help, with no luck.

_source.complaint_what_happened: My account was being managed by a XXXX XXXX XXXX, the advisor took my account offline after an argument after he did not pay my credit card bill, making me be behind on credit cards even till now, as it was something always paid from my account, the advisor closed my account and moved my stocks to holding companies, making it very hard to assess money, as I have to have documents and receive checks in the mail, also depositing checks from my stocks has been placed on hold multiple times by Bank of America, when all my checks come from stocks I previously held in a financially advised account, I have now tried to open a XXXX edge account to be told, I had a restriction on my account, which the banker told me he would email compliance and would let me know in two days, that was XX/XX/XXXX, I have not heard from the bank nor compliance about opening a XXXX edge account

_source.complaint_what_happened: In the past XXXX years there have been THREE fraudulent charges on my Discover Card. I disputed all three each at the time when the charge occurred. The first two were not properly investigated and I was unable to get a phone call from a human. I therefore paid the fake charges to keep my account in good standing, as I have never as much as carried a credit card balance in my entire life and my credit score is around XXXX. However the third charge was a ridiculous amoung and the final straw. I did still pay the charge while I disputed it. However, for the third time, Discover failed to investigate and failed to return any phone calls whatsoever. I have been requesting phone calls for XXXX consecutive months and have not received a single callback. Their hold times are absurd. Their chatbot online does nothing. So, Discover card actually owes me money as I overpaid the account. Because I have never missed a payment or even carried a balance, this must be the only way Discover card can make any money from me. It shoucld be noted that this same fake charge came up on XXXX other credit cards who both found the charge fraululent immediately. Discover however told me to " call the merchant '' except that is not possible since it is a fake merchant. There is no phone number, address, email address, etc. Discover also mailed me an ilegible document with some lines in it and no text, claiming that was their documentation from investigating the charge, so obviously no investigation happened. They wrongly updated my credit report inaccurately and continue to owe me money. Lastly, they failed to remove a second user on my account that was removed several years ago, then endangered my personal info and privacy by sending that personal person info about my account. I have not yet received a response that addressed even XXXX of these issues let alone the whole complaint. To sum : 1 ) fake charge # 1 2 ) fake charge # 2 3 ) fake charge # 3 ( current ) 4 ) person not removed from account 5 ) inability to investigate fake charges multiple times 6 ) wrong info on credit report 7 ) WILL NOT EVEN GIVE ME A PHONE CALL BACK 8 ) Discover still owes me money Please investigate these horrible crimes committed on the behalf of Discover as this is downright theft of hardworking people who don't carry credit balances so clearly this is Discover trying to make money any way it can. If it hopes it will frustrate people into giving up and paying it did that with me twice already but not this time.

The North Carolina XXXX XXXX accepted my complaint and entered it into record and assigned the complaint for investigation and have initiated an investigation into the violation that an in fact attorney - acting as a debt collector violated my rights when the law firm - XXXX XXXX - through a NC XXXX certified attorney, company staff, XXXX XXXX XXXX, Attorney violated my rights when a Letter was delivered to me through the U.S. Mail signed by the same attorney listed above - violated the Fair Debt collections practices act when the letter contained a demand for monies allegedly owed by me and that the amount the law firm and attorney for Discover Card, by the content signed by her, was in fact more - over and above the amount that their client Discover Card, has attested in dozens of complaints where Discover Card has stated multiple times through their own validation of the debt amount which is and always has been {$2300.00} as indicated on an attached document with this complaint. 

The attorney, the law firm of her employment, and their client as a whole violated my rights and FDCPA, Federal laws when they attempted to collect {$1100.00} more than the reported amount by their own client, Discover Card. 

Federal and state laws have been violated by the attorney, firm, and Discover card clearly and indisputably along with my rights being violated under both NC General Statutes and Federal law- and are both have Statutory fines that I am entitled to. {$1000.00} for the Federal violation and {$4000.00} for the NC state violations- Also, Discover Card falsely reported to the credit bureaus that I had made three satisfactory monthly payments, three months in a row and was in fact deceptive in this false reporting to the credit Bureaus of this charged off account in an attempt to reset the 7 year collections rule x, all regarding this one Discover Bank charged off account - when in fact I never paid any months payments to charged off account.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
After I received E-Statements from FNBO detailing a ~ {$20.00} balance due, I accessed FNBO 's mobile, which I used to make all previous payments on my FNBO card for the almost 2 years I used their services. The mobile app did not display any balance and, as a result, did not allow me to pay it. I accessed the mobile app multiple times in XXXX and XXXX attempting to find the balance that corresponded with my e-Statements. I was confused and assumed the e-Statements I received were a glitch or error. 

Prior to XXXX, at the end of XXXX, my phone and other cards were stolen while I was traveling in XXXX. After the theft, I called FNBO to ask if I could use the card while traveling. Instead of answering my question or helping, they froze my account on suspicion of fraud. The only way they would un-freeze the card would be if I did a bank ID, which I told them was impossible, given I was out of the country and would not return to the US until the middle of XXXX. I believe the freezing of the account could have had an impact on the failure of the app to accurately represent my balance. I also believe the timing of the freezing led to my confusion about the e-Statements being erroneous. 

FNBO 's records show that they sent me one email reminder to pay my credit card balance at the end of XXXX ( XXXX : an email reminder is not a notice of delinquency ) and letters in the mail after I missed the XX/XX/XXXX pay deadline. If FNBO had taken note and/or communicated to their collections department that I was out of the country they could have sent communications other then letters to my home address in North Carolina to notify me of my ongoing delinquency and need to pay. Given the error in the mobile app, I was under the impression that I had no balance to pay until my account was closed last week ( XX/XX/XXXX ). 

The effect of closing my account has had a disastrous impact on my credit score and has even caused my other lines of credit to decrease my credit limit with them. I had a perfect payment history with FNBO ( and all my other cards ) before this communication failure. Additionally, I paid significantly much more on my other credit cards during the period that FNBO reported me as delinquent. I was not willingly avoiding paying my ~ {$20.00} balance with FNBO - I was failed by multiple systems of consumer service and communication at FNBO and left in the dark about my small debt with them.

_source.complaint_what_happened: On XX/XX/XXXX I request to have PMI removed from my mortgage due to the home equity exceeding 20 % of the XXXX ratio. In XXXX PNC responded asking me to provide justification of the increase in my home value and a check for {$100.00} for a XXXX XXXX XXXX. The check was received on XX/XX/XXXX and cashed on XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, PNC mailed me a letter stating that the price increased to {$150.00} as of XX/XX/XXXX. I contacted PNC to ask why the price increase applies to me since I submitted my request and my check was cashed before the new price went into effect. I called XXXX more times during XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX and each time was told someone would call me back to explain. I never received a return phone call. Finally on XX/XX/XXXX I called and demanded to speak to someone right then that could explain since no one had ever called me back. I was told that the PMI department does not speak to customers which is why no one called me back. They did not explain why I was told I would receive a call back. The customer service rep I did talk to said that it did not matter when I submitted my request or when it was processed ; at any point if the price changes they can cancel my request and require that I restart the process and pay the higher fee. That is misleading and deceitful to allow a mortgage company to change rates at any time and make them retroactive.

While on a flight on XX/XX/XXXX, I was incented to apply for a credit card with Barclays bank to get XXXX bonus miles the first time I used the card for any amount ( " welcome bonus '' ). Subsequently my application was approved, I received the card in the mail, and activated it without a problem. The first time I attempted to use the card at a local merchant on XX/XX/XXXX - the charge was declined. I tried using the card again the same day at another merchant with the same result. On XX/XX/XXXX I spent 30 minutes with their customer service call center to finally get an answer that my card was not able to be used until I provided 'know your customer ' documents by mail to the bank in spite of already being a Barclays customer with another open credit card. And, the Security department is not open on Sunday so I would have to call back. I requested confirmation in writing of which documents would be acceptable to clear the XXXX and be able to use my card. 

I was traveling internationally during the following week and attempted to use my other Barclays card on XX/XX/XXXX and that charge was declined. I called the Customer Service number again and was told they couldn't help me and I need to call a different number. That resulted in a call to a call center with a 90 minute wait time, directed to their customer service website that has no option for providing any XXXX documentation or list of acceptable documents. 

So now adverse action has been taken on both of my credit card accounts ( no access to my available credit ) without a solution or any documentation on why ( no written direction was received after my XX/XX/XXXX request for how to lift the block on my card ). I also have a specific timeframe to use my card to get the promised XXXX miles in my airline account and no way to use my card to get them. This also feels like a bit of bait and switch, there is no apparent reason for my account to have been flagged for XXXX documents since I'm an existing customer. And the clock is ticking on me being able to get the reward.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I couldnt find any way to close my account on the Marcus by Goldman Sacks website. Then I spent several hours trying to close my account by phone. 
The first person I talked to said the account couldnt be closed because I had recently updated my email address on their website. The next 2 people I talked to said someone would have to call me back and Id have to give them a one-time 4 digit PIN. The first time, I was told someone would call me as soon as our call ended. They didnt call. I called back after over 30 minutes. After being put on hold 3 times, I was told again that someone would call to ask for the PIN but this time it would take 20 to 30 minutes for them to call for the PIN. There was no call back for several hours. I cant hang around for hours and keep my phone line open waiting for Marcus by Goldman Sacks to call. 
They also require me to be at home to sign for the check sent via USPS. That would certainly be another delay. 
Seems clear that this is a runaround to avoid closing a CD thats paying only a third of a percentage point interest.

My information was sold and bought illegally because I was a victim of the + XXXXdata breach. I want these items Deleted from my credit reports effective immediately. I am attaching proof that XXXX has admitted that! was in fact a victim of this data breach. 
According to 15 USC 1681e ( b ) it states this ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 
So I then asked them to provide me a description of the investigation according to 15 USC 1681 ( 7 ) : ( 7 ) Description of reinvestigation procedure A consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer a description referred to in paragraph ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) by not later than 15 days after receiving a request from the consumer for that description.

But they did not do that as well either.

They are also breaking these laws as well below : According to 15 USC 1681 ( 5 ) it states this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 
According to 15 USC 1681s-2 it states this. ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 
( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( i ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX while in the branch of PNC the branch XXXX recommended I open a credit card with XXXX percent interest on balance transfers for the first 12 months. I accepted their offer and was approved for the credit card and authorized a balance transfer of {$210000.00} to XXXX XXXX Credit card and {$850.00} transfer to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Credit card. The transfers were authorized with the credit card approval on XX/XX/XXXX. The XXXX XXXX transfer was posted to my XXXX XXXX credit card on XX/XX/XXXX and the XXXX XXXX XXXX transfer was posted to my XXXX XXXX XXXX Credit on XX/XX/XXXX. 
I set up auto payment transfers from my PNC checking account to my new PNC credit card to begin on XXXX and each month after on the XXXX of the month for {$500.00} each. 
I did this to pay off the credit card within the 12 months to avoid any finance charges. 
When my XXXX statement arrived in the mail, the statement period shown was from XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX, and the minimum payment was due XX/XX/XXXX. I had already made a {$500.00} dollar payment on XXXX so I was not worried about the minimum due. 
At sometime in XXXX I received the another statement from PNC for my credit card with a minimum payment due by of {$50.00} by XX/XX/XXXX, however I made a transfer payment on XX/XX/XXXX so I again was not worried about the minimum payment. However I did not notice the XXXX statement included a late fee of {$27.00} dollars and interest charges of {$1.00} dollars. 
When I received my XXXX statement this month I noticed a late fee of {$38.00} dollars and interest changes of {$1.00} dollars. I called PNC and disputed the late fee in XXXX and the interest charge and they reversed the charges for both. The next day I went back and reviewed my XXXX statement again and that's when I noticed a late fee that month too. So Monday morning ( XX/XX/XXXX ) I went to the PNC XXXX and explained the situation to them in person but she was not able to help me, she did escalate my request and I was contacted by a PNC representative who informed me they could not reverse the XXXX Late fee because they had already reversed the XXXX XXXX XXXX and PNC does not reverse XXXX late fees in the same year. 
Both the XXXX late and and the XXXX late fee are erroneous and should be reversed. 
I have made more than minimum payments in XXXX, XXXX and XXXX.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent the below letter to Barclay Card to dispute a transaction : On XX/XX/2023 I bought a car using XXXX from a private individual for {$5500.00}. XXXX is linked to my Barclay account. Unfortunately, the seller initially provided the wrong email address for the XXXX account. The first payment went to the wrong person. 

There were XXXX payments made that day. XXXX was to XXXX XXXX. The other to XXXX XXXX XXXX. Both payments were for {$5500.00}. The payment to XXXX XXXX XXXX is correct. The payment to XXXX XXXX is incorrect. 

We immediately contacted XXXX in an attempt to resolve the issue. I am attaching the correspondence with XXXX, including correspondence with the wrong XXXX XXXX where she makes it clear that she doesn't know anything about the {$5500.00} and further states I hope you get your money. Despite this, XXXX essentially passed the buck and informed us to take it upwith Barclay. I called Barclay during this time and I was informed to try to resolve the issue with XXXX first. 

To summarize : a payment for {$5500.00} was made to the wrong XXXX XXXX. She makes it clear that she doesn't know me, and has not done business with me. She has not requested {$5500.00} from me. Despite this, the {$5500.00} is still being charged against my card.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XXXX XX/XX/2022, {$590.00} worth of fraudulent charges were made on my TD Bank Visa card. No verification attempt was made by the recipient ( XXXX AA ), as the name given was not the name that goes with the card. I disputed the fraudulent charges and received a waiver of the charges on XX/XX/2022 ( attached ). But then they reversed that decision arbitrarily, based on no evidence. Furthermore, I have used this XXXX for well over a decade with zero history of anything but complete honesty ; I don't know how could have been any more of a model customer. TD Bank arbitrarily decided to steal that {$590.00} from me. 

Furthermore, when I spent a couple of hours on the phone attempting to get some kind of answers, they resubmitted it to investigation with the promise that I would get an answer within 6 months. No answer came and I called again, going through another 45 min. on the phone to get someone to promise I would get an answer within 10 days. That answer never came either. TD Bank has been horrible to deal with, both in terms of dishonesty and difficulty of finding anyone to talk to. It took me a half hour on the phone today to cancel the card.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I tried to trade in my XXXX XXXX XXXX and was told there is still a lien showing on my title. I paid the vehicle off on XX/XX/XXXX. The loan was with BBVA/Compass Bank . On XX/XX/XXXX, I called PNC bank customer service and spoke with someone in their auto loan service department because they acquired Compass Bank in XXXX, and I was unable to reach anyone at Compass Bank to provide me with a lien release letter. I asked the PNC representative to help me get a lien release letter. He took my SSN, full name, and was unable to locate anything about me or any record of a loan in the PNC system. He told me I needed to visit a branch location and ask them to research my issue with their title team so they could look for my loan information in their archives. 

The closest branch is in XXXX, NC - about 8 miles away ( a 30 minute drive for me ), so before I went in person, I called and spoke with someone in their customer service department ( his name was XXXX XXXX. He explained to me that nobody at the branch can help me and that they get erroneous requests like this a lot. He then told me to call customer service again and ask for someone in the auto loan department. I explained I already did this, and he said that this is the only option to get help, and I should just keep calling them until they actually help me. 

In lieu of calling back and not getting help, I am filing this complaint. It seems that someone at Compass Bank failed to release my lien when my car was paid off, and since they have been acquired, it seems that PNC is unwilling to help me get this processed so I can trade in my vehicle for a new one. Can someone please help me get this lien release letter?

I went in person to prove my identity with my lease and license and they won't do anything. On XX/XX/year> after due diligence and much research with a breeder I attempted to purchase a puppy from a breeder on XXXX. I looked at past litters and had point of contacts for past clients. After speaking with this breeder for a couple of weeks I felt comfortable making the purchase for said puppy. The breeder requested the payment via XXXX of XXXX XXXX This is the average price for the breed of puppy I was looking for. As a member of a breed specific FB page, this was XXXX of XXXX approved breeders listed, meaning they supposedly sent in all DNA and xray records of the puppy 's parents. The FB page had over XXXX approved members listed on the group. I started the process through my bank but the fraud department needed to verify with phone calls. Somehow during the call the payment went through ( even the person I spoke to on the phone was surprised and said it was submitted while we were on the phone together going through the checks. 
Come to find out it was a scam. There was never any puppy. In fact the scammed attempted to get more money during the shipping process by saying the crate was not sufficient enough for air travel to my local airport. I called Bank of America to alert them to the fraud and appropriate measures were taken and a fraud claim was opened up. 
Unfortunately as of today they will no longer support my claim of fraud and assist me with recovering my XXXX $ back. 
I need help with recovering my funds and stricter measures need to be in place regarding XXXX and the use of it on behalf of scammers. 
I attempted to get my money back by all means necessary, including calling the person to whom the money was sent but I was told that his bank account was hacked and he has been getting phone calls for the past week from other victims. How far and how long does this have to go on before something is done? I live alone and had to take a loan out to get this " fake '' puppy

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Checking Account Discrepancies and Request for Investigation Dear Customer Service Team, I am writing to formally express my dissatisfaction with the ongoing discrepancies in my checking account over the past XXXX and a half years. My wife and I have experienced continual issues where the balance reported by Bank of America does not match the actual available funds in the account. These fluctuations have caused significant confusion and distress, leading to serious financial burdens. 

In total, I estimate that we have experienced around {$3000.00} in discrepancies, with funds seemingly missing or held inappropriately. A specific incident occurred on XX/XX/year>, when I ordered a refrigerator from XXXX and subsequently canceled the order. I should have seen the funds from the hold returned to my account, but it took nearly XXXX weeks for Bank of America to acknowledge the existence of a pre-hold report. Even then, the bank admitted they could not explain what happened with the funds, leaving me to go through my account line by line to identify the issue. 

This situation is unacceptable. The unexplained fluctuations in our account balance have caused us grave financial difficulty, and I have lost confidence in the security and accuracy of your services. As a result, I have decided to close my account with Bank of America. 

However, before I proceed, I formally request that this matter be thoroughly investigated. I would appreciate your assistance in identifying where these discrepancies occurred and how they will be addressed. A clear and transparent resolution is necessary to ensure that this does not happen to other customers. 

I expect a prompt and detailed response, as well as a plan of action to resolve the missing funds. Please contact me at your earliest convenience to discuss how you plan to investigate and address this issue. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a swift and satisfactory resolution.
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

_source.complaint_what_happened: I had opened a USAA checking account a while back to switch from my local bank and during my use with USAA they were continuously freezing my debit card for suspicious activity over normal purchases. I had contacted them multiple times and my card had gotten unlocked. Fast forward two weeks I am calling USAA to get my card unlocked for no apparent reason and they hit me with a sorry USAA will no longer be banking with you due to unknown reasons. You will receive a cashiers check or business check with the money that was in your account within the next 60 days, I tried to get more info on the scenario, and the lady that I was talking to was not very informal so I decided to give them a call the next day and they ended up giving me the same line that I would be receiving the money within the next 60 days fast-forward 60 days later, Ive contacted USAA And no no attempt of them giving my money back had been found. the customer service representative, that I had talked to had sent up some sort of form to have my account re-reviewed multiple weeks later. I attempted to contact them regarding the form that was sent up saying it was rejected again for unknown reasons, so I had them resubmit the account review and there has been no further progress with USAA and receiving my money back or closing my account because I do not have full access to it anymore. During my multiple calls with USAA they always reassure me that all calls are recorded for USAA and customer protection I wish I had access to these calls to file them with this bunch of information to show how much BS they put me through. but without legal help USAA was not willing to do so. There was also a little bit of XXXX XXXX I feel with USAA security department or whoever deals with their account reviewing being a non-over the phone company or even being branched off of USAA Especially with USAA, not being able to unlock my account using personal verification methods. and having their finance department send over paperwork with the chance of it, not even being reviewed because they deem it low priority overall, USA has still not paid me back the minimum XXXX dollars that is sitting in my frozen account
_source.company_public_response: Company believes complaint represents an opportunity for improvement to better serve consumers

_source.complaint_what_happened: This is a follow-up complaint letter to the resolution letter for complaint ID XXXX. I got scammed through XXXX with the amount of {$2500.00} on XX/XX/2022. At that time, when I deposited the check via the BofA mobile app, Bank of America has failed to inform me that there might be insufficient funds to use because they needed time to validate the check, and they did not put a hold on my deposit. If they had placed a hold on my deposit and informed me properly that the check must be validated, a scam could have been prevented. This was not the case when I got a deposit check on XX/XX/2022, immediately I got an email from Bank of America saying that they have placed a hold on that check, and the full amount is not available yet. However, I have not received the same email from Bank of America when I deposited the check on XX/XX/2022. Had they sent me the same email on XX/XX/2022 when I deposited the check warning me that the amount is not available yet to use and might be available 2 days later, I would never have become a victim of the XXXX scam. That being said, after 2 days of putting the amount on hold, the check would have been returned because it was a fake check, and I would know for sure that it was a scam. Bank of America lost my money.

_source.complaint_what_happened: My husband and I have a XXXX XXXX that is our only source of income for our family. We have XXXX Bank of America business credit cards with Bank of America. Until recently we have always been able to make our payments on time. On XX/XX/XXXX BOA withdrew {$2700.00} out of our checking account to pay CC # 1. This setoff payment included the minimum amount due for XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX BOA withdrew {$4000.00} for CC # 2 and left us with less than enough to cover our rent, payroll, or any living expenses. We have tried working with the bank and they will not return the money. Our deposit agreement with the bank says that setoff payments will not be used to pay credit card payments. I certainly don't want to default on any balances due, but not sure how I can recover when I am not able to pay my mortgage, utilities, payroll, minimum payments for other balances or provide food for my XXXX children when over XXXX XXXX  was withdrawn unexpectedly. I understand BoA would like their past due money. But without the money in our account we are not able to get products needed to finish orders that would put more money in our account that would produce the ability to make our payments. Any assistance would be greatly appreciated. We were not given any notice of these deductions.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I the consumer have asked XXXX XXXX XXXX to validate the alleged debt he claims that I owe, and all he has provided me with are statements to an Alleged account that he can not prove is mine. I never gave XXXX XXXX XXXX consent to use my private personal information for anything. I do NOT have a contract with XXXX XXXX XXXX or his company. 
This is the 3rd attempt and I still have not received the relevant paperwork that the law requires this debt collector to provide the me the consumer. XXXX XXXX XXXX and his company have violated my Consumer Rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) 15USC 1692 ( g ) b Validation of debts. 
You XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) failed to validate this alleged debt. 
I refuse to pay this alleged debt until the proper validation of this debt is provided. 

You are an attorney/debt collector is this correct? If so, I imagine you know the difference between a Validation and Verification of Debt Pursuant 12 CFR 1006.34c. 

This is all hearsay, what firsthand knowledge do you have? This is all false and misleading information. 

Furthermore, I request verification of the alleged debt, specifically, a copy of a CONTRACT or AGREEMENT. Said contract or agreement must be with the original creditor and signed by all parties involved. You are illegally attempting to collect this alleged debt and money that I do not owe. 

An attorney can not be a debt collector and a debt collector can not be an attorney. You are claiming to be both an attorney and a debt collector.
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
_source.sub_issue: Impersonated attorney, law enforcement, or government official

_source.complaint_what_happened:
A few weeks ago, I submitted a request to increase the credit limit associated with my corporate business account. Today, on XX/XX/2023, I contacted customer service to inquire about the status of the request. I was informed that a representative from the bank tried to contact me on XX/XX/2023. Unfortunately, I missed that call as I do not answer calls from unknown numbers. 

As a business owner, I often have a busy schedule and can not always be available at a moment 's notice. Additionally, I hold the status of a platinum with honors reward client, and I believe that should have warranted special attention and consideration. It is my belief that, under these circumstances, leaving a voicemail should have been a standard practice. 

I am deeply concerned that Bank of America 's handling of this matter may constitute a violation of privacy and data protection regulations that are put in place to protect customers ' personal information. 

The fact that I was not notified by any correspondence regarding the attempted contact and that the representative did not leave a voicemail or provide any other contact details further exacerbates my concerns. 

I would like to request that the bank conducts a review and investigation of their credit department to ensure compliance with privacy and data protection standards. 
Additionally, I believe the representative involved with the call on XX/XX/2023 should receive coaching to improve their communication practices. 

As a loyal and valued customer, I trust that Bank of America will address these issues promptly and take the necessary steps to safeguard consumers ' privacy and data. I hope that my complaint will be taken seriously, and appropriate actions will be taken to rectify the situation.

_source.product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
_source.complaint_what_happened: Recently I saw a late payment on my credit report from your company that I do not recognize. According to the FCRA transactions such as payments are not supposed to show on a consumer credit report. I know that this is a billing error and I just would like for it to be corrected.

On XX/XX/2024, my credit card was charged by XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$980.00}. Subsequently, I noticed a billing error in the amount of {$240.00} and have made several attempts to contact the merchant and resolve this billing error. Unfortunately the merchant never responded to my multiple communications. 

On XX/XX/2024, I initiated a credit card billing dispute with Barclays. The dispute case ID is XXXX. 

On XX/XX/2024, Barclays sent me a copy of merchant response to my billing dispute. The merchant response itemized billing items, including the item that was billed in error. I provided additional supporting documentation to Barclays to explain the billing error. 

On XX/XX/2024 and XX/XX/2024, I received additional communications from Barclays notifying the case is closed without resolving the billing error. No further documentary evidence was provided by Barclays to explain its decision. 

In accordance to the section 1666 ( a ) ( B ) ( ii ) of the Fair Credit Billing Act, the creditor shall send a written explanation or clarification to the obligor, after having conducted an investigation, setting forth to the extent applicable the reasons why the creditor believes the account of the obligor was correctly shown in the statement and, upon request of the obligor, provide copies of documentary evidence of the obligor 's indebtedness. In the case of a billing error where the obligor alleges that the creditor 's billing statement reflects goods not delivered to the obligor or his designee in accordance with the agreement made at the time of the transaction, a creditor may not construe such amount to be correctly shown unless he determines that such goods were actually delivered, mailed, or otherwise sent to the obligor and provides the obligor with a statement of such determination.

By closing this billing dispute without providing documentary evidence to support its decision, Barclays has violated the Fair Credit Billing Act.
_source.issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I am writing to formally express my frustration with the ongoing difficulties in accessing my USAA account. Despite following your instructions and submitting all required documentation to verify my identity, I am still locked out of my account. When I called your customer service team as instructed, representatives were unable to verify me, leaving me without access or clear guidance on how to resolve the issue. 

Blocking access to my account raises not only customer service concerns but also potential legal issues under various laws and regulations : Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) and Regulation E : Under the EFTA, financial institutions are required to provide consumers with timely access to their funds and ensure transparency around account restrictions. If you are unjustifiably denying me access, this could violate my rights under these provisions. 

Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : If your inability to verify my identity is connected to the use of third-party information, such as identity verification through credit reporting agencies, improper handling or delays could constitute a violation of FCRA requirements for accuracy and fairness. 

Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) : The CFPA prohibits unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices by financial institutions. Making it unduly difficult for me to access my account or receive assistance without reasonable justification may be considered an unfair practice.

North Carolina Consumer Protection Act ( N.C. Gen. Stat. 75-1.1 ) : This law prohibits unfair or deceptive trade practices, including unreasonable barriers to accessing services or accounts. If USAAs actions in blocking your access are deemed unfair or unjustified, you could raise a complaint under this statute.

This situation has caused significant inconvenience and financial stress. I need immediate assistance to restore access to my account, along with an explanation of why my identity could not be verified, despite submitting the requested documents. If this issue is not promptly resolved, I may explore filing a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or consider legal action.

Please escalate this matter to the appropriate department and provide me with a prompt resolution. I look forward to your swift response.
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

_source.product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
_source.complaint_what_happened: A charge off account is showing on my report & the creditor told me that I can not get a copy of the 1099-C document because they did not officially charge off the debt and they didn't take a write off which is a violation because it says on my credit report that it is charged off which equates to false reporting & not reporting 100 % accurately. FCRA violations refers to a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, which is a federal law that regulates the collection, dissemination, and use of consumer credit information. Federal law requires that consumer reporting agencies follow reasonable procedures to ensure 100 % accuracy of the information contained in their credit reports. If a consumer suffers damages as a result of a FCRA violation they may be entitled to bring a private lawsuit against the CRA and recover actual damages, statutory damages, and attorney 's fees. These accounts listed on my letter are not 100 % correct and I demand them to be investigated completely.

15 USC 1681 section 501 which states that I have the right to privacy - furthermore 15 USC 1681 section 604 section 2 also states a consumer reporting agency can not fumnish an account without my written instructions pursuant to 15 US 1666B a creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer plan as late for any purpose unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by the section 1637B of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. _source.complaint_what_happened:
Im a victim of identity theft someone use my identity to create these accounts on my credit profile I demand my social security number and date of birth be removed from being displayed on the credit file for privacy reasons.

Delete all information in the employer section.

Pursuant to the FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 4 ), I am a federally protected consumer and I have a right to privacy. Not granting me my rights is in direct violation of 15 USC 1681 and all its subsections.

Please send an updated credit report once the changes are complete to my contact information listed. My contact information is as follows : 15 U.S. Code 1681 - Congressional findings and statement of purpose ( b ) REASONABLE PROCEDURES It is the purpose of this subchapter to require that consumer reporting agencies adopt reasonable procedures for meeting the needs of commerce for consumer credit, personnel, insurance, and other information in a manner which is fair and equitable to the consumer, with regard to the confidentiality, ccuracy elevane. and proper utilization of such information in accordance with the requirements of this subchapter The current personal information being furnished is inaccurate, not relevant out dated information.

15 U.S. Code 1681e - Compliance procedures ( b ) ACCURACY OF REPORT Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

The Consumer reports must be accurate this is law! Please make all the correct updates as requested and delete all old inaccurate outdated and irrelevant information from my consumer report! 
Once this is done please send me an updated copy of my consumer reports reflecting only the correct information below.

There was an ongoing dispute with Discover about a {$500.00} charge on my account for almost two years. I paid the account while it was in dispute then Discover repeatedly removed and put back the charge for two years. During this time they added multiple late fees and interest charges to this charge, even though they claim they don't do that to disputed charges. I requested my account be closed and they owed me money since I had overpaid for everything while it was in dispute. However they never sent me any money. 

Finally in XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  they agree that the charge was fraudulent and sent me a notice saying so, several months after my account was closed and they never sent me a ) refund check for the overpayment b ) my cash back rewards. Since my account was closed I could not log in to check my overpayment status and when I called they could not give me any information and told me someone would call me back and they never did. 

Today XX/XX/XXXX they decided to list my account as a charge off on the credit bureau even though I have had a negative balance for the last 7 months as they owed me money. Now they are saying I have a {$10.00} past due balance even though they still owe me money. The transactions listed are late fees that should have been removed and it looks like they used my cash back rewards without my consent to go to any fees for late fees and whatever bogus transactions they added to my account. The current transactions listed for 6 months ago do NOT match the old transactions. 

THIS ACCOUNT WAS IN PERFECT STANDING. IT IS NOT A CHARGE OFF. DISCOVER OWED ME MONEY AND ADDED LATE FEES AND INTEREST TO A BOGUS CHARGE FOR MONTHS, REFUSING TO INVESTIGATE THE FAKE CHARGE. THIS IS DISCOVER 'S DESPERATE ATTEMPT TO MAKE MONEY OFF SOMEONE WHO NEVER PAID LATE OR CARRIED A BALANCE IN THEIR ENTIRE LIFE. NOW THEY ARE STILL TRYING TO MAKE MY ACCOUNT LOOK BAD. 

Please investigate this and have Discover correct the account and send me my check. 

Please be advised THIS WAS THE THIRD FAKE CHARGE TO MY ACCOUNT WITHINT ONE YEAR and Discover also refused to investigate the first two, forcing me to pay them.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
XXXX - A Final Agreement between Bank of America and ourselves was reached to settle a mortgage in XXXX. It took XXXX years to settle and has resulted in an incorrect XXXX issued creating a large tax liability for us. The original mortgage was through Countrywide and bought by Bank of America. In XXXX, the mortgage was refinanced utilizing the XXXX act resulting in an agreed upon monthly payment which was religiously made each month. However, over the next 9 years, BAC lost the paperwork a total of XXXX times necessitating resubmissions from us to formally document the agreement. During that time the reduced payments were considered partial payments and resulting in BAC initiated foreclose proceedings in XXXX. During this time entire time payments were ( and several lost by BAC even though cancelled checks were submitted ), lost paperwork updated and sent, numerous attorneys hired on both sides, legal briefings, discussions and arbitrations held all at BACs request. After XXXX years and through multiple attorneys, a final agreement was reached and signed on XX/XX/XXXX. HOWEVER, it wasnt over! 

Unfortunately, BAC issued an incorrect XXXX XXXX. Per the final agreement, a settlement amount was given to us to cover attorney fees and costs incurred by us. This is designated in the agreement on page XXXX of XXXX ; paragraph XXXX : " Full Satisfaction. The XXXX is in full satisfaction of the Released Matters ( as defined herein ), and it includes all attorneys fees and costs that Defendants XXXX have incurred in connection with the XXXX. ' Per the IRS and the XXXX, this is a non-taxable event. However, BAC has issued a XXXX XXXX stating XXXX amount as taxable. From XXXX to XXXX, multiple attempts have been made to correct the problem. The attorneys settling the case advised us to work with BAC directly to solve the issue. The attempts were fruitless, again, lost documents, multiple XXXX with no direct communication to the group responsible for the issuing of the XXXX. The XXXX itself has an XXXX number that doesnt work. Detailed below are the latest attempts as there are too many to detail from XXXX to XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX IRS agent assigned and XXXX XXXX date assigned. Agreement with IRS that BAC should issue a corrected XXXX XXXX with 3 of the XXXX stating a XXXX XXXX. All documents must be turned into the XXXX XXXX by XX/XX/XXXX. The IRS agent also stated that if a corrected XXXX can not physical be issued quickly, a letter on Bank of America letterhead stating that a corrected XXXX with Box 3 as XXXX  is in process would be acceptable until the corrected XXXX is in process XXXX 

XX/XX/XXXX Multiple phone discussions with BAC over 2 hours via 3 different XXXX. The operators could not find the agreement nor the XXXX XXXX in question and had NO facility to have us send them to them. After many phone transfers and much discussion and verification, the operator opened case # XXXX. All details as stated above were noted in the case and it was expedited. Since the operator had no facility to accept the agreement or XXXX in question, we went to a BAC branch and faxed the incorrect XXXX, a full copy of the XXXX XXXX, the IRS information and contact and a cover explaining the entire situation. A fax confirmation was received. 

XX/XX/XXXX No updates on this case XXXX had been received. Spent 3 hours on 4 different XXXX # XXXX and 4 different operators. First, the case couldnt be found. Then, both names werent on the loan which was eventually found after much discussion. The status given to us was that the case was rejected due to the original operator submitting an incorrect code and/or form. We were not notified of this in any way. This current operator created a new case # XXXX and stated that it was expedited and full details ( as previously stated ) were added to the case. We were told that we should call back to XXXX in 7 days to get status. 

XX/XX/XXXX Received letter from BAC dated XX/XX/XXXX stating We cant add ( husbands full name ) and ( wifes full name ) as authorized third party of your home loan. We are ALREADY the stated lenders on the loan. This is further proof of BAC 's incompetence in this entire matter. 

The XXXX XXXX date is XX/XX/XXXX and all documentation must be sent to them by XX/XX/XXXX. Based on BAC displayed incompetence and lack of responsiveness in this matter, it is unlikely that we receive a corrected XXXX from them to meet the XXXX date. Therefore, we respectfully submit this complaint as a request for additional help. 


CC : Office of the Comptroller of the Currency Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX, CEO BAC ( XXXX ) IRS, Examination Appeals, New York

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Bank of America modifies due dates, asses late fees, and compounds interest in a way that should be illegal, if not already. 

Due to Bank of America modifying the date that a credit card statement is processed it is impossible to schedule a ( date ) recurring payment that assures you have a XXXX balance as of the statement date. Moreover, even if you do pick the correct date, charges that occur on that date, after the transfer of funds are carried forward. Bank of America asses interest on your account at the last possible minute but does not give you the option to pay after/just prior to this assessment. I was told over the phone this can be done, but it can not be signed up for online. 

I was charged late fees and interest totaling {$100.00} over XXXX  months, while making a payment each month for the complete balance of the card as provided by BoA, within XXXX  day of each other in calendar date. Bank of America never notified me of any interest or late fees being assessed and does not have an option to do so. They provide options to alert me on individual credit purchases over a dollar amount or checks posting, but can not alert me to late fees or interest assessed? This is an abusive banking practice and should be mandated by law. 

I was never notified the account was past due in XXXX, and only let me know after multiple days of assessing interest in XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX 's payment. The late fees and interest are retroactively added to the previous month 's statement so that without opening past months statements in online banking there is no way to know that interest or late fees were assessed. I was never able to find a {$39.00} late fee I was told was assessed in XXXX anywhere in their XXXX  app, which is my primary way to access banking. I only found it when viewing XXXX copies of statements from the PC. 

After calling Bank of America they offered to credit me back the {$100.00}, but said I would need to call back and pay an adjusted balance if I continued to use the card in XXXX, which does not make sense as interest should not be being compounded on purchases made prior to a closing date. Bank of America charging me daily interest on charges I am currently making is an abusive banking practice WHEN I'm not even aware my account is past due.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
The companies, along with the credit reporting agencies, are knowingly and willingly committing Aggravated Identity Theft to collect on an extension of credit and punish me for non repayment of, when I am in fact not the debtor as they are alleging. This is a violation of 15 USC 1681a, 18 USC 1028A, 18 USC 894, The Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, and RICO. 

This is an Identity Theft pursuant to 15 USC 1681a ( 3 ). The information I am demanding to be removed is not sent in error and is an affidavit of fact, so there is no material misrepresentation of the fact. If you believe I obtained possession of goods and services, then have a XXXX  XXXX member of this company put this information on a signed and notarized affidavit under penalty of perjury.

Once the items are removed from my consumer report, I demand that they are never put back on. If they are put back on, I will pursue litigation against your company in federal court, pursuant to 15 USC 1681o. 

Per 15 USC 1681c-2, the credit reporting agency must block this information from being reported to my consumer report within 4 days of receipt of this ID Theft Report, and I am demanding that you do so.

Thank you for your help in protecting my federally protected consumer rights.

I am writing to address several inaccuracies on my credit report regarding a voluntary repossession due to mechanical failure and catalytic issues with a vehicle that falls within the lemon category. Firstly, the account status listed does not accurately reflect my current financial standing ; it should be marked as closed. Additionally, the number of months reported for this account is incorrect ; it should be 72 months. The date of last activity is also inaccurate ; the actual date is XX/XX/year>. Furthermore, the number of months reviewed in each credit report does not align. Regarding payment status, payments were consistently made prior to the surrender in XXXX, contrary to what is reported. Lastly, the reported monthly payment amount is incorrect ; the accurate figure is {$300.00}. I kindly request that these errors be rectified promptly to ensure the accuracy of my credit report. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

This debt collector engaged in abusive, deceptive, and unfair practices of the FDCPA which it prohibits. They furnished this account that we didn't agree upon and I didn't sign an agreement on. A legal contract is signed by two parties and I did not participate in any of it.

I declare under penalty of perjury ( under the laws of the United States, if executed outside of the United States ) that the foregoing is true and correct to the best of my knowledge. Further, I certify that I am permitted by FEDERAL and STATE LAW to file this dispute. I also understand that knowing and willful misstatements or omissions of material facts constitutes a FEDERAL CRIMINAL VIOLATION punishable under 18 U.S.C. 1001. Additionally, these misstatements are punishable as perjury under 18 U.S.C. 1621. This collection found within my credit report is not related to any transaction that I made. I am alleging that a person or company- without my authorization- used my personal identifying information to apply for goods, services, or money ; and, was successful in creating some accounts.

My auto loan is with TD Auto Finance ( Acct Number : XXXX ) to which I have had had since XX/XX/XXXX with XXXX late payments. Additionally, my account was setup on auto draft as well. 

Over the month of XXXX I started getting phone calls from ( XXXX ) XXXX which is labeled as spam/scam with XXXX a XXXX I use called XXXX : XXXX : XXXX The calls were coming in roughly every other day until finally I answered the call on XX/XX/XXXX to find out it was TD Auto Finance. The collector immediately identified themself and let me know that my payment was delinquent. Within no less than XXXX seconds I went into my account saw the auto draft was no longer on and paid the past due amount. I asked the collector to research what had happened because I am never late. Shortly after, I received an alert from the bureaus that my score had dropped XXXX points due to a 30 day late payment reported by TD Auto Finance. I escalated the request to there support who researched the issue and there formal response was there was no bank error and I have an agreement in place and therefore its on me the consumer. They sent me XXXX piece of mail on XX/XX/XXXX which I didnt get until XX/XX/XXXX and continued to call me from a number that was registered as spam. 

I asked the bank to remove the negative mark to which they declined as they said it was not a bank error. I am only asking the bank to adhere to proper communication methods especially considering I have a proven track record of never missing payments and have the negative mark removed from my file.

On XX/XX/XXXX I put thru an external recurring transfer of {$160.00} into checking acct. On XXXX I received an email from valley stating the funds would be in my XXXX  acct in NC on that date. I waited that day it never came. On XXXX I called valley and they said transfer would take place in XXXX. I said I couldnt wait that long. I was walked thru the procedure to do another external transfer for one time only and then after that went thru to cancel the recurring transfer. I did exactly what the rep told me. On XXXX I checked my valley acct and saw the {$160.00} was taken out but it wasnt in my XXXX  acct. I also saw that another {$160.00} was taken out of my acct which only had a balance of {$7.00} along with a {$30.00} overdraft fee. This left my acct with a negative {$180.00} balance. I immediately called valley and spoke with XXXX who said she would straighten out. A few days later I received two transfers of {$160.00} to my XXXX acct. I did not get the {$7.00} balance nor a chargeback of the {$30.00} fee. I never heard of any back approving 2 {$160.00} transfers when there was only {$7.00} in that acct. I proceeded exactly as the valley rep told me and due to her incorrect info was charged {$30.00}. I told valley if I didnt receive the {$30.00} by XX/XX/XXXX I would file this complaint. I had to write a check from XXXX for {$190.00} and mobile deposit in my valley acct in NJ because valley told me I would continually get recharged {$30.00} until the acct had a positive balance. I cant understand why valley wouldn't have emailed or texted or called to inquire. Why would I try to take {$160.00} out of an account that I just received {$160.00} from knowing the balance was {$7.00}. This is ludacrious.

_source.complaint_what_happened: I reviewed my Consumer Reports and noticed that I had two late payments on an account that I was never late for.
