However, after reviewing my records, I am unable to find any documentation of any contractual relationship between and me which makes you a person entitled to enforce a commercial claim against me. This letter is not a request for verification or validation. This is a request for proof of contract to substantiate your claim. 
Provide me with a certified copy of an original contract, with my signature, specifically naming your company as a person entitled to enforce a commercial claim against me. Certification can be done through the presence of a notary public, who duly swears the copy made is in fact a copy of the original paper contract in question. Failure to respond and provide strict proof of contract will constitute your tactic agreement that you, and, are not entitled to enforce a claim against me. In the event, you continue your collection efforts against me without providing proof of contract, I will file a complaint with the Attorney General and Federal Trade Commission, and file a police report against you for harassment and invasion of privacy. 
You have 30 days to provide strict proof of contract. In the event, you can not provide strict proof of contract, you must cease and desist all collection efforts and immediately remove any derogatory information reported to the consumer reporting agencies. If you transfer this account to an attorney without providing proof of contract, he will be immediately reported to the State Bar Association and XXXX XXXX XXXX for code of ethics violations.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I took out a TD retail card for XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX for {$4100.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. 

The account has the wrong mailing address and wrong last name. Furthermore, none of my 3 payments were processed. I was not informed of this by the company, instead I got a XXXX XXXX notice several months later in XXXX that my score decreased by XXXX points. I was also unaware that I had the following charges : - XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  I was charged {$29.00} late fee - XX/XX/XXXX I was charged {$40.00} late fee - XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  I was charged {$40.00} late fee Total : {$100.00} This is predatory and fraudulent because I did not receive any emails that the payments did not go through or that I had late fees. However, I received confirmation emails the 3 times I submitted payment that each payment was processed. Due to the credit company 's OWN error of having the wrong mailing address, I never received any paper notices that money was past due. I thought this whole time that I was in good standing, and not aware of the issues until AFTER the card services reported 2 missed payments. 

- XXXX, paid {$440.00} over the phone to bring my account to good standing so I could update my address. I was told they could reach out to the credit bureau to remove the false late payments. Customer service could not tell me why the payments were not processed, and blamed this on me. 
- XX/XX/XXXX, called to confirm the payment was processed, and was told my address was still incorrect, I owe more money, and that the company does not contact the credit bureaus. 

Prior to this I submitted payment : - XX/XX/XXXX {$1000.00}, email confirmed received XXXX, {$800.00}, email confirmed received XXXX, {$1000.00}, email confirmed received Total : {$2800.00} I am requesting that all late fees be reimbursed, that the 2 late payments be permanently removed from my credit report, and that my credit score be adjusted to what it was prior to those 2 marks. 

I have never missed a payment in over 7 years, this is the first incident, and it is not even my fault. My highest score in XXXX was XXXX before all this. I appreciate your understanding and help to resolve this dispute and reinstate my correct credit score.

_source.complaint_what_happened: I use online bill pay. I established a new recipient within my banking system on XXXX XXXX, providing all required data ( e.g., account info, address, phone, etc. ). I scheduled a payment and noted the " due date '' was XXXX XXXX. My expectation was the check would be received by the recipient within a day or two of XXXX XXXX, understanding that XXXX XXXX is a Friday and perhaps mail would be delayed by a day or two. On XXXX XXXX, the recipient emailed to note they had not received the check. I called the bank to inquire. The bank confirmed the recipient was established on XXXX XXXX and a check was issued and mailed via US Mail on XXXX XXXX. On XXXX XXXX, I will incur a late fee penalty, unless I pay electronically at additional expense. This " delay '' in check receipt has happened at least three times in the last two months. My primary complaint is that I established a due date based on my billing cycle and communicated that to the bank. The bank established when a check would be sent to achieve that due date ( within reason ). However, the system isn't working well and the bank is essentially shrugging their shoulders and blaming the US Mail. The bank did agree to pay any late fee ( if requested ) after they conduct an investigation. Which means I would have to initiate that for each occurrence and hope they accept responsibility - I have my doubts.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I spent 2.5 hours on the phone between XXXX XXXX XXXX and Bank of America trying to prove this phantom debt was not real. I want to file a compliant with CFPB for fraudulent activity by the third party acting on behalf of Bank Of America. They are pursuing innocent people and are committing mail fraud and wire fraud trying to collect non existent debts. 

On XX/XX/2024 and XX/XX/XXXX I received an automated call from ( XXXX ) XXXX. The message was prerecorded used the reference number XXXX. The message said : " Call us regarding this urgent matter. '' They did not provide a name of the business or any other details. I called back. The agent found the case and said I had an outstanding balance of {$8600.00} that had to be paid in full today to avoid being sued. They claimed I signed a waiver that allowed the lender to put a lien on my property and or garnish wages. I had until XX/XX/XXXX to pay this amount. They claimed they were the company hired by Bank of America 's lawyers to confirm the debt. 
The first agent I spoke with could not give me any verifying information about the debt other than the amount and the originating creditor. She transferred me to the " Lead Arbitrator '' who was hostile and yelling that they were trying to help me by allowing me the opportunity to pay in full today. When I told her I did not have any or ever had any delinquent accounts through Bank Of America or its credit partners, she told me if I kept being argumentative, she was going to hang up on me. 

I have attached the copy they emailed me at my request because I had not received supposed letters thy had mailed to us on 3 other attempts to inform us of this debt. They claimed they were not collection agency but clearly in the letter attached to this file- they ask for money and provide an online payment portal and even text to pay phone number.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX NC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Division TD Bank [ Address ] [ City, State, ZIP Code ] Dispute of Collection on Credit Report To Whom This May Concern I XXXX XXXX I hope this letter finds you in good health. I am writing to dispute a collection entry on my credit report, which I believe is inaccurately associated with my credit history. 

I recently reviewed my credit report from the three major credit bureaus, namely XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. To my surprise, I discovered a collection account that does not belong to me. I would like to bring to your attention that this entry violates the following consumer protection laws : 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The FCRA mandates that credit bureaus maintain accurate and up-to-date information on consumers ' credit reports. In this case, the collection entry is erroneous and does not reflect my credit history accurately. 

2. Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : The FDCPA prohibits debt collectors from engaging in unfair, deceptive, or abusive practices. This includes reporting inaccurate information to credit bureaus, which has negatively impacted my creditworthiness. 

3. Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) : Under the FCBA, consumers have the right to dispute inaccurate charges and billing errors. The collection entry in question does not pertain to any debt that I have incurred, and therefore, it should be removed from my credit report. 

4. Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act ( FACTA ) : The FACTA ensures that consumers have access to their credit reports and have the ability to dispute inaccurate information. I have taken the necessary steps to review my credit report and am exercising my right to dispute this collection entry. 

I request that TD Bank, as the creditor, take immediate action to investigate and rectify this error. I kindly ask that you provide me with a written response within 30 days, acknowledging the receipt of this dispute and informing me of the actions taken to resolve the matter. 

In addition, I urge TD Bank to notify the credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ) of the inaccuracy and request the removal of the collection entry from my credit reports. This action is essential in ensuring the accuracy of my credit history and maintaining my financial reputation. 

Please find attached copies of supporting documents, such as credit report excerpts highlighting the erroneous collection entry, as well as any other relevant information that may assist in the investigation process. 

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Should you require any further information or documentation, please do not hesitate to contact me at the provided phone number or email address. 

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation. 

Consumer Financial Protection Division TD Bank

_source.complaint_what_happened: In XX/XX/XXXX, I requested services from an independent vendor on the XXXX platform for an original policy and procedure for the State of Maryland Developmental Disabilities Administration Comar Regulation - application requirements. Upon receipt/delivery of the finished work, I read through the document and immediately recognized that the documentation wasn't at all what I made my request for. It was a generic policy and procedure for a home care agency, which isn't what I requested. I provided the vendor with the exact list of what was to be included within the policy and procedure to be in compliance with the state of Maryland Comar regulations and receive a license to become a provider. I immediately contacted the vendor via the XXXX platform to request a FULL REFUND because I was not at all satisfied with the work and it didn't even meet the State of Maryland 's requirement. On XX/XX/XXXX the vendor, XXXX agreed to cancel the order and give me a refund. On the same day, I filed a dispute with Discover to ensure the this complaint was on record with them and that I wanted to get a FULL REFUND from the vendor and FIVERR. In to the complaint with Discover, I provided them with proof of the via XXXX communication with the vendor that he would give me a refund. On XX/XX/XXXX this message was posted to my Discover account " Dispute Resolved, Credit has been reversed. We have reversed a credit transaction which was previously applied to your account. This was done either because the merchant also issued a credit to your account, or because you recently requested us to close the investigation. Accordingly, we have placed the charge back on your account. '' Unfortunately, I didn't receive the credit from the merchant/XXXX and Discover didn't ultimately didn't reverse the charge of {$670.00} back to my credit card account. I have contacted Discover about the charge and my dispute, but they are refusing the do anything not even call back.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/2024, I went to the Bank of America branch located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  to open a joint account with my wife. We were looking to open our first joint account and were looking for offers to take advantage of when doing so. 

When we found an offer at Bank of America, a bank we both already have accounts with, we decided to open our joint account with them as well for the sake of simplicity. We set an appointment with a banker there and she quickly and easily created our joint account using information from our previous ones, and she assured us we would be eligible to receive {$200.00} through the offer if we receive atleast {$2000.00} in direct deposits over the next two months. 

On XX/XX/2024, I received {$2800.00} in direct deposit from my workplace to the new joint checking account. 

When I called the support number today, XX/XX/2024, to ask about the promotional offer status, they said I was not eligible since I already had an account with the Bank of America and there was nothing they could do. I then went to the branch where I opened the account and got to speak with the same banker, and she admitted that the system she used to enroll me in the offer doesn't catch if someone is ineligible and their branch encountered this situation 3-4 times already. I asked if they have any way of resolving the situation, and she said no, but she can bring her manager to apologize.

_source.complaint_what_happened: Subject : Urgent Request for Documentation and Action Regarding Unauthorized Inquiry and Security Interest Dear Bank Of America, I am writing to address a concerning matter regarding an inquiry reported by Bank of America, which lacks permissible purpose and, as such, constitutes potential identity fraud. Per my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Sections 604 and 605B, I am requesting immediate action to rectify this situation. Firstly, I require documentation proving that I provided express written consent for Bank Of America to report the inquiry in question. As there is no evidence of such consent or a court order, I must assert that this inquiry lacks legitimacy and is thus subject to removal. Per the FCRA Section 605B, a consumer reporting agency must block the reporting of any information resulting from alleged identity theft when identified by the consumer. Therefore, I am formally notifying Bank Of America to remove this inquiry from my file within four business days. Furthermore, it has come to my attention that Bank Of America neglected to inform me of my right to rescission, as outlined in the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), specifically Regulation Z ( 12 CFR 1026.23 ). This allows me to revoke any rights waived, particularly those related to the security interest. I am requesting the CUSIP number associated with the security interest provided to Bank Of America. Failure to provide this information will leave me with no alternative but to initiate a level 3 audit on my account. I expect prompt compliance with these requests to avoid further escalation of this matter. Failure to do so will be regarded as willful noncompliance and may result in legal action. Please provide confirmation of receipt of this letter and a timeline for resolution of these issues.

_source.complaint_what_happened: Had a boat loan with Bank of the West. They recently sold to BMO Harris, so now BMO is handling our loan. We received a NC UCC statement yesterday and inquired what it was about. They told us that BMO filed a lien against our name and to contact them to see why. When we contacted BMO, we were told that it was a mistake and shouldn't have been filed, so we asked for a letter stating that the lien was removed and it was an error on their part. They wouldn't provide us with this letter and instead said a manager would call us back. They never called back. To try to disassociate with this bank because of this situation, I logged in to make a lump sum payment to pay off this loan with them. I was informed that they would only allow a {$25000.00} payment to be made and that I couldn't make the whole {$45000.00} payment. So I paid the {$25000.00} payment and it immediately locked my account. I've made a payment from this same account in the past and they had no problem when it was a regular monthly payment but because it was such a large payment I was told that they had to verify my identity. Upon calling to do so, I was told that it was verified but would take XXXX days for them to process the hold on my account on the back end. So now not only can I not make a payment, it is probably going to be late due to them locking my account. I've spend countless hours contacting them for help and no one is willing to help me. I need someone to step in and make this bank do what they're suppose to do. Thank you!

_source.product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
_source.complaint_what_happened:
BANK OF AMERICA IS IN VIOLATION OF THE CODES : 15 U.S. Code 1681 - Congressional findings and statement of purpose a ) Accuracy and fairness of credit reporting The Congress makes the following findings : ( 4 ) There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. 
( b ) Reasonable procedures It is the purpose of this subchapter to require that consumer reporting agencies adopt reasonable procedures for meeting the needs of commerce for consumer credit, personnel, insurance, and other information in a manner which is fair and equitable to the consumer, with regard to the confidentiality, accuracy, relevancy, and proper utilization of such information in accordance with the requirements of this subchapter. 
As you can see there is a need to protect your right to privacy. 
Important Definitions from 15 U.S. Code 1681a - Definitions ; rules of construction The term consumer reporting agency means any person which, for monetary fees, dues, or on a cooperative nonprofit basis, regularly engages in whole or in part in the practice of assembling or evaluating consumer credit information or other information on consumers for the purpose of furnishing consumer reports to third parties, and which uses any means or facility of interstate commerce for the purpose of preparing or furnishing consumer reports. 
The term consumer means an individual. 
The term consumer report means any written, oral, or other communication of any information by a consumer reporting agency bearing on a consumers credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living ( 2 ) Exclusions ( A ) ( i ) report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report ; Reporting Transaction history is illegal 15 U.S. Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. 
They need your written consent to add anything to your consumer report if you did not give this authorization that is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act P.L 90-321 ( 82 Stat. 146 ) which is law law that backes the code is even stricter as it states that any agency can only get your report in response to a request by the head of a State or local child support enforcement agency ( or a State or local government official authorized by the head of such an agency ) 15 U.S. Code 1681c - Requirements relating to information contained in consumer reports Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information : Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. 
No adverse item besides the conviction of crimes should be on your report any item that is a derogatory mark is not allowed into consumer reports this is another violation 12 CFR 1022.3 Definitions Identity theft means a fraud committed or attempted using the identifying information of another person without authority. 
Anything added to your report without your written consent could be considered Identity theft 15 U.S. Code 1681c2 - Block of information resulting from identity theft Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer ; ( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report ; ( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer. 

If you chose to list that in your complaint YOU MUST provide the information listed above. Identity theft reports can be filed with the Federal Trade Commission on their website 15 U.S. Code 1681e - Compliance procedures ( a ) Identity and purposes of credit users Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. These procedures shall require that prospective users of the information identify themselves, certify the purposes for which the information is sought, and certify that the information will be used for no other purpose. Every consumer reporting agency shall make a reasonable effort to verify the identity of a new prospective user and the uses certified by such prospective user prior to furnishing such user a consumer report. No consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report to any person if it has reasonable grounds for believing that the consumer report will not be used for a purpose listed in section 1681b of this title. 
( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 
By violating section 1681b for permissible purpose and 1681c for information contained in consumer reports they are also violating compliance procedures under this title.

15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance ( a ) In general Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ; If you can prove they wilfully violated the act you are entitled to at least 1,000 $ per violation plus any other damages you have sustained as a result of their failure to follow the law. If you have to file more than 1 complaint, wilful noncompliance can easily be proven as they had a full understanding of the violations after you complained the 1st time. 

Every company in their agreements with consumers said they would follow the law and agreed to do so.They are aware that they are breaking the law. 
15 U.S. Code 1681o - Civil liability for negligent noncompliance In general Any person who is negligent in failing to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure Negligent noncompliance means the law was violated not on purpose but just due to a lack of knowledge on the required reporting procedures. 
15 U.S. Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( 1 ) Prohibition ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 
( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. 
Once you notify the consumer agencies that there is inaccurate information they must immediately stop reporting that information until they can prove that it is valid. 
Those are a few violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act that you can use in your complaint against not only the reporting agencies but the furnisher of that information to them. 
Privacy Act of 1974 ( 5 U.S. Code 552a ) Important Definitions ( 4 ) the term record means any item, collection, or grouping of information about an individual that is maintained by an agency, including, but not limited to, his education, financial transactions, medical history, and criminal or employment history and that contains his name, or the identifying number, symbol, or other identifying particular assigned to the individual, such as a finger or voice print or a photograph ; This includes consumer reports ( b ) Conditions of Disclosure.No agency shall disclose any record which is contained in a system of records by any means of communication to any person, or to another agency, except pursuant to a written request by, or with the prior written consent of, the individual to whom the record pertains, unless disclosure of the record would be ( 12 ) to a consumer reporting agency in accordance with section 3711 ( e ) of title 31. 
Again they need prior written instruction of the individual to whom it relates. 
Section 3711 ( e ) of title 31 States ( 1 ) When trying to collect a claim of the Government under a law except the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 ( 26 U.S.C. 1 et seq. ), the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency shall disclose to a consumer reporting agency information from a system of records that a person is responsible for a claim if ( E ) the head of the agency has established procedures to ( iii ) get satisfactory assurances from each consumer reporting agency that the agency is complying with all laws of the United States related to providing consumer credit information ; and Either way they have violated not only the Fair Credit Reporting Act but also the Privacy Act of 1974 Opt Out Laws PART 1016 - PRIVACY OF CONSUMER FINANCIAL INFORMATION ( REGULATION P ) 12 CFR 1016.1 Purpose and scope. 
( a ) Purpose. This part governs the treatment of nonpublic personal information about consumers by the financial institutions listed in paragraph ( b ) of this section. This part : ( 1 ) Requires a financial institution to provide notice to customers about its privacy policies and practices ; ( 2 ) Describes the conditions under which a financial institution may disclose nonpublic personal information about consumers to nonaffiliated third parties ; and ( 3 ) Provides a method for consumers to prevent a financial institution from disclosing that information to most nonaffiliated third parties by opting out of that disclosure, subject to the exceptions in 1016.13, 1016.14, and 1016.15. 


Every company owes you a privacy notice before they furnish any information to our consumer report 12 CFR 1016.4 Initial privacy notice to consumers required. 
( a ) Initial notice requirement. You must provide a clear and conspicuous notice that accurately reflects your privacy policies and practices to : ( 1 ) Customer. An individual who becomes your customer, not later than when you establish a customer relationship, except as provided in paragraph ( e ) of this section; and ( 2 ) Consumer. A consumer, before you disclose any nonpublic personal information about the consumer to any nonaffiliated third party, 12 CFR 1016.7 Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods. Section ( a ) ( 1 ) Form of opt out notice. If you are required to provide an opt out notice under 1016.10 ( a ), you must provide a clear and conspicuous notice to each of your consumers that accurately explains the right to opt out under that section. The notice must state : ( i ) That you disclose or reserve the right to disclose nonpublic personal information about your consumer to a nonaffiliated third party ; ( ii ) That the consumer has the right to opt out of that disclosure; and ( iii ) A reasonable means by which the consumer may exercise the opt out right. 
( 2 ) Examples ( ii ) Reasonable opt out means. You provide a reasonable means to exercise an opt out right if you : ( A ) Designate check-off boxes in a prominent position on the relevant forms with the opt out notice ; ( B ) Include a reply form together with the opt out notice that, in the case of financial institutions described in 1016.3 ( l ) ( 3 ) of this part, includes the address to which the form should be mailed ; ( C ) Provide an electronic means to opt out, such as a form that can be sent via electronic mail or a process at your Web site, if the consumer agrees to the electronic delivery of information ; or ( D ) Provide a toll-free telephone number that consumers may call to opt out. 
( iii ) Unreasonable opt out means. You do not provide a reasonable means of opting out if : ( A ) The only means of opting out is for the consumer to write his or her own letter to exercise that opt out right; or ( B ) The only means of opting out as described in any notice subsequent to the initial notice is to use a check-off box that you provided with the initial notice but did not include with the subsequent notice. 
( g ) Time to comply with opt out. You must comply with a consumer 's opt out direction as soon as reasonably practicable after you receive it. 
( h ) Continuing right to opt out. A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. 
( i ) Duration of consumer 's opt out direction. 
( 1 ) A consumer 's direction to opt out under this section is effective until the consumer revokes it in writing or, if the consumer agrees, electronically. 

15 U.S. Code 6802 - Obligations with respect to disclosures of personal information ( a ) Notice requirements Except as otherwise provided in this subchapter, a financial institution may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information, unless such financial institution provides or has provided to the consumer a notice that complies with section 6803 of this title. 
( b ) Opt out ( 1 ) In general A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to the consumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. 
Once again they must give you an opt out notice for anything that is to be added to your consumer report. 
15 U.S. Code 6805 - Enforcement ( a ) In general Subject to subtitle B of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 [ 12 U.S.C. 5511 et seq. ], this subchapter and the regulations prescribed thereunder shall be enforced by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection, the Federal functional regulators, the State insurance authorities, and the Federal Trade Commission with respect to financial institutions and other persons subject to their jurisdiction under applicable law, You have the right to opt out of anything on your report at any time and the companies must comply as soon as reasonably practicable after you send them a notice. They have given you unreasonable means to opt out so you will have to write your own letter directing them to stop reporting in accordance with the laws listed above. 
Consumer Finance Protection Bureau

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I can not even begin to describe my nightmare experience with this company. After repeated attempts to validate my debt and merely ask questions about the amount ( for example, my card had a $ XXXX limit ; why do I owe more than {$5600.00}? ), I have never received anything from them detailing this information. 
When this suit was initially filed, I was working with a Debt Consolidation company ( XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) and was represented by XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX who responded on my behalf ( In fact, I contacted XXXX several times and was told they could NOT speak with me ). I have emails from XXXX XXXX detailing their negotiations with XXXX ; I emailed them detailed information about my situation, why the account went behind, inability to pay, etc. yet when I had to go to court for this upon being SUED, they LIED and said they NEVER heard from me- a bold lie ; in court! 
To make matters worse, I lost my job the same month I was served with this " lawsuit '', which is a tragic waste of taxpayer time, dollars, and has taken a significant toll on my health. 
Now, after becoming re-employed and getting one singular check, I called XXXX ready to pay and make this go away- EVEN THOUGH they have still not validated the debt per my request. I even made two small payments in good faith to them, when I had NO INCOME. I spent hours speaking with the settlement team only to be lied to, manipulated and refused. Each rep had a different " policy '', " lowest amount '' etc. they could offer. Just more continuous lies and deceitful practices. One rep abruptly said " why didn't get get a job and pay this? '' I informed her that I did and am also a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX raising XXXX children, she said " yeah nobody wants to flip burgers at XXXX XXXX XXXX but there are lots of things out there to do '' and finally, " couldn't you take a semester off and get a job to pay for this? '' Oh and like many others have reported, they urged me to get a loan, or ask family and friends for money, and that my credit will be ruined from the judgement. Thankfully, their calls are monitored and recorded according to an associate attorney, and will hopefully be made available as I believe they are in numerous violations of consumer protection policies. 
The worst part is I have made it explicitly clear from DAY ONE that I want to settle this. Why do they take people in vulnerable situations, shame them, drag them through court and so on? Just for the hope of getting more money? 
It's sickening. As hard as this year has been for me and so many others, my heart breaks for these people who would be so unethical in their pursuit.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
In XX/XX/XXXX, my Mother noticed there were deposits coming into her checking account via XXXX. These deposits were from companies that my Mother has never had any type of relationship with. 

We spoke with XXXX XXXX at the XXXX XXXX. He suggested that we reach out to the three companies that made the erroneous deposits. These companies were SC XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX SC and XXXX XXXX. No one at these companies was willing to assist me as I could not supply an account number for them to reference. 

We went back to XXXX XXXX who said all he could do was request the ACH deposits be returned. 12 of the original 15 were reversed on XX/XX/XXXX. Before the returns were processed, a fourth company began depositing by XXXX. More deposits from various companies continued to be made, totaling over {$30000.00}, through XX/XX/XXXX. 

We opened a new checking account on XX/XX/XXXX. It took several months to transfer all direct deposits and automatic drafts for bills to the new account. During this time, numerous deposits continued, as mentioned above. 

In XXXX, I came into the XXXX XXXX and met with XXXX XXXX, with whom we had continued to communicate. We transferred {$3900.00} which was rightfully my Mother 's, into the new account on XX/XX/XXXX, leaving over {$10000.00} in the old account. 

During that visit, XXXX and I compiled a list of the deposits that should be returned in order to close the old account. After months of worry and believing the bank would do their due diligence, we moved on. 

In XXXX, I received a call from XXXX XXXX. He stated that the bank had exhausted all avenues in returning the remaining funds but there was still {$8700.00} remaining in the old account. We could take a check or the bank would retain the funds. We took a check. 

On Monday, XX/XX/XXXX, there were XXXX separate transactions from XXXX XXXX, totaling {$9400.00}, which were debited from my Mother 's new account via XXXX, with no authorization from either my Mother or myself. These amounts were some of the deposits that the bank should have returned in XX/XX/XXXX. We believed, in good faith, that " all attempts had been exhausted ''. 

A fraud claim was filed for each of the 24 transactions on Wednesday, XX/XX/XXXX, as soon as we were notified that a check my Mother had written was going to be returned and we learned of the unauthorized debits. The old checking account has nothing to do with the new checking account and is not linked in any way.

USAA bank offers fixed rate CDs. When I purchased my CD, I was told by the representative that I could speak to the service department and have the CD changed so that it would not automatically renew. When I contacted the service department on XX/XX/2023, they indicated that I could not change the CD to not automatically renew until the 10-day grace period. Additionally, documents on their website at https : //www.usaa.com/inet/wc/advice-finances-everything-to-know-about-cds say the following : " When your CD matures, or the term ends, you receive your deposited money plus the interest you earned along the wayunless you decide to renew the CD for another term. You also have the option of reinvesting your money into a new CD with a different term. '' This is apparently false, instead it should read : When your CD matures, or the term ends, you WIL NOT receive your deposited money plus the interest you earned along the wayunless you decide to NOT renew the CD for another term. Your CD WILL BE AUTOMATICALLY SET UP TO REINVEST your money into a new CD with a different term. IF YOU CHOOSE NOT TO REINVEST, YOU MUST LET USAA KNOW WITHIN THE 10-DAY GRACE PERIOD PRIOR TO THE RENEWAL DATE.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Summary : First National Bank classified my second home as an investment property. They are now telling me, due to this erroneous classification, I need 35 % equity in the home in order to eliminate PMI, despite the fact that all the loan documentation I signed at closing indicates 20 % ( and it auto terminates at 22 % on XX/XX/XXXX ). 
At no time during the lending, closing, etc. process was there a discussion about 35 % equity to eliminate PMI. In fact, my original Loan Officer has confirmed she has never even heard of such a requirement. 
I have tried for a month to get this resolved and I can barely get anyone respond. 

Details : On XX/XX/XXXX, I reached out to my lender ( First National Bank ) indicating I wanted to cancel PMI and requesting information on what I needed to do to get the process started for proving I have > 20 % equity in the home. I am attaching an email ( Exhibit_A ) showing the the entire conversation with my original Loan Officer. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a call back from XXXX ( mortgage servicing dept. ). 
He indicated I needed to have 35 % equity in the home since it was done as an investment property, versus the 20 % as indicated by my loan docs and my direct Loan Officer. I told him that's not what I agreed to and asked him to escalate the request. He said he would get back to me later that day. Since then, I have left a few voicemails and he has never returned a single call. 

I continued to try and work through my original Loan Officer to obtain a resolution. On XX/XX/XXXX, she indicated she received a response that I needed 35 % and that " they '' are sending me a letter. She said she has never heard of a 35 % requirement and neither has anyone else in her office ; therefore there's no way this was ever communicated to me. Again, the loan documentation I signed clearly states PMI can be canceled at 80 % ( and will auto terminate at 78 % ). To date, I have never received a letter. 

Finally, today ( XX/XX/XXXX ), as I type this complaint, I received a follow-up call from XXXX ( mortgage servicing dept. XXXX XXXX 's superior ). She is telling me I need 35 % equity to eliminate PMI and there's nothing she can do except escalate the issue to someone higher. 

Again, my loan documentation ( attached ) clearly states I need 20 %, not 35 %, to cancel PMI. The bank is refusing to make this right and take the necessary steps to correct the issue they caused. Given it's been almost a month without any resolution, I have very little confidence FNB will provide a satisfactory response. Satisfactory = tell me what steps I need to take to prove 20 % equity and then eliminate the PMI.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
PNCs Bank Secrecy Act ( BSA ) / Anti-Money Laundering ( AML ) and Sanctions program is a domain within Enterprise Compliance, with the chief AML officer reporting directly to the chief risk officer ( CRO ). The enterprise policy for the program aligns with regulatory requirements and provides governance and oversight of PNC business units. The program sets forth minimum BSA/AML and sanctions standards designed to ensure that PNC is providing compliant products and services and conducting business activities in compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulatory guidance. The chief AML officer provides program updates to multiple committees throughout the year. 

Punishments for international fraud can vary depending on the type of crime and the jurisdiction : Wire fraud A federal crime in the United States, wire fraud can result in up to 20 years in prison and {$250000.00} in fines. If the crime affects a financial institution, the penalty can increase to 30 years in prison and {$1.00} million in fines. 
Anti-Money Laundering ( AML ) sanctions Violations of AML sanctions can result in serious legal consequences, including fines of up to {$20.00} XXXX and imprisonment for up to 30 years. 

Fraud is considered to be false representation, dishonesty, or deceit, and can break both civil and criminal law.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/2024, I formally terminated my car contract using commercial paper. Concurrently, I revoked my Power of Attorney through a notarized revocation. Additionally, I dispatched a certified letter on the same date, exercising my rights under 15 USC 6802, explicitly opting out of reporting to any reporting agencies. 

Despite these actions, the company continued to report on my credit, thereby violating my consumer rights. They disseminated my information to multiple non-affiliated entities, which are not authorized credit reporting agencies ( XXXX and XXXX are reporting agencies, not credit bureaus ; the only credit bureau in the United States is the CFPB ). 

Furthermore, my Social Security number was transmitted to non-affiliated third parties without my consent. The term " nonaffiliated third party '' refers to any entity that is neither an affiliate nor related by common ownership or corporate control with the financial institution. 

The company has also sent unmarked letters in an attempt to collect a fictitious debt, which was already satisfied through UCC Tender of Payment. This constitutes fraud and harassment. Additionally, they have placed harassing phone calls despite my explicit instruction in a certified letter that all communication must be in writing. 

This behavior appears to be systemic within the company, suggesting a need for a forensic audit for securities fraud in addition to their routine violation of consumer rights as part of their daily operations.
_source.sub_issue: Reporting company used your report improperly

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Bank of America regarding their recent actions, which I believe to be retaliatory and detrimental to my credit restoration efforts. Below, I have outlined the events and concerns in detail : XXXX. Submission of Complaint : On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a formal complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) regarding issues I have been facing with Bank of America 's practices related to my credit. 
XXXX. Bank of Americas Response : On XX/XX/year>, Bank of America contacted me to acknowledge that they had received the complaint. 
XXXX. Unauthorized Withdrawal : On XX/XX/year>, Bank of America withdrew {$1100.00} from my bank account without my knowledge or consent. This unauthorized withdrawal appears to be in direct retaliation to the complaint I submitted. 
This unauthorized action by Bank of America has had several significant impacts : Financial Disruption : The unexpected withdrawal of {$1100.00} has jeopardized other scheduled bank drafts, causing potential overdrafts and additional financial stress. 
Lack of Communication : Bank of America did not inform me of their intention to withdraw these funds, exacerbating the situation and demonstrating a lack of transparency and communication. 
Retaliatory Nature : The timing and nature of this withdrawal suggest that it was retaliatory, stemming from my complaint to the CFPB. This raises serious concerns about the bank 's commitment to ethical practices and accountability. 
Additionally, Bank of America has consistently failed to take responsibility for the inaccurate information reported by credit bureaus. Their refusal to address these inaccuracies continues to harm my credit standing and overall financial health. 
I urge the CFPB to investigate this matter thoroughly. It is crucial to ensure that financial institutions adhere to fair practices and do not engage in retaliatory actions against consumers who exercise their right to submit complaints. 
Please find attached all relevant documents, including a copy of my initial complaint, Bank of America 's response, and evidence of the unauthorized withdrawal from my account. 
Thank you for your attention to this serious matter. I look forward to a prompt and just resolution.
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

I am unable to access my PNC demand checking account, credit card accounts, and mortgage accounts via the PNC 's online portal ( website ). This a recurring problem and has been for years. Multiple complaints about PNC holding account access XXXX have not, as yet, been fruitless. 

PNC 's website demands that I provide its online banking system with my mobile number via a site-blocking pop up message. There is no option to decline, only to remind later meaning, at some point in the future I will again be denied access to my demand and credit accounts until I abide.

I explained my situation that I had to close my house and I could only do when the funds will be available. I have been calling 2-3 times every day, all they say is they do not know when the review will be completed and upon completion it will take 1-3 business days for my funds to be available. 

Their customer team is such a useless team, every time I call they give me a different answers every time. When I called them on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX  they informed that the transaction has been approved, after that information I informed my attorneys and agent that the transaction is successful and the funds will be available next day, on the same day I again called at XXXX only to realize that the review has not been completed and it is still being reviewed. I was literally fooled in front of other by savings team. I am under XXXX state and my mental state is not well because of this. Today XX/XX/XXXX I spoke to them for XXXX minutes ( at XXXX ), it has been 48 hours since I initiated my transaction on Monday ( XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX  ), and even after 48 hours they still can not answer me on whereabouts of my funds. They are still saying it is being reviewed whereas no one from savings team or reviewing team reached me as of now.

On XX/XX/XXXX, I filed an identity theft complaint with the CFPB regarding the furnishing of nonpublic personal information without my consent on my consumer report. They responded that the information furnished was acceptable in accordance to the cardmember agreement signed when the account was opened, however the Cardmember Agreement that I agreed to in XXXX of XXXX was agreed to under FALSE PRETENSES making the agreement a result of FRAUD. Prior to agreement, I was unaware that the payment history is nonpublic personal information and was under the impression that the terms of the contract were legal. In addition, I am now aware of 15 U.S. Code 6802 ( b ) and USC 6802 ( c ), which states that I, the consumer, am " given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' I was not provided neither the opportunity to opt out of disclosure of my information or an explanation of how I could exercise that option. Therefore, the transactions between Discover and myself, specifically the late payments, that were furnished on my consumer report are in violation of multiple consumer laws, including but not limited to USC 1681b Permissible purposes of consumer reports, and needs to be removed from my consumer report. It was not made clear to me that my nonpublic personal information, what Discover would call " payment history '', would be furnished, which according to consumer law is illegal.
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Bank of America regarding their recent actions, which I believe to be retaliatory and detrimental to my credit restoration efforts. Below, I have outlined the events and concerns in detail : 1. Submission of Complaint : On XX/XX/2024, I submitted a formal complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) regarding issues I have been facing with Bank of America 's practices related to my credit. 
2. Bank of Americas Response : On XX/XX/2024, Bank of America contacted me to acknowledge that they had received the complaint. 
3. Unauthorized Withdrawal : On XX/XX/2024, Bank of America withdrew {$1100.00} from my bank account without my knowledge or consent. This unauthorized withdrawal appears to be in direct retaliation to the complaint I submitted. 

This unauthorized action by Bank of America has had several significant impacts : Financial Disruption : The unexpected withdrawal of {$1100.00} has jeopardized other scheduled bank drafts, causing potential overdrafts and additional financial stress. 
Lack of Communication : Bank of America did not inform me of their intention to withdraw these funds, exacerbating the situation and demonstrating a lack of transparency and communication. 
Retaliatory Nature : The timing and nature of this withdrawal suggest that it was retaliatory, stemming from my complaint to the CFPB. This raises serious concerns about the bank 's commitment to ethical practices and accountability. 

Additionally, Bank of America has consistently failed to take responsibility for the inaccurate information reported by credit bureaus. Their refusal to address these inaccuracies continues to harm my credit standing and overall financial health. 
I urge the CFPB to investigate this matter thoroughly. It is crucial to ensure that financial institutions adhere to fair practices and do not engage in retaliatory actions against consumers who exercise their right to submit complaints. 

Please find attached all relevant documents, including a copy of my initial complaint, Bank of America 's response, and evidence of the unauthorized withdrawal from my account. 

Thank you for your attention to this serious matter. I look forward to a prompt and just resolution.
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

_source.complaint_what_happened: In XX/XX/2023, I called USAA Bank regarding a checking account being opened in my name using my information. No one in my family is in or involved with people from the military. They told me they would start investigating and they would close the account if they found it fraudulent. After a week I called back to make sure my account was being closed since I was still receiving emails stating changes being made in the fraudulent account. They asked me security questions, I'm assuming the other person set up then proceeded to tell me they could not let me know what the other person was doing even though it was all being done in my name, but they would investigate. I told them they had already said they were investigating and the person seemed to not know anything about it. They said they'd make a note for the fraud department so they could continue investigating. After about two weeks of going back a forth, and repeatedly verifying my identity, I stopped receiving emails for a while but never received any confirmation the account was closed. Fast forwarding to a week ago, I started receiving emails from the account again, the one I was told repeatedly was closed. I called them again and the lady told me they closed the checking account but not the main account. This wasn't true since I received an email regarding the checking account being active. I asked them to close all accounts associated with USAA so there was no longer an account in my name and she said she'd make a note of it for the fraud department. This means the first few people still hadn't made a note after months. I called again earlier this week, the week of XX/XX/XXXX, and I was told the same thing. The checking account should be closed but it's just the main account and they're not allowed to say anything else about it. They redirected the call to the fraud department and they told me, that the account should be being closed soon and to call back in a few days. It's been a few days now, and I have received another email about the person making changes to the account. This has been going on for months and it should have been closed when they told me they would close it back in XXXX.
_source.company_public_response: Company believes complaint represents an opportunity for improvement to better serve consumers

And there are multiple unauthorized charges I keep all my cards on the back in my case!! And I tried and tried to dispute this charge over and over again but they keep denying me over {$150.00} I tried 2 times already they keep turning me down OVER MY OWN MONEY This happened of XX/XX/2023

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I was a victim of a scam because a person under the alias of " XXXX XXXX '' emailed me under then impersonation mask of being a XXXX XXXX XXXX hiring manager. After obtaining my resume information from XXXX  XXXX then offered me a fake job as an XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

XXXX stated that XXXX 's accounting department would issue out company funds to pay for my work-from-home materials. I had suspicions because I have never worked for an employer that requests new employees to pay for their work equipment prior to working, so I created a separate checking account under my profile and named it XXXX XXXX XXXX, to eliminate confusion and ensure that my personal earned income was separate and secure from any XXXX related transactions. 

After the first company-issued check did not clear so that I could use the funds for my work-from home equipment, I contacted XXXX 's payroll and left a voicemail at XXXX, and requested verification that XXXX XXXX was an XXXX XXXX XXXX 's. I did not receive a call back from XXXX at or around that time. After not receiving my first payroll check, I contacted the FTC on XX/XX/XXXX and filed a complaint of XXXX 's bad business practices because I was concerned that future checks may not clear again. 

XXXX later emailed me an electronic check for mobile deposit on XX/XX/XXXX and assured me that it was Bank of America 's fault that the check did not clear because BOA did not request the funds quick enough. I retorted to XXXX that it was XXXX 's accounting department 's fault because they were not releasing the funds quickly enough after BOA had requested the funds. I contacted XXXX again and left another voicemail that requested verification of XXXX XXXX 's employment status. 

I received a phone call back from XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX confirming that XXXX XXXX was not an employee of XXXX 's and that I had not been hired as a XXXX employee, despite of my job offer letter. 

Now I can see that the funds were probably never there in the first place because the mobile deposit was returned on XX/XX/XXXX. Although I was already a victim, Bank of America 's risk management department attacked the personal credibility of my personal checking and savings accounts and placed them under forced closure, despite of my never opting in to activate overdraft protection. 

I even requested to go to the Bank of America in person to withdraw my personal funds for hardship reasons, since I have had to use my credit cards for household needs and groceries however my Bank of America denied my request to close my accounts in person. I have mailed supporting correspondence of my claim of being scammed to Bank of America and confirmed that the correspondence was received on XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX XXXX number XXXX ). Today is XX/XX/XXXX and the bank will still not close my account and issue a XXXX XXXX  asap to my mailing address. My funds have been frozen since XX/XX/XXXX and I still have XXXX children to support and a part-time job to get to. 

I would like for this forced financial hardship to be publicized so that consumers can see that Bank of America treats victimized consumers like hardened criminals when they have fallen victim to scam artist practices.
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

_source.product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
_source.complaint_what_happened:
Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 USC 1681 Section 602 ( a ) states, " Consumer reporting agencies must exercise their responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and respect for the consumers privacy. '' XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX are such agencies, and as a consumer, I am entitled to ensure my private information is not shared. This right is supported by 15 USC 6801, which asserts, " ConXXXX 's policy is that financial institutions have a continuing obligation to respect customer privacy and protect the security and confidentiality of nonpublic personal information. '' XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) qualifies as a financial institution under this section.

According to 15 USC 1681 Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ), " A consumer reporting agency may provide a consumer report only in accordance with the consumers written instructions. '' XXXX XXXX XXXX the financial institution and XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX do not have my consent, whether verbal, non-verbal, written, implied, or otherwise, to furnish my information. Any and all forms of consent previously granted to these agencies are revoked.

Additionally, 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) requires that " A financial institution must not disclose nonpublic personal information to nonaffiliated third parties unless the consumer is informed about how to exercise their nondisclosure option. '' XXXX XXXX XXXX, have not provided me with this information. Furthermore, 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) stipulates that " No consumer reporting agency may include adverse items of information, other than criminal convictions, that are more than seven years old. '' The reporting of this adverse item without my permission is unlawful.

15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) mandates that " No person shall furnish information to a consumer reporting agency if they know or have reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. '' 15 U.S. Code 1681e requires consumer reporting agencies to " maintain reasonable procedures to avoid violations of section 1681c and limit reports to the purposes specified in section 1681b. '' XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX are not adhering to these reasonable procedures. Lastly, 12 CFR 1016.7 allows consumers to " opt out at any time. '' Therefore, I am opting out of your reporting services.
_source.sub_issue: Reporting company used your report improperly

_source.complaint_what_happened:
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Discover Financial Services XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Notice of Dispute Regarding Inaccurate Reporting Dear Discover Financial Services, I am writing to formally dispute the allegation that I was late on my credit card payment in XXXX of XXXX, specifically regarding an alleged minimum payment due of {$100.00}. I believe this information is inaccurate and has been reported incorrectly to the credit bureaus. 

I request that you provide verifiable proof of this late payment. Please note that mere statements indicating a late payment are not considered sufficient evidence. I require documentation that clearly demonstrates the date and amount of the alleged late payment, including any records of communication that support your claim. 

If you fail to provide satisfactory proof, I will expect the erroneous information to be corrected in my credit report.

Furthermore, I would like to bring to your attention the potential financial implications for Discover Financial Services should I choose to proceed with arbitration regarding this dispute. Below is an itemized list of potential losses you may incur : 1. **Arbitration Fees** : {$500.00} ( average cost of arbitration ) 2. **Legal Fees** : {$2000.00} ( estimated legal costs for representation ) 3. **Potential Settlement Costs** : {$1500.00} ( in case of an unfavorable ruling ) XXXX. **Loss of Business** : {$5000.00} ( projected loss from customers who XXXX choose to switch due to negative publicity ) XXXX. **Administrative Costs** : {$300.00} ( costs related to the dispute process ) **Total Estimated Loss** : {$9300.00} I hope to resolve this matter amicably and expect a prompt response within 30 days. Thank you for your attention to this serious issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Discover Financial Services Subject : Notice of Dispute Regarding Inaccurate Reporting Dear Discover Financial Services, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of a late payment on my credit card account. It has come to my attention that you have reported a late payment for XX/XX/XXXX. I believe this information is incorrect and not substantiated by reliable evidence. 

In the case of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ), the court emphasized the importance of accurate reporting and the necessity for financial institutions to maintain proper documentation regarding account status. In light of this precedent, I request that you provide me with your internal records and documentation that clearly prove the alleged late payment. 

Please ensure that the records include : XXXX. The specific date the payment was due. 
XXXX. The date the payment was received. 
XXXX. Any relevant correspondence or communication that supports your claim of a late payment. 

I expect a prompt response to this dispute, including the requested documentation, within 30 days. If you are unable to provide this information, I will expect the erroneous reporting to be corrected immediately. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

_source.complaint_what_happened:
This letter is a formal complaint that National Credit systems is reporting inaccurate and incomplete credit information. 
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are required by federal law to verify, through the physical verification of the original signed consumer contract, any and all accounts that you post on a credit report. Otherwise anyone paying for your reporting services could fax, mail or email in a fraudulent account. 

I demand to see verifiable proof ( i.e. : an original consumer contract with my signature on it ) that you have on file for the account listed below. 

Your failure to positively verify these accounts has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Under the FCRA, unverifiable accounts must be removed and if you are unable to provide me a copy of verifiable proof, you must remove the account listed below. 

I demand that the following account be verified or removed immediately : National Credit Systems : {$300.00} Collection Under federal law, you have thirty ( 30 ) days to complete your re-investigation. Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested as well, to be provided within fifteen ( 15 ) days of the completion of your re-investigation.
_source.issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

_source.complaint_what_happened: I've contacted the property manager XXXX XXXX via email on XX/XX/XXXX about my concern for XXXX 's Rent. On XX/XX/XXXX I received a message from XXXX, their rent collector, saying theres a balance for {$1900.00} for the month of XXXX. I called the day before to see what the balance was about because from what is documented and signed on our lease agreement is that the last month of XXXX rent would be a prorated amount of {$1200.00} since the lease caps and ends on the XXXX of XXXX. Since we first moved in on XX/XX/XXXX, me and my roommate paid a prorated amount of {$600.00} via cashiers check so its documented that XXXX 's month would be the same instance since we did not stay for a full month technically. The lease documents state that XX/XX/XXXX is the official end of the lease so why are we being charged for a full months rent? it's not fair for us and its not fair to the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  nor to the apartment management company ( XXXX XXXX  ). I then got followed up by XXXX XXXX who also confirmed that XXXX 's rent would be prorated to the amount of {$1200.00}. I have documents, emails, and screenshots of our conversations. After we had officially moved out we get an email saying that we owe {$3600.00} for the month of XXXX. I sent a email to XXXX XXXX asking if he ever looked into why we are being charged for the amount of {$3600.00}? When the amount was supposed to be prorated to {$1200.00} for the month of XXXX. I didn't understand why we were being charged double for a single month 's rent being that we did not even stay for a full month, we stayed til our last move out day on XX/XX/XXXX. It felt like I was being taken advantage of and they did everything in their power to get more money out of me and it set me back financially because It damaged my credit. They went from saying the rent will be prorated to {$1200.00} to then rent being {$3600.00}.

Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a complaint against XXXX and XXXX for violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other applicable laws. The agency has been pursuing an alleged debt from 2007 that I disputed and despite my requests for validation, they have failed to provide proper documentation. 

I have previously requested that the debt collection agency provide me with written proof of the validity of the debt, including documentation that shows the original creditor, the amount of the debt, and any interest or fees that have been added. To date, they have not provided me with this documentation, and I am concerned that they are continuing to pursue collection activities without proper validation. 

I believe that this behavior is in violation of my rights under the FCRA and other applicable laws. I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and take appropriate action to ensure that the debt collection agency complies with all applicable laws and regulations. 

Specifically, I am requesting that the agency cease all collection activities related to this debt until they can provide proper validation. I am also requesting that any negative reporting related to this debt be removed from my credit report until the debt can be properly validated. 

I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to your response. 

Thank you for your time.

_source.complaint_what_happened: In XX/XX/year>, M & T bank sent a notice of escrow shortage. In the letter it states if you choose not to pay the full escrow shortage amount to refer to the next page to see how the payment will change. This statement implies if the escrow shortage is paid there would be no change in payment. On the second page it shows the current payment and the new payment, if escrow shortage is not satisfied. No where in the entire notice does it show what the new payment would be if the escrow short is satisfied. This bank knowingly and willingly uses deceptive language and practices in their annual statements. _source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX Bank of America allowed a garnishment of - {$4200.00} from my money market savings account ( attached transaction image ). They did not notify me of the transaction before or after. 

I called to report it as fraud because I didnt recognize Legal Order, XXXX XXXX as an authorized transaction on my account. I was informed that it was a court order and they couldnt provide me with the entity name or information pertaining to the order. I was told I would have to go to a bank branch to get this information and a copy of the supporting document. 

After visiting the bank branch on XX/XX/XXXX, I was provided a copy of a one-page document that contained very little information as a court order ( attached ). I learned that Bank of America allowed the garnishment by the state of CA for a matter that is currently still in dispute. I am a NC resident and have been for the past 36 years. CA, in error, has charged me XXXX resident income taxes vs. an investor in a passive business investment I have in the state. I have never been a CA resident in any capacity. My bank account has always originated in NC and never CA. 

I asked for a copy of the bank policies permitting the garnishment. I was informed I would need to reference my original account documents from when I opened ( nearly two decades ago ). Given the age of my account, I informed them I no longer have these documents. I was handed a booklet that new customers are given when opening an account in XXXX and told that I would need to read through that to find the information I was looking for. I have not been able to locate any clear language in this material to explain the business practices/policies regarding matters like these. 

I recently found the attached article referencing the actions your organization has taken against Bank of America in the past 24-months for situations like mine : unauthorized garnishments and deceptive consumer information regarding their rights ; imposing unenforceable clauses in take it or leave it customer contracts; failing to adhere to consumer protections and acting on garnishment orders without disclosing that the accounts were located out-of-state and protected from the issuing courts garnishment orders.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On Saturday XXXX XXXX, between XXXX and XXXX EST, I drove to a local BoFA branch where they had a drive up ATM.

I proceeded, as one does, to deposit the cash I had on hand ( {$2100.00} in 20 {$100.00} bills and 2 {$50.00} bills denominations ) into the ATM ( atm number is XXXX ). 

The atm counted the money, however, the machine had only counted {$1000.00}. So I freaked out and decided that I will not proceed with this deposit as the ATM counted the wrong amount. So I pressed cancel and the machine spit out {$1000.00} ( in different denominations ). I decided to park and walk into the branch where I was told no one can help me but that I should call the claims department, the branch manager had said it just happened to someone right before me with {$6000.00} and the atm only counted {$100.00}. however, I ended up handing the cashier inside the BoFA branch the {$1000.00} all while I was on the phone making the claim with BoFA. 

I made the claim ( XXXX ) that same day on Saturday and i was told that in 2 business days I will be updated. 4 business days went by and nothing happened.

I called and they said they can try to put in a special request to get a temporary credit of the {$1100.00}. They also said It will take 10 business days. 10 days later ( XX/XX/XXXX ) they tell me that they never found a deposit in my account for XXXX, and that they looked at the ATM between XXXX XXXX. I dont understand what investigation they did, because it seems like they did nothing. and I was told when I called on XX/XX/XXXX that no one looked at any cameras after I told them they can check the ATM, branch and drive through cameras. I work for XXXX XXXX and I know as a fact that this happens as well and its considered an operational risk. 

Keeping in mind that all this while I couldve had XXXX cash in hand. An inconvenience and BoFA just doesnt make it easy. I tried to escalate the case, I called 3 times on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX to escalate the case, but it says its closed. 

Now they say that by XX/XX/XXXX the money will be taken out of my account. The person that I called on XX/XX/XXXX told me that they never looked at the any of the cameras nor the atm. 

Now its XXXX days out so they obviously wont find the cash stuck in the atm because they have a servicer that comes and checks the ATMs 1 time a week at minimum.

So I dont understand how they came to this conclusion but I am not paying a XXXX back because I dont owe them anything. 

Meanwhile my account balance will continuously decrease because of the XXXX XXXX monthly service fee. And an FYI my account with them has been open for maybe 2 months now.

_source.complaint_what_happened: This account has been closed on XX/XX/year> complaint XXXX by XXXX XXXX l am writing to formally file a complaint against National Credit Systems XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX GA XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX for violating the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 USC 1692c ( c ) and failing to validate a debt as required by law. On multiple occasions, I contacted National Credit Systems to request validation of an alleged debt and to instruct them to cease all further communication with me until the debt was validated. Despite these requests, National Credit Systems has continued to contact me without providing the required validation of the debt. Here is a detailed summary of my interactions with National Credit Systems : Email Communication : On XX/XX/year>, I sent an email to National Credit Systems requesting that they validate the alleged debt and cease all communication until such validation was provided. Follow-Up Email : On XX/XX/year>, I sent a follow-up email reiterating my request for validation of the debt and for them to cease contacting me until validation was provided. Telephone Communications : On XX/XX/year>, I called National Credit Systems to verbally request validation of the debt and to instruct them to cease contacting me until such validation was provided. On XX/XX/year>, I spoke with a representative named XXXX XXXX, once again requesting validation of the debt and instructing them to cease all communications until they provided such validation. Despite my clear and repeated requests, National Credit Systems has failed to provide any validation of the debt and has continued to contact me, in direct violation of 15 USC 1692c ( c ). Under this section of the FDCPA, if a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing to cease further communication, the debt collector must cease communication except under specific conditions that do not apply in this case. Additionally, they have not fulfilled their obligation to validate the debt as required under 15 USC 1692g. The ongoing and unlawful contact from National Credit Systems has caused me significant stress and inconvenience. Therefore, I am requesting the CFPB to take immediate action against National Credit Systems to enforce compliance with the FDCPA, ensure that all unlawful contact ceases, and that the debt is validated as required by law. Please find attached copies of my email communications and summaries of my telephone conversations to support my complaint. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.
_source.issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

I currently bank with Discover, and honestly was happy until now. I know it doesnt seem like a big deal to a banker, but I literally need this money to survive. I did some XXXX  and couldnt find a law they could site, and I know they wouldnt assume the funds are not legitimate coming from XXXX XXXX 

It sounds like they are making money off the interest of my money while I go without. If this is legal I want to know how it could be justified. They assured me they would pay my bill late fees if I could prove they are at fault, but being they are a big bank, and that they can just hold my funds to their satisfaction I am worried that is a battle I will never win.
