_source.complaint_what_happened: National Credit , Systems, debt collection agency has unlawfully reported derogatory information {$2500.00} on my credit report without my consent or proper authorization. Specifically, I have not signed any application or contract with this agency, nor have I provided them with a valid copy of my drivers license or any other form of identification that would allow them to legally report this information. The agency has failed to provide a copy of any wet signature contract or application demonstrating my consent, which raises concerns about the legitimacy of their actions. I also have not given this agency the authority to access or report any information related to me under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which requires a permissible purpose for such actions. Their failure to comply with these legal requirements has caused harm to my credit standing, and I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter and ensure that the derogatory information is removed from my credit report immediately. Thank you for your attention to this serious issue. I look forward to your prompt assistance in resolving this matter or I will seek help from federal agencies and legal counsel.

On XX/XX/XXXX I checked my mobile banking app and saw a fraudulent ACH payment to a credit card I do not own, in the amount of {$4200.00}. I was not sent any text alerts or email alerts like I have been in the past. I immediately called the fraud department regarding this unapproved transaction. After over an hour and multiple transfers, an agent said she could not initiate a claim or stop payment as the ACH was processing and that Id have to call back the next day once the charge posted. I called in today, XX/XX/XXXX, and after 2 hours, multiple transfers, and denials to requests to speak with a supervisor, I have no resolution or case number. Ive been told it will take up to 10 business days to review and investigate, which is unacceptable since I have no access to my money during this time. 

Bank of America is failing to uphold safeguards and is allowing fraud to run rampant. They fail to take accountability and provide basic consumer protections to prevent large amounts of money from being illegally accessed and stolen, and thus, are complicit in the fraud. When this unique, first time transaction was noticed on my account ledger, it was not paused, stopped, or canceled in spite of immediate requests by me. I was not provided any alerts or timely resolution.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I purchased an Apple laptop through Apples online store. To pay for the purchase, I used my Apple Credit card, underwritten by Goldman Sachs. The Apple credit card allowed me to split the purchase into 12 monthly payments, with the first payment of {$85.00} due upon checkout. 

There was also an ongoing promotion for consumers to receive a {$150.00} Apple Store gift card with their purchase ( the cost of which was rolled into the price of the device so that if consumers returned the product, they would not receive a refund for the gift card portion but rather would keep the gift card ). 

I was one of the consumers who ultimately decided to return the device because it was insufficient for my use case. Once the device was returned, the Apple Store refunded the purchase amount equal to the remaining installments balance ; however, the initial payment completed at checkout was not refunded, nor the {$150.00} charge included for the gift card promo. Which normally would have been fine, except for the fact that the gift card I received was voided and no longer available for use. I have asked the Apple store to provide evidence that the gift card is either still active or a record of the gift card being used ; Ive also asked them to provide me the details of the gift card so that I can use it ; however, those requests have gone unanswered, yet the charge remains on the account.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX, our business accounts were wiped out by a garnishment from the state of Maryland. The issue is, we are a North Carolina business and have never done business in Maryland. 

We called the law office in Maryland and found out this is a case of mistaken identity. They issued an order for XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX XXXX Maryland, but Bank of America garnished us, XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX NC. 

We have been given the run-around by customer service agents and managers and even branch managers so I am asking you for help. 

The money garnished was credited back to our account on Friday. We have not, however, received any formal communication ( explanation, apology, etc ) from the bank about this issue. We had to temporarily close our business on Thursday and part of the day on Wednesday to deal with this issue and because all of our sales were being immediately garnished. 

This issue has caused a hardship for us emotionally and financially and affected our creditworthiness with vendors who we couldnt pay during this time. In addition to any fees that were assessed, we would like to request compensation for lost revenue and inconvenience. 

We would very much appreciate a response as we feel like we deserve an explanation for how and why this happened to us.

_source.complaint_what_happened: On XXXX, I purchased XXXX tickets to a local event through XXXX using my Discover Card. The event was scheduled for XXXX The total amount charged was {$260.00}. Initially, I had trouble with XXXX because they didn't send the tickets when they were supposed to. I spoke with the creator of the event and he sent me the tickets. Then, just XXXX  days before the XXXX, the event was canceled. I reached out to the event creator and he confirmed it was canceled and told me I would be getting a full refund. I waited several days and still hadn't received the refund. So I reach out again, to the venue, to the creator, to XXXX and finally to Discover. I started a dispute for the charge and was initially given a credit. then on XXXX I received an notice that the vendor provided new evidence stating I did receive services and never requested a refund. Both of these statements were outright LIES. I had uploaded PROOF that I had been in contact, that they admitted they canceled the event and that I was to receive a refund. I showed enough proof in writing that should have been a very straightforward case. Yet, I was charged the money and the case was closed. Discover grossly mishandled this dispute. So I called in to have the case reopened, and was promised that it would be re-opened and was confirmed that there was clearly enough evidence submitted to prove my case. If Discover had done ANY due diligence they would have seen that XXXX XXXX is publicly reviewed as a scam company. If they had read my submitted documentation, there would have been no question about my honestly and their lies. So the person that promised a re-evaluation and a new credit, then promptly closed the dispute as soon as I got off the phone. I called back AGAIN, to speak with someone else- who also said they could see that I had proven my case and should have the dispute reopened and should get a credit. then I was put on hold for more than XXXX minutes and they never returned to the phone line. I called a XXXX time and got transferred to various people until finally getting a " supervisor '' who turned out to be in customer service - not billing... They transferred me to another person that transferred me to Billing XXXX XXXX. XXXX then told me that she can clearly see that someone in their billing department made a mistake and accidentally closed the case which is now permanent. she admitted that they were at fault and said she was going to make notations on my account in the " hopes '' that someone will review it - eventually, but no idea when, or if that will actually happen - and if they do, maybe they will do the right thing and credit me the {$260.00} I am out. I have been scammed, I performed my due diligence to my credit card company - who I trusted to do the right thing - and then I was mistreated by them due to their own internal failures. I am not going to let this drop and I will keep going to any forum that will listen to keep other people from having to go through this. Where is the consumer protection that they promised?!

_source.complaint_what_happened:
This is an Identity Theft pursuant to 15 USC 1681a ( 3 ). The information I am demanding to be removed is not sent in error and is an affidavit of fact, so there is no material misrepresentation of the fact. If you believe I obtained possession of goods and services, then have a senior executive member of this company put this information on a signed and notarized affidavit under penalty of perjury. 

Once the items are removed from my consumer report, I demand that they are never put back on. If they are put back on, I will pursue litigation against your company in federal court, pursuant to 15 USC 1681o. 

Per 15 USC 1681c-2, the credit reporting agency must block this information from being reported to my consumer report within 4 days of receipt of this ID Theft Report, and I am demanding that you do so. 

Thank you for your help in protecting my federally protected consumer rights.

_source.complaint_what_happened: There was a rental debt with National Credit Systems. Me and the other person who they put the rental debt on first spoke to them on the phone on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXXXXXX XXXX, the call was XXXX minutes long ( I recorded every single phone call with them for my protection and so that way they could not claim anything false. ) upon getting on the phone me and my mother were super nice we just wanted to pay our debt and get it removed off of our credit report. We spoke to XXXX XXXX who was assigned to help us. We told him we would pay our debt for a pay to delete. He talked to us like we were incompetent and kept cutting us off but we just wanted to move on with this situation. He told us that when we paid we would get a receipt and a letter stating that the debt was paid in full and that they would send that information to the credit bureaus. He told us to wait XXXX hours and the receipt would show up on the portal the next day. The original balance was XXXX but we settled for XXXX. We paid on XXXX separate cards XXXX $ on the first card and XXXX $ on the second one.Once we got off the phone we received an email that gave us a login to their portal which we were supposed to login to on Saturday and see the receipt. When we logged in the next day there was no receipt and it showed as if we only paid half ( XXXX $ ) of the balance.We decided to try and wait until Monday so they could update the information. We called back on Monday and spoke to XXXX again but this time he was super rude and seemed frustrated with us. We told him we received no receipt for our payment and that the payment showed that we only made half of the payment so where did the money go ( the other half of the payment which was XXXX $ ). All he did was simply tell us how to login the portal which we already had instructions for and kept telling us that we should see a receipt which we did not. Eventually we just got off the phone and decided we would try to find the receipt ourselves due to him not being helpful. While me and my mother were trying to do that he called us at XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX trying to collect money for the debt we already paid! when I answered the phone he asked if he was speaking with me and I said yes and he proceeds to say that we owed a certain amount to national credit systems. Me and my mother were confused because we already paid him so we called him out on it and reminded him that we were trying to find receipt so why is he calling us for more money. He proceeded to say that he remembered us which clearly he didn't because he asked for more money and we were lucky that he called back because we clearly needed his help.We asked him if he even closed our account and he said yes but that was clearly a lie because he called us trying to collect money again. Eventually he went over to his supervisor and said that he would send us the receipt which we were supposed to been had and a letter stating that the debt was satisfied. When we checked with the credit bureaus they updated the balance to an incorrect amount and it is still on our credit history. My concern is that they could never come up with a receipt and even after they accepted the settlement was paid they called me back after several phone calls trying to collect a debt, how do I know they will not try and contact me again trying to collect money. They would not provide a pay to delete letter which we agreed on and even on the letter they provided that states that the debt is paid is satisfied it still shows a balance.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I am writing to file a formal complaint against National Credit Adjust for multiple violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). Despite my attempts to address the issue directly with the agency, the following violations have remained unresolved : XXXX. Unauthorized Debt Acquisition : National Credit Adjust acquired debt from the original creditor, XXXX XXXX, without obtaining my explicit consent. As per the FDCPA, it is illegal for a collection agency to acquire and pursue debts without the debtor 's consent. 
XXXX. Failure to Provide Verification of Debt : On XX/XX/2023, I sent a written request to National Credit Adjust, requesting verification of the alleged debt they were pursuing against me. However, the agency failed to provide any valid documentation or evidence supporting the existence and accuracy of the debt, as required by the FDCPA. 
XXXX. Ignoring Cease and Desist Instruction : In my previous correspondence with National Credit Adjust, I explicitly instructed them to cease all communication with me regarding the alleged debt until proper verification was provided. Despite this instruction, the agency continued to engage in collection efforts, including phone calls and letters, disregarding my rights under the FDCPA. 
These ongoing violations have caused significant distress and have infringed upon my rights as a consumer. In light of these circumstances, I am seeking the following actions : XXXX. Investigation : I request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) conduct a thorough investigation into the actions of National Credit Adjust to determine the extent of their violations and hold them accountable for their non-compliance with the FDCPA. 
XXXX. Cease Collection Efforts : I demand that National Credit Adjust immediately cease all collection activities related to the alleged debt until they provide valid verification as required by the FDCPA. 
XXXX. Ignoring Cease and Desist Instruction : In my previous correspondence with National Credit Adjust, I explicitly instructed them to cease all communication with me regarding the alleged debt until proper verification was provided. Despite this instruction, the agency continued to engage in collection efforts, disregarding my rights under the FDCPA. 
Enclosed with this complaint, you will find copies of all relevant correspondence, including the written request for debt verification and the documented disregard of the cease-and-desist instruction. These documents serve as evidence to support my complaint. I appreciate your attention to this matter and your commitment to protecting consumer rights. I trust that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will take swift and decisive action to address these violations and provide me with a resolution.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I filed a dispute with Barclays Bank on XX/XX/23 for over {$10000.00} for a vacation rental issue. At the time I had spoken with the merchant, who agreed with my complaint and said they would not contest the dispute. After a month, I received letters from Barclays saying they would not send the dispute to the merchant, first because I needed to try and return the " merchandise '' and second because services were provided. I requested multiple times to speak with a supervisor, and was told none were available. I finally filed a complaint with the XXXX XXXX XXXX which got a response from the " Office of the President ''. After speaking with this person, Barclays finally sent the dispute to the merchant on XX/XX/23. 

I am in possession of the response from the merchant, dated XX/XX/23, where they asserted that they accepted the dispute and would not contest it. I have called Barclays multiple times inquiring as to why the dispute has not been finalized in my favor, given the merchant 's response. Each time, Barclays says they are still investigating, and can not give me a timeframe as to when my dispute will be finished. Multiple times, I have requested to speak with a supervisor in the dispute department, to be told there are none available and that they will call me back within XXXX hours. I have received no callbacks at all. 

It is now almost 3 months since I filed the initial dispute, and 45 days since the merchant responded to Barclays accepting the dispute, and yet I still have no resolution. I have emailed and called the Office of the President, and have received no response. I have now filed a second XXXX complaint, since this seems to be the only way to get Barclays to do what they are supposed to do under the terms of the credit card agreement. They are essentially refusing to refund money that the merchant has agreed I am due. 

This is absolutely awful customer service, and really has me wondering what Barclays would do if I actually needed them to advocate on my behalf, as opposed to the open and shut case that I just need them to process correctly.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I have been in touch repeatedly with TD Auto Finance in an effort to take over my sister 's loan and obtain title to her vehicle so that I can sell it to the dealer. 
My sister passed away on XX/XX/2023 and left her car at the dealership. It's been sitting there ever since. They are interested in buying the car but require that it be titled in my name and are threatening to have the car towed and impounded. 

Once I obtained a death certificate ( XXXX  months after my sister 's passing ), I submitted it to TD Auto Finance and began discussions with them. They alleged that they would send me documents for a Transfer of Equity, so I can take over the loan and title, but nothing arrived. They have repeatedly promised and nothing happens. 

I've been talking with XXXX XXXX XXXX at TD Auto Finance. The number I have for his office is XXXX. 

I am distraught over the loss of my sister and further upset by how hard it's been to deal with her affairs. I could really use some help but don't know who to appeal to. I would greatly appreciate any assistance that the CFPB could provide me in this situation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I do not consent to being contacted through anything but certified mail. If I receive any response other than certified mail rebutting all of the points made thus far, GOLDMAN SACHS BANK is knowingly and intentionally violating me under federal law. Every violation will result in a fine. I sent a CEASE AND DESIST Notice on XX/XX/23 and I am still being contacted. 

According to USC 1692 ( C ) ( a ) : Communication with the consumer generally without the prior consent of the consumer given directly to the debt collector or the express permission of a court of competent jurisdiction, a debt collector may not communicate with a consumer in connection with the collection of any debt.

I never gave intended permission to GOLDMAN SACHS BANK or ANY third-party affiliate to contact me.

USC 1692 ( C ) 806. Harassment or abuse A debt collector may not engage in any conduct the natural consequence of which is to harass, oppress, or abuse any person in connection with the collection of a debt. Without limiting the general application of the foregoing, the following conduct is a violation of this section : ( 5 ) Causing a telephone to ring or engaging any person in telephone conversation repeatedly or continuously with intent to annoy, abuse, or harass any person at the called number. 


A debt collector who fails to comply with any provision of the FDCPA is liable for : Any actual damages sustained as a result of that failure ; Punitive damages as allowed by the court : in an individual action, up to {$1000.00} ; or in a class action, up to {$1000.00} for each named plaintiff and an award to be divided among all members of the class of an amount up to {$500000.00} or 1 percent of the debt collectors net worth, whichever is less ; Costs and a reasonable attorneys fee in any such action. 

GOLDMAN SACHS BANK has still not provided me with ALL of the information listed below. 
The identity of the original creditor. 
The amount of the alleged debt. 
The name and address of the original creditor, if different from the current creditor. 
The original lawful contract signed by both parties in wet ink, therefore binding both parties, XXXX XXXX ( the natural person ), and GOLDMAN SACHS BANK, proving I agreed to pay the alleged amount knowingly and intentionally in wet ink. 
A GAAP accounting documentation ( both on and off ledger ) showing the exact asset used to collateralize this debt. 
Proof of compliance with the truth in lending laws of the United States XXXX, title XXXX XXXX XXXX et. seq. and XXXX XXXX. 

It is my right to request validation of any purported debt under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, and it is your obligation to supply me with the aforementioned materials.
_source.sub_issue: You told them to stop contacting you, but they keep trying

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/2023, I received a debt collection notice from Albertelli Law requesting that I respond to the notice. 

On XX/XX/2023, I responded to the notice by paying the amount requested on the notice. 

On XX/XX/2023, I received a XXXX package from Albertelli Law with a refunded check for the exact amount I sent. The check that was sent back was dated XX/XX/2023. Along with the check was a notice dated XX/XX/2023, stating that the amount sent was not the correct amount owed and that the eviction would proceed. 

On XX/XX/2023, I called the number listed on the notice that was sent on XX/XX/2023, and the number was disconnected. I also called the number listed on the notice received on XX/XX/2023, and was told that was not the correct number as it was for foreclosures. The lady on the phone gave me the number for the evictions. 

On XX/XX/2023, I received an email from Albertelli Law stating that a response to my questions that I sent to the landlord would be responded to. 

On XX/XX/2023, I emailed the attorney to let them know I was still awaiting a response. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I left voicemails for the attorney at the office and on the cell number listed in the previous email. I finally received a call back and the attorney stated they were filing a writ of possession. I then received an email with the same information. I responded that I had not received an answer to my questions. 

As of today XX/XX/2023, the attorney still has not given me the requested information.
_source.company: James E. Albertelli, P.A., a Florida professional association

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/2023 I applied with BMO Alto to open a new jointly owned CD account with me as primary owner and my husband as co-owner. Their online application form required my personal information only, and stated that the co-owner will be invited to apply once the account is opened and funded. We funded the $ XXXX account via ACH, and the account officially opened on XX/XX/2023. 

On XX/XX/2023 my husband was invited via an email from BMO Alto apply for his co-ownership, which he did. Later that day he received another email stating that his ownership was denied, and that he would receive a follow-up email with more information. He is still waiting for that email. He called BMO Alto, and was informed that a co-owner can not be added to an account once it is opened and funded, which is in direct opposition to the online application process and also the opposite of what was stated in the first email he received. The customer service rep ( XXXX ) filed a complaint on my husbands behalf and was told a supervisor would call back in XXXX hours. He is still waiting for that call. 

On XX/XX/2023, I received an email from BMO Alto stating Thank you for choosing BMO Alto. We regret to inform you that we're unable to honor your request to add ( my husband ) to your account ( s ). This is to let you know that your account ( s ) will remain in your name only. Thank you for choosing BMO Alto. This is not what I wanted at all. BMO Alro took it upon themselves to change the application from a co-owned account to an account in my name only without my input or permission. I would have never allowed this had I applied for the account in person. I called the bank asking that the account be closed immediately and that our entire $ XXXX be returned without penalty, considering that the bank mishandled the account ownership. The rep I spoke with filed a complaint on my behalf and told me I would receive a follow-up call in XXXX hours. I am still waiting for that call. 

After a week went by without hearing anything from BMO Alto, I called the bank again. I reiterated my request. I was told that the account would be closed without penalty on XX/XX/2023, and that our money would be returned in its entirety within XXXX hours after the account closed. It is now XX/XX/2023. The account is still open. Our funds have not been returned. The bank has not contacted us.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I am writing to express my deep disappointment and frustration regarding my recent application for an Apple Credit Card, which was unexpectedly denied despite meeting or exceeding the stated minimum requirements.

I applied for the Apple Credit Card with a credit score of XXXX, well above the minimum score of XXXX required for approval. Furthermore, my credit report shows no hard inquiries or derogatory marks, indicating a responsible and stable financial history. Given these factors, I was confident in my eligibility for the Apple Credit Card.

However, to my dismay, my application was denied without any clear explanation. This rejection has left me bewildered and deeply concerned, especially considering that I appear to meet all the criteria for approval. As an XXXX XXXX individual, I can not help but wonder if my race played a role in this decision.

While I understand that credit decisions are complex and multifaceted, and that there may be factors beyond my credit score at play, I am troubled by the lack of transparency and clarity surrounding my denial. It is essential to ensure that the credit approval process is fair and free from any form of discrimination.

I kindly request a thorough review of my application and a detailed explanation for the denial. I urge you to reconsider my eligibility for the Apple Credit Card based on my qualifications and merits as a consumer. Additionally, I would appreciate any assistance or guidance you can provide to address my concerns and rectify this situation. 

Discrimination of any kind has no place in our society, and I trust that Apple values diversity and inclusivity. I hope that we can resolve this matter amicably and restore my confidence in your company 's commitment to fairness and equality.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and a satisfactory resolution. 

If requested i can send a copy of my current report.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
National Credit Systems and their client have placed a {$500.00} collection on my credit file for a deductible on a bond policy that had paid my previous landlords monies for damages/fees I supposedly incurred due to my leaving. 
Originally, I was disputing this debt under the notion that it was for damages left in an apartment and potential violation of lease fees, because thats what I was told by the leasing office. This information was not correct. The account manager for National Credit Systems XXXX XXXX XXXX who had previously provided me with incorrect information, updated the reason for the debt to be that of one owed to a Bond Company that was in contract with XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Once the reasoning behind the debt was clarified ( XX/XX/XXXX ), I explained that I did not leave my apartment with any damages. I have a few clips from my move-out. In addition to this the regional mgr XXXX approving my leave. I had purchased a home and could only break the lease without penalty with his approval. The conditions were to give the official notice, leave the apartment in mint condition/have anything fixed my maintenance prior to the leave, and complete a walk-thru. All those conditions were met. Now I'm being told by NCS that the bond deductible is owned by me due to the apartment complex stating I owed for damages and prorated rent ... .the bond company apparently paid XXXX XXXX XXXX for damages that were completely false. When I asked for the bond company 's direct contact info or to be conference called with them NCS declined my requests. I went to the physical location of the apts, the maintenance mgr XXXX even confirmed to the new owners that nothing was wrong with my apt when I left. The new/old property management offices have neglected to return my calls. The NCS account mgr told me on a recorded line that she's never seen this overturned and that I should just pay what I owe. She told me that there was no way to prove the apts had sent in false info to the bond company. Even with a statement from the maintenance mgr and a vid of my apt she stated that no one ever wins in these scenarios. I abided by all the terms of my early lease termination which is how I was able to leave without penalty. I do not owe this debt and have been blocked and rejected at every turn to fix this injustice. Please help me. There has been no evidence from XXXX XXXX management or the maintenance staff anything other than my leaving the apartment in outstanding condition. Also, I even paid utilities days after I left, and no one reached out to inform me that this was happening from the leasing office. 

I have attached a screenshot of the timeframe where XXXX approved my request. The video says " exceed '' I was unable to upload it here.
_source.sub_issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt

_source.complaint_what_happened: I received a phone call from a USAA number claiming someone hacked into my account. They already had all of my information. They claimed someone was trying to make XXXX payments. They attempted over XXXX transactions all but XXXX were blocked. The XXXX XXXX was for {$990.00} on XXXX XXXX. The XXXX  was the same amount on XXXX XXXX. I called USAA on the evening of XXXX XXXX because my card was denied while buying groceries. They claimed they saw the activity and already had a fraud investigation started. I was adamant about them putting a block on my account and they assured me no further money would be taken out. Today, XXXX XXXX was the XXXX  transaction that went through. Again, plenty more transactions were attempted. I called again and they opened another claim. They were denied. But they did not provide reasons why. I am out {$2000.00} because someone had all my information and pretended to be from USAA. USAA takes no fault even though they confirmed they put a block on my account after the first XXXX.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I am in receipt of your company 's letter informing me you are handling the collection of the account mentioned above. However, after reviewing my records, I am unable to find any documentation of any contractual relationship between and me which makes you a person entitled to enforce a commercial claim against me. This letter is not a request for verification or validation. This is a request for proof of contract to substantiate your claim. 
Provide me with a certified copy of an original contract, with my signature, specifically naming your company as a person entitled to enforce a commercial claim against me. Certification can be done through the presence of a notary public, who duly swears the copy made is in fact a copy of the original paper contract in question. Failure to respond and provide strict proof of contract will constitute your tactic agreement that you, and, are not entitled to enforce a claim against me. In the event, you continue your collection efforts against me without providing proof of contract, I will file a complaint with the Attorney General and Federal Trade Commission, and file a police report against you for harassment and invasion of privacy. 
You have 30 days to provide strict proof of contract. In the event, you can not provide strict proof of contract, you must cease and desist all collection efforts and immediately remove any derogatory information reported to the consumer reporting agencies. If you transfer this account to an attorney without providing proof of contract, he will be immediately reported to the XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX for code of ethics violations.
_source.issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
_source.sub_issue: Debt was result of identity theft

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Bank of America is not complying with the Fair Credit Billing Act in terms of representing its customers who file chargebacks based on billing errors, dissatisfactory services, and misrepresented products on their Bank of America credit cards. I have multiple examples to prove this. Bank of America does not take chargeback claims seriously in comparison to other major card issuers. Bank of America uses many tactics to offset its lawful responsibility to handle chargebacks seriously. A few of these tactics are to not acknowledging documentation they receive from their consumers ( I.e they ask for supporting evidence, and then never acknowledge receiving the evidence ) or putting undue onerous on the consumer to provide documentation when they have reasonable means to capture this information on their own from a merchant ( i.e, double charged in a restaurant, lost the receipt, and they would not pursue the claim ). 

Bank of America is likely doing this to reduce its internal expenses in administering the chargeback process on behalf of its customers.
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

_source.complaint_what_happened:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NC XXXX  Phone : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX DISCOVER FINANCIAL SER XXXX  READS WAY XXXX XXXX, DE XXXX Dear { DISCOVER FINANCIAL SER } This letter is your formal notice to cease your unauthorized hard inquiries into my credit report and, a formal demand that you immediately contact the credit reporting agencies and credit bureaus, where your organization has made inquiries into my credit history, to have your illegal inquiries removed. Be advised that I will be checking my reports to ensure you have had the following unauthorized inquiries removed : Made by : DISCOVER FINANCIAL SER Made on : { XXXX XXXX AND XXXX XX/XX/XXXX } Made with : XXXX, XXXX, AND XXXX TO INCLUDE ANY REPORTING ANGENY USING THE SSN AND NAME To my knowledge, I have not signed any documents authorizing your organization to view my credit history therefore, your inquiry into my credit report violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Section 1681b ( c ) : Transactions Not Initiated by Consumer.

If you are in possession of any document that you believe authorizes you or your organization to make inquiries into my credit report, I respectfully request a copy of this document be sent to my address listed above so that I may verify its validity. 
Given the amount of identity theft, I'm sure you'll agree that verifying your information is in your best interest. 
Finally, assuming you do not possess inquiry authorization, I request that, after removing your unauthorized inquiries from my credit profiles, you also remove all of my personal information from your records and send me confirmation that you have complied with my requests. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX ATTORNEY OF FACT SIGNED WITHOUT PREJUDICE All inquiries and reported information are to be restricted to the consumers ' wishes in writing. Thus no other reports will be submitted without the consumer 's knowledge or written permission. DATE XX/XX/XXXX Claim initiated

_source.complaint_what_happened: Good Morning, on XX/XX/year> @ XXXX I arrived to XXXX on XXXX XXXX located in XXXX, XXXX  I went inside the store I was there roughly XXXX hours due to me getting thjngsbfor my graduation and also getting my nails done. I proceeded to come out around XXXX XXXX  that day and when I came out a buggy had been rammed into my front end of the car and the back end of someone elses car. As in beginning walk around the car to see what happened I see the ownerr of the car in front of me. I began letting her know how I found the cart parked ( with my grocery still being in a cart at my trunk ) and I let her know it weren't me who done any damage to her car and she said yeah I believe you people are stupid I Dont know who could've done this but did you see anybody? I said to her no I Dont but my mother has a dash cam that hopefully can show it but when the car is off it doesn't record anything she then proceeded to ask me could we exchange information so I could be a witness to her insurance for her to be able to file a claim I said sure I can be since it is I wasn't the one who was at fault. I spoke with a person with her insurance company and they began to question to me as though I was at fault I've showed documents and time stamps with this matter and somehow the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX have issued me a bill of {$1200.00} regarding this matter when I wasn't the one who damaged her car I sent them the videos and as of today RESENT the videos to XXXX XXXX. _source.complaint_what_happened: On XX/XX/XXXX a scammer called with BofA phone ID. The man claimed that BofA had issued a person a credit card with a line of credit with my stolen identity. that person had already spent XXXX at an XXXX XXXX and before it had posted I could stop payment by depositing money in an XXXX  account.I had XXXX in my savings and not knowing at the time if I had deposited XXXX in an XXXX  account it would have been flagged by the FTC this scammer knew that and I inadvertantly put XXXX in an XXXX  account that I provided. Now of course I'm not seeing any red flags.My XXXX son also has an account with BofA and he's listed jointly with me. He had over XXXX from his SSI and the scammer moved XXXX into my sons account so that he could also get XXXX into an XXXX  account. Now both my son and I opened XXXX  accounts. I deposited the money unknowingly but realized that I was being scammed and got a hold of Bof A and we realized that my money was moved but my sons account was locked due to suspicious activity. I verbaly said to the rep that please keep this account frozen!!! She was more concerned with why my son had more money. She referred me to the fraud department which was closed I went to bed thinking that I was only investigating my XXXX when first thing on my phone I see that my sons account was depleted of all his funds. When I finally got a hold of someone from the fraud department they said they don't freeze accounts! He knew darn well I meant locked. Now my son never had access to that account on the XXXX, actually the scammer was texting him while I was on line with the BofA rep saying he was from the fraud department and he needed to call this number ( which ended up being a number from XXXX ) my son is smart and just kept writing STOP the scammer did this until someone from BOFA unlocked that account and the money was deposited into the XXXX account which my son set up but if they hadnt unlocked it never would have been released.BofA dropped the ball and now have refused to pay my son. They also let the scammer try to get into his locked account four days later and tried to blame me for it. I said I don't understand the purpose of a locked account thats being investigated for fraud when letting scammers back four days later into locked accounts!! now I may have to pursue a lawsuit since my son is XXXX but not mentally. I hope they are not using that as an excuse to not pay him his money from his account. Very disappointed in a bank Ive been doing business with for over XXXX years, very hard to get a hold of someone from the fraud department and they keep referring you to talk with different departments and keep you tied up on the line for sometimes an hour before you speak to someone. I would just like to see my son get the money he deserves and have BofA take the blame since they were the ones who let the money slip into the XXXX account.

_source.complaint_what_happened: A charge off account is showing on my report & the creditor told me that I can not get a copy of the 1099-C document because they did not officially charge off the debt and they didn't take a write off which is a violation because it says on my credit report that it is charged off which equates to false reporting & not reporting 100 % accurately. FCRA violations refers to a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, which is a federal law that regulates the collection, dissemination, and use of consumer credit information. Federal law requires that consumer reporting agencies follow reasonable procedures to ensure 100 % accuracy of the information contained in their credit reports. If a consumer suffers damages as a result of a FCRA violation they may be entitled to bring a private lawsuit against the CRA and recover actual damages, statutory damages, and attorney 's fees. These accounts listed on my letter are not 100 % correct and I demand them to be investigated completely.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
" The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. 

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of TILA US Code 1666B since I was never late. 

I recently reviewed my consumer report and noticed an incorrect late payment record on my DISCOVERBANK XXXX. I have always maintained timely payments on this account. Under the Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), creditors are required to accurately report consumer transactions and provide a mechanism for correcting errors in a timely manner. Please conduct an investigation into this matter, and if you can not provide documentary evidence of these supposed late payments, I demand these payments to be updated to on time as they should be as I was NEVER late. I expect these updates to be made promptly, in compliance with the law. 
"

_source.complaint_what_happened: About 3 months ago Bank of America notified us of fraudulent activity and we found that about XXXX was lost. At their direction we closed that checking account and opened a new one recreating in the next few weeks the entire set of autopayed bills. They told us the fraud included a forged signature that was taken to a window and they were attempting to find out how it had gotten through their system. They also told us the missing funds were taken in 2 or 3 transactions. We've called in several times in these 3 months and were repeatedly told they were continuing the research, assuring us the funds would be returned in the 90 day period. About one day short of this 90 days we got an email with a link that didn't work and an attachment that didn't open. The phone number was answered by a smooth talker who wouldn't explain why the link & attachment didn't work, and who also wouldn't tell us details of the letter except that the claim was denied because " we had gotten some benefit of the funds ''. When I asked what she meant about getting a benefit from losing , she said she would resubmit the claim, thereby adding another 60 days to the process. This makes me wonder if the bank 's goal was only to draw this out to a maximum amount. This money represents savings of a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I'm her son and executor. We are both on the account.

At this point, they should be able to mail me a check with MY money that they have been holding hostage for over two months. This is ridiculous and the worst banking experience I have ever had. I see why they have bad reviews, and I will not recommend them to anyone. They purposely try to take your money and hold it for months. I do not want to send in an affidavit because I did that already, and it did not work. I want to close my account asap and get my money back.

Marcus locked my account when I initiated this transfer. I called to find out the issue and kept being hung up on. I finally spoke to a supervisor, and they said they would send me an affidavit to verify my identity. I received the affidavit two weeks later and got it notarized virtually using an app called XXXX that charged {$25.00} for a virtual service. I could not physically make it into a store to notarize because my husband works and uses the car, plus I have XXXX XXXX to take care of. Then the representative said it was notarized by someone in Texas and needed to be done in North Carolina, where I reside. I told her I paid {$25.00} for a virtual video service to get this done. Hence, people work from virtually anywhere to help get documents notarized asap if they can not physically make it to a location. She said they would be sending out another form so it could be done in NC. I then asked to close my account. After all, I am no longer interested in banking with a bank holding my money hostage for over a month, all because I wanted to transfer some of my funds. She said she would send a code to the phone number I have on file to close the account. The code never came, and she asked if I had an alternate number. I told her I only use one number on my account and have not had issues using this number in the past for my account. A duplicate loan was created somehow, and my original loan was closed. This all happened without my knowledge. When XXXX attempted to send the corrected amount, it was rejected because they were stating that the account had been paid in full. 

This was a banking error. As of the end of XXXX I finally was able to get my insurance company to send yet another check. I believe this account is finally going to be closed. 

I have had to pay {$400.00} in interest and {$1600.00} in rent/deposit coverage due to my credit report being negative. I am unable to get any loans or open up any new accounts due to this error. 

PNC bank has stated they have done nothing wrong and can not help me.

orginally contacted XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. They requested more information I submitted that and never heard back. I then proceeded to contact them via Chat. The history of reaching out is below. 

- XX/XX/XXXX asked for help to remove the restriction. They responded asking for more info and I provided it. Then they never responded again. 
- Started a chat with XXXX prior to the XXXX ( It doesn't say what day exactly ). She did respond saying she was transferring me to the proper team and should receive a response in 1-2 business days. 
- followed up the XXXX. - no response - followed up the XXXX - no response - filled up XX/XX/XXXX - no response- Started a chat with XXXX on the XXXX- received a response on the XXXX with the exact same response as XXXX. I explained that I received the same response before and never heard back and if we could escalate. - no response - followed up the XXXX - no response - followed up the XXXX - no response- Started a chat with XXXX on the XXXX. responded on the XXXX, This time the response was the same as XXXX 's but stating it will take 3-5 business days. I responded letting them know it has been more than 2.5 weeks and no one has reached out. - no response I don't know what else to do at this point. When I call the support line they say to email and start a chat.

_source.product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
_source.complaint_what_happened:
Subject : Urgent Request for Documentation and Action Regarding Unauthorized Inquiry and Security Interest Dear Barclays Bank, I am writing to address a concerning matter regarding an inquiry reported by Barclays Bank, which lacks permissible purpose and, as such, constitutes potential identity fraud. Per my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Sections 604 and 605B, I am requesting immediate action to rectify this situation. 

Firstly, I require documentation proving that I provided express written consent for Barclays Bank to report the inquiry in question. As there is no evidence of such consent or a court order, I must assert that this inquiry lacks legitimacy and is thus subject to removal.

Per the FCRA Section 605B, a consumer reporting agency must block the reporting of any information resulting from alleged identity theft when identified by the consumer. Therefore, I am formally notifying Barclays Bank to remove this inquiry from my file within four business days.

Furthermore, it has come to my attention that Barclays Bank neglected to inform me of my right to rescission, as outlined in the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), specifically Regulation Z ( 12 CFR 1026.23 ). This allows me to revoke any rights waived, particularly those related to the security interest. I am requesting the CUSIP number associated with the security interest provided to Barclays Bank. Failure to provide this information will leave me with no alternative but to initiate a level 3 audit on my account.

I expect prompt compliance with these requests to avoid further escalation of this matter. Failure to do so will be regarded as willful noncompliance and may result in legal action.

Please provide confirmation of receipt of this letter and a timeline for resolution of these issues.
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
_source.sub_issue: Reporting company used your report improperly

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I purchased a dog training program on XX/XX/XXXX that included a lifetime membership to group classes offered at least once per week. The total was {$3200.00} split into XXXX payments of {$1600.00} to the merchant name " XXXX XXXX ''. The first payment was transacted on XX/XX/XXXX and posted on XX/XX/XXXX. The second payment was transacted on XX/XX/XXXX and posted on XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX, the dog training company, decided that they would no longer honor the lifetime classes and instead charge a membership of $ XXXX. The company is still in business and not bankrupt, they have just changed their business model and will not honor previous contracts. Another way of thinking of it is if you purchased a yearly subscription for XXXX and 6 months later, XXXX announced that the yearly subscriptions would be cancelled, not honored or refunded and you would have to take the monetary loss and resubscribe on a monthly plan. 

I reached out to Bank of America to dispute one of the {$1600.00} charges from XXXX and the representative told me to mail a letter to their Texas Claims office since the transaction was over 2 months old. I mailed the letter and reason for delayed dispute and my claim was opened on XX/XX/XXXX. I received a request for more documentation but there was no upload option on the Bank of America website. I called and a representative told me to print out the documents and mail it tot the Texas Claims department. On XX/XX/XXXX I received a letter stating that the claim was denied because the dispute was too far back. I called Bank of America again to clarify the issue and was told to send another letter to the Texas Claims office with more detail. I did so, with more detail and documentation and a new claim was opened on XX/XX/XXXX. I received another letter of XX/XX/XXXX stating that the claim was denied again because of the time frame. 

It is clear that there is a disconnect in practice within the Bank of America and that their claims department is not putting the required time and attention into resolving their cases.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/2023, My wife and I, XXXX and XXXX XXXX applied for a HELOC loan online via the Bank of America website and it stated we would receive a letter in the mail, it didn't go on to state that we were declined. 

Today XXXX and I received a packet from Bank of America stating that we either need to sign enclosed document or upload documents that would be requested online via the website www.bankofamerica.com/hestatus, well the documentations is very misleading and leads us to believe that we could potentially get a home equity loan on our home that we have been in 22 years and never missed a payment. The representative at BOA stated that we were declined and that letter would follow up. The confusing thing is that on the website, it states that the approved amount is still pending then it says above that application is no longer active, if you can make heads or tails of all this more power to you but BOA cant have it both ways, if we were denied then why in the world would they send out documents leading us to believe that we might get the loan, why didn't we receive just a letter of declination instead, I informed the representative about the issue and she said they send these out to everybody regardless of approval. I dont buy that because that is misrepresentation, I have attached everything for you to review.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Hello, I made an in-person deposit in form of a United States Treasury check at my local Bank of America branch on XX/XX/XXXX and was assured the funds would be available the next business day. The teller swiped the check through their reader and verified the authenticity of the check. 

Later on in the evening of XX/XX/XXXX I received an email from Bank of America telling me that my funds would not be available until the end of the following week on XX/XX/XXXX due to them believing the item/check may be returned. 

That is simply unacceptable. We are talking about a somehow larger check, sure, but its a valid check from the US Treasury and not subject to significant holds under Regulation CC and if, on the rare occasion, an exception is invoked you better be very sure there are grounds for that and you arent placing an undue burden on the customer. A week and half hold for the full amount of the deposit of an, again, US TREASURY check is simply unacceptable, so I have to wonder why and how this decision was made. 

Apparently the person at the bank, who actually held the check and verified it, had no issues with it, so what happened here? Someone in the processing center came across this deposit and decided to just slap on a hold on it due to believing the funds wouldnt be available from the US Treasury? 

My account is in good standing and has always been so. My balances are typically in the neighborhood and have been in excess of this $ XXXX deposit, so its not like Im a new customer or someone who isnt known to the bank. 

Was it my foreign sounding name that caused someone to put this hold on my account, because I cant imagine what else it was? 

BoA didnt even attempt to mitigate the situation even somewhat by making a portion of the check available, but instead is holding the entire amount. 

BoA also did this after close of business at which point I couldnt go back into the branch and ask for the check back so I could deposit it at my credit union, who wouldnt have acted in this manner. 

There simply is no good reason to have this long of a hold on a properly endorsed check from the US Treasury, because surely if the check was fraudulent, law enforcement for the treasury wouldnt be waiting until the end of next week to notify BoA and myself of that l, and if the check cleared, it would happen also way before that, so for me to not have access to the funds before some arbitrary date is unacceptable.
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

_source.product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
_source.complaint_what_happened:
XXXX  XXXX XXXX  XX/XX/XXXX USAA XX/XX/XXXX According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 a states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy.I am the Consumer. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states '' It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX, XXXX and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) Never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. XXXX  XXXX XXXX  USAA are not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. 







" I am opting out of your reporting services.
_source.company_public_response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
_source.sub_issue: Reporting company used your report improperly

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states : a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions.

15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : No consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information : Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

_source.complaint_what_happened: Description of complaint : In XXXX, I spoke to BofA 's to cancel my owner 's HO3 policy for insurance on my new home. I was advised the HOA Master Policy covered it. I spoke with the insurance team and sent them a copy of the Master Policy on XXXX, and was told it was sufficient. Well 2 mortgage payments later, in XXXX, the escrow was still inclusive of the owner 's HO3. I received notice that it was denied, on XX/XX/XXXX, so I called back and was told that they would correct the request, and resubmit, and I had to cancel with my insurance company. On XX/XX/XXXX, i got an email that it was denied again. I called back and was then advised that it would take 30 days to process, and that XXXX would not include the insurance, but it did. I called on XX/XX/XXXX and spoke with 2 mgrs - one named XXXX, who finally advised she contacted the insurance team and confirmed the HOA Master Policy was sufficient, and that the insurance team would clear it up witihin 30 days, as it had to go through the final steps, and any money owed would come back in a check. She told to continue paying the full amount in the interim. Today, XX/XX/XXXX, i received a call from " XXXX - XXXX XXXX in PA '' stating she needs proof of insurance. I asked her why, she said she didnt know and transferred me to inurance. Insurance representative XXXX said she sees the policy was cancelled and the Master Policy was proven ok, so she transferred me back to customer service to get the policy removed. She merged customer service, - who said insurance would do it. XXXX XXXX wouldn't speak to me again, and the had her agent transfer me to insurance manager XXXX, who hung up on me. This is very unprofessional and high level incompetence. I will let social media know that BofA is a horrible morgage servicer, as my house is the only thing in jeopardy due to their incompetence. And mgmt doesn't care. Im a sad First Time Home Buyer. The only ones that can resolve my issue dont care enough.

_source.complaint_what_happened: I have already filed 2 complaints with USAA, and I filed one complaint with the FDIC, who referred me to Consumer Finance.gov. The FDIC stated they forwarded my complaint to your department. On XX/XX/XXXX, while my wife was sick with XXXX and Flu-B she transferred {$1100.00} into our USAA account XXXX XXXX, XXXX our XXXX bank account so I could pay our auto insurance bill with USAA. Also on the XXXX she unwittingly answered a spam call and quickly hung up. Later that same day someone named XXXX XXXX recived {$1000.00} out of our USAA account. Neither my wife, nor I know this person, and we did not approve this transaction. On XX/XX/XXXX, when I went to make our insurance payment, I noticed this money missing as well at other transactions which had occurred earlier in the day on XX/XX/XXXX : a transfer of {$1100.00} into our USAA account from we don't know where/ or who ; then four more XXXX transfers out of our account to people we do not know and obviously did not approve, {$200.00} to XXXX XXXX XXXX {$230.00} to XXXX XXXX XXXX {$500.00} to BrynGarrity, and {$570.00} to XXXX XXXX. Again we do not know any of these people, and did not authroize these transactions. When I spoke to a lady in the fraud dept for USAA she told me the transactions were initiated from my wife 's phone and were under an IP address associated with our physical address. She said the memo line stated 'puppies, ' and that this seems like an issue I'd need to take up with my wife, insinuating my wife used our auto insurance mone to purchase puppies. When I told the lady my wife did not spend money on puppies, that we already have dogs and have no desire for more, she became argumentative and insisted my wife is the cause of the missing money. She also stated USAA is not going to take responsibilty for the money their faulty security system allowed to be stolen from my account. Another customer service person I had spoken to previously stated this is a common problem through XXXX and banks can barely stay ahead of the criminals. Why do I have to go through insane security to speak to someone in customer service, but some criminals can easily steal money from my account? Then why is that theft blamed on my family when I, and my wife, are willing to sign an affidavit stating we did not authorize those transactions. Documents from USAA I received refernce claim # XXXX & XXXX.

_source.complaint_what_happened: As a federally protected consumer under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I am reporting numerous violations of the law by Barclays Bank Delaware and all three major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ). Not only has my nonpublic information been unlawfully reported by Barclays to each bureau against my written instruction, but the information reported includes numerous inaccuracies that require correction. The Privacy Act of 1974 and 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 4 ) both require that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. Furthermore, according to 15 USC 1681b, any consumer reporting agency may only furnish a consumer report in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. I have not given any instruction to the bureaus to report my nonpublic information. On the contrary, I have exercised my continuing right to opt out of any sharing of my nonpublic information per 16 CFR 313.7 that states a consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time by mailing an opt out notice to the creditor ( see attached letter sent to Barclays on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ). Barclays did not honor my notice when they reported past due payments and an account closure for my XXXX XXXX XXXX. According to 15 USC 1681a ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ) consumer reports can not lawfully contain information regarding the transactions between the consumer and the person making the report. 15 USC 1681c prohibits the reporting of any adverse items of information ; as such, derogatory reports like late payments, delinquencies, and account closures are in direct violation of the law. Furthermore, all three bureaus list my account as 120 days past due when, according to 15 USC 1666b ( a ), a creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose. Both 15 USC 1681 ( a ) and 15 USC 1681e require consumer reporting agencies to ensure the accuracy of the information they report, and there are numerous discrepancies and inaccuracies between the three bureaus reporting on this account. XXXX reports an account balance of {$16000.00} in XX/XX/XXXX while XXXX reports {$12000.00}. XXXX also reports scheduled payments of {$170.00} for XX/XX/XXXX and {$470.00} for XX/XX/XXXX while XXXX reports {$140.00} and {$340.00}, respectively. XXXX and XXXX show the date of first delinquency as XX/XX/XXXX while XXXX shows XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX reports a past due amount of {$0.00} for XX/XX/XXXX, while XXXX reports {$1700.00}. XXXX shows the account was closed in XX/XX/XXXX, while XXXX and XXXX both report it closing in XX/XX/XXXX. None of the bureaus report this card as XXXX XXXX, and it has been charged off since XX/XX/XXXX.

_source.sub_issue: Reporting company used your report improperly

I went to check my account and it was locked and I could not access anything so I waited until yesterday morning to contact the bank they told me that my account had been closed due to the fradulent check that was deposited no questions asked they just closed the account and stated that the funds remaining in the account would be mailed to me to me on XXXX XXXX. Also I got a call from XXXX XXXX XXXX stating that they were closing the account there as well with no explanation but to say the check was fradulent and with it being a new account it would close my account, I have every check and can prove everything being said.

_source.complaint_what_happened: Well per the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 ( a ) states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumer 's right to privacy. XXXX, XXXX and XXXX as the consumer reporting agencies has decided to continue to violate my consumer rights and so has Discover. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is supported by 15 USC 6801 which says " It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers ' nonpublic personal information. '' Discover is a financial institution by definition under that title. Discover has reported to XXXX, XXXX and XXXX as a charge off which is a certificate of indebtedness which means is considered income and income can not be report on a consumer report. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that i quote " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' The consumer which is me, I did nor do not consent. Discover XXXX and XXXX the Consumer reporting agency do not have my consent to furnish this information. So again I am writing XXXX XXXX XXXX and Discover to inform them they do not have my consent whether verbal, non verbal, written, imaged, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states and i quote " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless- the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option " XXXX XXXX and XXXX are definitely third parties. Discover never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. 15 USC1681 ( c ) ( a ) ( 5 ) says " Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account with Discover is an adverse item they are reporting without my permission which is hindering me the consumer and is against the law. And its being reported as a charge off. And there's more 15 USC 1681s-2 says '' ( a ) Duty of furnishers of information to provide accurate information ( 1 ) Prohibition ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. '' These are the law not my words so i don't know if they don't know the law or just don't care about it. 15 U.S. Code 1681e - Compliance procedures ( a ) " Identity and purposes of credit users Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. '' XXXX XXXX nor XXXX definitely are not maintaining reasonable procedures. As I mentioned multiple times I am opting out per 12 CFR 1016.7 which says " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. 15 USC 1681n Civil liability for willful noncompliance they are all ignoring my request and not complying. The Privacy Act of 1974 5 US Code 552a has been violated as well along with them violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act

_source.complaint_what_happened: A charge off account is showing on my report & the creditor told me that I can not get a copy of the 1099-C document because they did not officially charge off the debt and they didn't take a write off which is a violation because it says on my credit report that it is charged off which equates to false reporting & not reporting 100 % accurately. FCRA violations refers to a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, which is a federal law that regulates the collection, dissemination, and use of consumer credit information. Federal law requires that consumer reporting agencies follow reasonable procedures to ensure 100 % accuracy of the information contained in their credit reports. If a consumer suffers damages as a result of a FCRA violation they may be entitled to bring a private lawsuit against the CRA and recover actual damages, statutory damages, and attorney 's fees. These accounts listed on my letter are not 100 % correct and I demand them to be investigated completely.

Bank of America charged me a late credit card payment fee of {$40.00} on XX/XX/year> when my payment was due on XX/XX/year>. According to a new law they are NOT allowed to charge more than an {$8.00} late fee.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I had been paying my phone off for XXXX XXXXXXXX financing through Bank of America auto Bill Pay for nearly 3 years. Never missed a payment with them or ANY creditor. I've worked so hard to get and keep my credit up. My bill pay paid all my bills until, unbeknownst to me it just stopped for no reason. I learned this am that there was an issue when I looked on my credit karma account and learned that the Bank of America auto bill pay did not make the scheduled payment on XXXX and XXXX and my credit score took a bashing! This is the ONLY late payment or any derogatory marl and was NOT of my doing. I pay all my bills on time, every time. 
This issue is one caused by BOA bill pay suddenly not making the last 2 payments. I spoke to XXXX XXXXXXXX this am and paid them the full remaining balance ( approx {$130.00} & change ). The XXXX XXXXXXXX rep volunteered to me that he's seen this happen many times that a customer had a seller payment history, and paying through auto Bill Pay and it stopps. He advised I speak to BOA to get the fees credited by them and get help removing this from my credit file. I called BOA after that and the rep needed to verify the fees with XXXX XXXX so she called and we were in a 3 way call. Then as I was speaking the call dropped. I didn't know what to do since the call to XXXX  was a 3 way call initiated by BOA. I tried to call BOA back. It took forever to reach someone and then she was having technical difficulties and had a supervisor call me. When that supervisor called, we were in the midst of discussing and I was hoping to get everthing resolved and AGAIN- The call dropped! I called back to XXXX  to ensure they had issued the {$40.00} credit and they had. But I was to get BOA to refund me XXXX for the other fee. And help to get this off my credit file. 
I went to my BOA inbox and they had sent a message but did not acknowledge the XXXX refund. They also didn't say anything about addressing the ding to my credit. 
I want this fixed! 
This was not MY doing. 
BOA did not pay the auto payment. From looking on line, this is a complaint others have made. 

Please help me get this sorted out. I worked so hard for so long to get my credit score to where it was to have it damaged due to no fault of my own.

_source.complaint_what_happened: USAA does not give customers the option to set up weekly or biweekly scheduled automatic payments toward credit cards. They will only allow a once-a-month automatic scheduled payment of an amount I choose, or the minimum amount due. I feel this is predatory lending because it does not allow the consumer to make automatic scheduled payments that may help get the debt owed paid off sooner. USAA states that I can go online and make manual, individual payments as often as I want, but this is terribly inconvenient to the me, and it also puts the me at a disadvantage as the chance of missing a payment is much higher. USAA is preying on this opportunity to maximize interest collection, late fees, and not looking out for the best interest of the credit card holder. No solution has been offered by USAA at this time and their customer service representatives are stumped when I call and ask for help. Every single time the representative insists weekly payments are an option, and then can't find how to set it up either, and have no idea why it is not available.
