_source.complaint_what_happened:
Unknowingly on XX/XX/XXXX - I begin having trouble with PNC 's online banking platform. I submitted a payment online as I always do for XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX when I logged into system to make my XXXX payment, there was a total of {$2400.00}. When I looked at the posted transaction history, the last posted transaction was on XX/XX/XXXX. I immediately scheduled a payment with the entire amount. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I Iogged back into the online portal to set up reoccurring payments to avoid any further issues. While attempting to set up reoccurring payments, I noticed the transaction history showed the last posted transaction was still showing XX/XX/XXXX, and the past due balance was still showing XXXX. Now completely confused and concerned that maybe I did not click submit, I scheduled another payment. Now even more determined to set up reoccurring payments, the online portal was only giving me the option to use XXXX of XXXX external accounts that had been deleted. 

As I am working through this, ( all on XX/XX/XXXX ) I received a notification that my PNC account was 30 days late. I log back into the portal and don't see any record of my most recent payment of XXXX. The transaction history is still showing XX/XX/XXXX as the date of the last payment. I attempted to make another payment and a pop up box appeared asking me to confirm if I wanted to make a duplicate payment so I opted out. 

After opting out there is prompt to view payment history. This view enabled me to see the XXXX payments for XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX which showed complete and the other payment on XX/XX/XXXX which was showing in process which I ended up canceling. ( This is different from the transaction history on the main home screen ) On XX/XX/XXXX I contacted PNC because my account is still showing past due XXXX. I informed them that the payments I have made online are not reflected in my current balance. The customer service rep confirmed that their online banking does not readily sync or process. She advised that it would take up to XXXX hours for them to see the transaction on their end. I let her know as a result of the glitches and outdated framework I have a 30 day late. I asked if there was anyone that could remove this information because technically my account is not past due. Additionally, I also let her know that the payment I initiated on XX/XX/XXXX never posted or processed. 

I was eventually transferred to an XXXX Banking technician who confirmed that their systems are outdated and they have a technology update scheduled to be rolled out in XXXX. He also confirmed this upcoming update should alleviate some of the pains we have. I am certain from a regulatory perspective they have identified technology risks that impacts customer experience. Additionally, the lag in processing and updates puts many of us at risk for having incorrect information sent to the bureaus. 

My resolve to this was to set up reoccurring payments. The correct external account is not showing up on the external payments to complete a transfer. I was on the phone for over an hour to learn that because I'm not current I can't set up a reoccurring payment with the recently added external account even though my most recent payment of XXXX was showing complete and I used the very account to complete that payment.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
XXXX accordance with the fair credit Reporting act XXXX Account # XXXX, has violated my rights. 

15 USC 1681 Section 602 States I have the right to privacy.

15 USC 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions.

15 USC 1666B : A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose.

_source.product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
_source.complaint_what_happened:
BANK OF AMERICA XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX " I am opting out of your reporting services.

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 a states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' XXXX, XXXX and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies and I am the Consumer. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states '' It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX, XXXX and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) Never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. XXXX, XXXX and XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time.

" I am opting out of your reporting services.
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
_source.sub_issue: Reporting company used your report improperly

I am writing to file a formal complaint against Discover regarding the inaccurate reporting of my closed account on my credit report. Despite the closure of my account with Discover in XXXX, which is now over 7 years old, they have persistently reported false activity on my credit report, with the most recent instance occurring this month, XX/XX/XXXX. 

Under the Fair Housing Act, specifically code 1681 Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ), it is explicitly stated that inaccurate information must be removed from credit reports. Discover 's ongoing reporting of false activity on my closed and charged-off account directly violates this provision.

I am formally requesting the immediate removal of the inaccurate information from my credit report in accordance with the provisions outlined in the Fair Housing Act. It is imperative that Discover rectifies this matter promptly and ensures that accurate information is reflected on my credit report moving forward. 

I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to a swift resolution.

In XX/XX/XXXX, initiated settlement on a equity loan account ( House in lien for this account was foreclosed on XXXX ) with PNC Bank thru PNC loss and mitigation ( LM ). 
As of XX/XX/XXXX, all application and documents were filed. It was confirmed by LM and confirmed that the account will be stopped and closed. 
As of XX/XX/XXXX, settlement offer was received from PNC. All payment was made as of XX/XX/XXXX and on XX/XX/XXXX, received official letter from bank on receipt of payment and settlement in full with bank ( document available ). 

However, on my credit report from all three credit bureaus were showing as from XXXX XXXX to XXXX. XXXX as " Late Payment '' and from XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX as " Charge Off ''. 

I tried first to talk to bank on this wrong credit report, but they would just keep transferring me to different departments, not willing to work with me. 

Then, I filed dispute this first thru XXXX and XXXX corrected all these incorrect information after reviewing my dispute and filed documents. 
Afterwards, I filed dispute with XXXX, but XXXX agent is saying even though all information is clearly showing it was incorrect, they need to keep it because that is what the bank says it is. I haven't received any results from XXXX, yet.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. 

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate

_source.product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XXXX at XXXX EST I received a text message from my bank from ( XXXX } It stated : BofA security team : Did you attempt a sign in on the mobile app from XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX in XXXX XXXX Texas. Reply YES/NO/HELP to block this attempt. 
I replied NO as i had not. 
They stated " Thank you for confirming '' The text had come from a number that my bank sent me previously with the same phone number that had sent a legit notice once before. 

At XXXX my phone rang from a numher XXXX I did not answer it. No voice mail was left. At that time i reverse looked up the number that called to see who it was. The result of the look up stated it was from Bank of America Credit Card Customer Service. So they called back and I answered the phone call. 
The man on the phone stated that he was from Bank of America fraud department and that some suspicious activity was noticed on my account and that they had denied the transaction. That someon was currently logged into my account that was not me. He asked some routine questions to verify my account, appearing to have all of my account information " on file ''. He told me the last 4 digits of my bank account number and the last 4 digits of my social security number to confirm. 
In my mind this was a legit call and that he had my account open in front of him. As he clarified the exact amount of money in my account- which at that time was {$9900.00}. 
He told me that since the person was logged into my account they were going to have to shut down my debit card and to safeguard my money, open a new account in my name. 
He then told me that since the {$3500.00} had been charged I needed to XXXX transfer {$3500.00} from my old account, to my new account ( so transfer my money from myself to myself ) I then was sent a XXXX notice in my online banking account under XXXX activity AND a text message from his supervisor an " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' here is the message : XX/XX/XXXX Completed Incoming Request XXXX XXXX XXXX - email XXXX XXXX {$3500.00} Request date : XX/XX/XXXX Pay by : XX/XX/XXXX Confirmation number : XXXX Message : XXXX Reversal Refund instantly Case # XXXX He confirmed that the case number was XXXX A few moments later i received this : XX/XX/XXXX Completed Outgoing Transfer XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$3500.00} Actions Transfer date : XX/XX/XXXX Confirmation number : XXXX Message : XXXX Reversal Refund instantly Case # XXXX He stated that the XXXX was a charge the person who was in my account had made and to get my money back I had to zelle myself my XXXX back. 

Still with all of my questioning him this looked legit. I got a text stating that I had approved the XXXX transaction and that it had gone through. 
At that point he stated that he needed to transfer me to his supervisor to confirm all of the information thus far and that they would help me " open a new account '' so that my money would be safe. He assured me that the XXXX was in my bank and was already in my new account waiting on the transfer of the rest of the funds in my account. 
The supervisor asked me to open a facetime link sent in a text. Her contact info was " XXXX This was at XXXX. She then told me that I needed to open my online banking app on my phone and that she would walk me through opening my new account. Of course, hitting " share my screen '' so that she could help.After all the steps she went through to add the XXXX user she sent a " bank of america XXXX payment code ... several of these were sent as the call progressed.The codes were XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Of course, she asked to verify the code number that was sent. The first code was from sending XXXX from myself TO myself and the last 4 were her trying to get XXXX to go through XXXX to put the rest of my money in my new account. 
She then sent a text with a link on it : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX And I was to click it. 
It was told to me that it was a verification link I spent quite a bit of time on the phone with this lady. And then she kept trying to transfer the rest of the funds to keep my account safe and it kept rejecting. she put me on a " brief hold '' to consult with her supervisor and the call dropped. 

I then IMMEDIATLY called the bank of america fraud number from the bank of america website XXXX and verified that was the phone number on the back of my card. This was at XXXX I spent 1 hour and 31 minutes on the phone with them going all over this and finding out that I had been scammed and that I had not, infact, sent XXXX from myselfto myself. And that the new account number i was assigned was XXXX was not legit. They helped me file a REGULATION E claim. 
I then started researching all this fraud and what to do to get reimbursed since this XXXX was obtained through fraud returned too me. The 2 case id 's for this are : XXXX and XXXX. And ended the call. 
Through my research, I called the bank today : ( XXXX ) to confirm the information I had learned as to what to do next to help with the banks investigation. I asked first if I needed a police report, no one had mentioned this previously on the phone. And said I would do this. I then asked if XXXX was part of bank of america, they said it was and so i confirmed that since they were, getting this XXXX returned to my account sould not be a problem since I am protected under REGULATION E correct? and he said it had to be investigated. I also confirmed wtih him that REGULATION E states : **IMPORTANT UPDATE** The EFTA distinguishes between intentionally providing access to someone, like a friend or family member, and access obtained by fraud or robbery. For example, an account holder who provides their PIN to someone falsely pretending to be a bank representative is protected by the EFTA. In one recent case, a bank argued the account holder authorized an EFT after an identity thief manipulated him into providing his bank information. The court disagreed and found the EFT was unauthorized because the account holder was defrauded.If you or someone on your behalf initiates the EFT for fraudulent purposes, and If the transfer was initiated by the financial institution or its employees. 

Experts say any situation in which access to a device was obtained through fraud would be covered under Regulation E. So if someone gets your password through a phishing scam and transfers money, Regulation E would apply. 

Experts say any situation in which access to a device was obtained through fraud would be covered under Regulation E. So if someone gets your password through a phishing scam and transfers money, Regulation E would apply. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX operating company, has now confirmed a policy change back on XX/XX/XXXX that requires XXXX XXXX bank and credit union participants to reimburse consumers for what it calls qualifying impostor scams He confirmed that this was actual information and that I needed to file a police report and bring them a copy of it. 


XXXX submission : Submission Successful Your incident report has been submitted and you will receive a confirmation e-mail shortly. Thank you for using XXXX Police to Citizen. 

Submission Number XXXX If you do not receive the confirmation email within a few minutes, please check your Spam or Junk email folder. 

Bank of America basically has told me " too bad and contact the person you sent the money to. '' Also, they contacted XXXX bank where the money was sent and XXXX said no they will not return the funds.

_source.complaint_what_happened: National Credit Systems sent a debt collection letter for a joint debt that me and my daughter had XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX at XXXXXXXX XXXX my daughter and I contacted National Credit Systems to settle a debt. We spoke with XXXX XXXX who we settled the debt with. We settled for {$1300.00} at which we used two credit cards to pay, {$750.00} on XXXX card and {$600.00} on the other one. XXXX advised us we would receive a receipt by email and this listing would be removed from our credit reports. He advised us to check National Credit System online portal on the next day which would have been Saturday and the balance would update and we would receive a receipt. The first thing we noticed on Saturday when we checked the portal is that only the {$750.00} payment is showing and not the payment of {$600.00} and no where was we able to locate a receipt or a letter showing the debt satisfied. We contacted National Credit Systems back on Monday XX/XX/XXXX around XXXXXXXX XXXX and we advised XXXX that we wasnt able to locate a receipt, the letter that would state we paid and a pay for delete letter. XXXX seems to get aggravated with us because we was asking questions trying to get the documents he promised to us before we made a payment. And also something seems very fraudulent about the entire transaction. The online portal only reflects the {$750.00} payment and not the {$600.00} payment. Once we started to ask questions XXXX puts us on hold and said his manager was typing up a letter that shows the debts not paid in full but satisfied. After we hung the call up, we received a phone call back from XXXX and he stated he was trying to collect a debt??? We stated to him we just settled a debt so how u calling back as if we didnt just settle for XXXX. That was very unsettling because wouldnt there be account notes that would show we just settled. Something about the entire transaction just seems fraudulent. We have the phone call recorded for our protection because money is involved. National Credit Systems updated our credit report and the listing done reflect what he told us it would or not even removed. It says we owe {$1600.00} from {$2300.00}. We paid XXXX so what happen to the other payment of {$600.00}? Something seems very fraudulent about their collection practices and we want this removed from our credit and the correct documentation as we were told we would receive.

My wife and I went on an XXXX XXXX mid last-year with XXXX XXXX During our stay on the ship, we were changed daily for our room to be cleaned. However, we noticed that the fridge was never cleaned. As a matter of fact, a spilled drink stayed in the fridge for the entire week. I sent Apple/Goldman Sachs a picture of this, along with emails that i had sent to XXXX XXXX ( to which XXXX ) never responded. I opened a dispute with Apple/Goldman Sachs , disputing the charge of {$970.00} ( the total cost of cleaning the room on the ship ). Twice now they have come back and denied me. And they've asked me to resubmit it. And I do. This time they finally sent me a message over the weekend that the dispute has been resolved in my favor, only to backtrack today and send me an email telling me they had overturned their decision. 

I have spent months and time and energy going back and forth with the merchant, as well as Apple/Goldman Sachs about this. This is not a difficult decision. It is clear to see that the merchant did not provide the service we paid for. And we should not be charged this amount.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Subject : Dispute Regarding Debt Collection by Unknown Company Dear CFPB, I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to bring to your attention a matter of concern regarding a debt collection agency that has been pursuing me for a debt that I have no knowledge of. I believe there may be discrepancies in the contract or signatures associated with this debt, and I am uncertain about the legitimacy of the company involved. 

[ NATIONAL CREDIT SYSTEMS INC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Cash Amount : {$16000.00} ] Despite multiple attempts to seek clarification and validation of this debt, I have not received any concrete evidence or information about the alleged debt 's origin or validity. Furthermore, I have not been able to identify the debt collection agency itself, as they have not provided sufficient contact information. 
I understand the importance of addressing legitimate debts and fulfilling my financial responsibilities. However, I am deeply concerned about the lack of transparency and the possibility of fraudulent activity in this matter. 
I kindly request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this issue and take appropriate action to ensure that my rights as a consumer are protected. Specifically, I would appreciate your assistance in : * Verifying the legitimacy of the debt collection agency in question. 
* Requiring the agency to provide complete and accurate documentation regarding the debt, including any contracts or signatures. 
* Ensuring that all communication from the debt collection agency adheres to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 
I am committed to resolving this matter responsibly, but I need your help in verifying the validity of this debt and the actions of the unidentified collection agency. I look forward to your prompt attention to this issue and request that you keep me informed of any progress made. 
Thank you for your time and assistance in this matter. Your efforts to protect consumers like me are greatly appreciated. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
_source.issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

_source.complaint_what_happened: My fianc has an Apple Card and added me as an authorized user. Apple sent me a physical card and also created a virtual card in Apple Pay for me to use. The Apple Card does not have the card information printed on it - that information is stored in the virtual Apple Card in the iPhone wallet. I am unable to view the card information in the virtual wallet due to an error that Apple is aware of. I have communicated with Apple support over the last 3 months and no resolution has come for this issue. Therefore, Im unable to view or know my Apple card #, expiration date and CVV. Im unable to use the card to make online purchases or any purchases requiring that information. I have communicated with Apple support over chat, over the phone, sent diagnostic reports to support and allowed them to remote into my phone to investigate and to take screen recordings. There has been no communication to me with an ETA on when this issue will be resolved. I need to be able to view and access this information in order to have full use of the credit card.

_source.complaint_what_happened: Early in XX/XX/XXXX, I accidentally found out that our BoA credit card balance had been charged twice ( back-to-back days ) to our BoA checking account. We called a few times to have the error fixed and, eventually, one of the two balance charges was correctly returned to our checking account. In XX/XX/XXXX, however, the problem recurred ( XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX : USD XXXX ). We called several times and, eventually, on XX/XX/XXXX one of the two balance charges was both refunded to our checking account and yet recharged to our credit card new balance as " returned unpaid '' ( as well as interests and fees ), now nonsensically due on XX/XX/XXXX ). We called again, were told that it would be fixed, but never was. Even worse, the same problem recurred in XX/XX/XXXX ( XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX : USD XXXX ). Once again, we called several times, the balance was returned and yet re-recharged to the new balance of our credit card ( due in XX/XX/XXXX, we believe ). At that point, we looked back ward till the beginning of XXXX and found that, unbeknownst to us, our credit card had been charged twice to our checking account even in XX/XX/XXXX, but on the phone we were told that, after 12 months, that charge was no longer refundable. We even went to our local BoA branch, but were told they have no access to our credit card account and could not help us. This whole 18-month long ordeal is a scandal. BoA, from time to time, charges our checking account twice the balance of our BoA credit card.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX I called in to Barclays to pay off my credit card $ XXXX. I explained to the agent that I would like to have the account paid in full and for the account to be closed and for that information to be relayed to XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and XXXX. The rep placed me on hold and came back with the payoff. I gave her my financial information and she thanked me for my business and explained that she would handle every thing on her end to close the account and to notify the credit bureaus. 

3 weeks go by and I received notice that the account was past due. I called Barclays to find out why and was advised that the rep from XX/XX/XXXX may not have given the correct payoff and that they recognized that it was their error and that they would be reversing the last amount on the account and as a precaution contacting the bureaus to advise that I was not past due and the account was paid in full and in good standing. 

Another few weeks go by and I received another notice of delinquency. The previous rep did not do anything that they said they were going to do. So the new rep got a manager on the phone and she apologized and said that she would have to escalate it to a different department and I would be getting a call back in around 2 weeks. I never received a call and a few weeks later received another collections notice. 

I called to Barclays again and a rep explained to me that he saw the notes in the system that the account was being handled and that it takes 1-2 billing cycles for the update to take affect and he ensured me that there would be and had not been any adverse reporting to the credit bureaus. 

Fast forward to this past weekend and I receive another notice of collections from Barclays for {$60.00} and now I received notice from XXXX XXXX and XXXX that my scores have dropped by over XXXX points. Barclays is reporting the account delinquent and my credit is adversely being effected. Barclays is completely inept and can not do their jobs, and DO NOT do their jobs. This has gone round and round and round and today the situation is going back into " review '' for which I'm supposed to wait 2 weeks to hear from someone. I am supposed to be purchasing a new vehicle this week and my credit score will determine what interest rate I qualify for. I may end up paying thousands and thousands in additional interest as a result of Barclays ineptitude and unwillingness to correct their errors. 

Please help!

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Let me first say Target has poor customer service. I got hung up on by a supervisor and lied to by a specialist. I will No longer give them my money! 

The company is going against my consumer rights. 
Violating US codes 1681a 2 ). ( i ), US code 1666b ( a ), US code 1681e ( b ).

According to US Code 1681a 2 ). ( I ) report containing information solely as a transaction or experience between the Consumer and the Person making the report. My experience is the relationship between the transaction and the creditor or the person of the corporation that extends the line of credit that is used at a particular time of the account. Which is the consumer, which is me and the person making the report. 

Moreover, US Code 1666b ( a ) states A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose. 

Stated by the Internal Revenue Service ( IRS ) Instruction for forms 1099-A and 1099-C. A 1099-C must be filled regardless of whether the debtor is required to report the debt as income. Income does not get reported on your consumer report. Therefore, a consumer of a charge-off being reported on your consumer report is illegal because it is ordinary income. If a charge off is being reported on your consumer report it is not accurate and reasons to believe the whole account is fraudulent according to the IRS from instruction form 1099-A and 1099C. 

Lastly, US Code 1681e ( b ) explains, Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 
This statement explains doing so will presume a 1099-C, that must be filled according to the IRS as mentioned above. The status of a charge-off is an inaccurate account and it must be deleted.

Under 15 US Code 1681b ( 2 ) I am exercising my right and I demand these inaccurate accounts be deleted Immediately.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
My family and I were 15 year customers of USAA with 2 checking accounts and 1 savings account serving all of our monthly banking activity. These joint accounts are what my family and I used to pay bills, deposit paychecks into, save for the short term, and use for daily purchases. I handle all of the finances in the household, but my wife is on as a joint account holder so that she has equal control as Im away from the home quite a bit in the XXXX XXXX. A few months ago, I logged onto USAA and was required to answer a few questions about the account usage in order to continue to the accounts. They were simple, seemingly unimportant questions so that USAA could understand our customers and how an account will be used. This information may include, but is not limited to, the source of funds used to open the account, purpose of the account, anticipated account activity, country of citizenship and occupation ( Information obtained from the account closure notice ). 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I signed into my accounts and saw that 2 of my 3 accounts were missing, and one was put into a credit only status. I called USAA and they informed me that the accounts were closed because of missing information pertaining to my wifes profile, but the customer service agent was just as XXXX  as to why they would close the account and wasnt able to provide any more information to me. I had my wife call and they went over the same questions that I faced earlier, How often do you use the account?, How many checks do you write, etc.. Questions that I answered months ago, but it was too late, the accounts were already closed and nobody could help in reinstating them. 

Were now left waiting XXXX days for my checks to arrive so that we have money to open a new account and so that I have a place to deposit checks from my employer. In the meantime, we cant pay our mortgage, monthly bills, or use cash in any way. We now have to explain to creditors that we have no bank for the near-term, and are required to reach out to those with checks that weve recently wrote to please not cash them. Were XXXX. 

No attempts were made to contact my wife using our communication preference methods on the account of text and phone call. Shes mostly hands off from the accounts other than the daily use of the debit card and the writing of checks. 

How is this moral? If this information is so important why werent there phone calls made to my wife? Why were the accounts not merely frozen until that information was provided? Very little effort was made on the part of USAA to maintain us as customers. The impact this has had on our lives is not insignificant and is enough to tarnish a 15 year relationship and drive us to another institution for our banking needs.
_source.company_public_response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX  I received a series of alerts from my credit card company Barclay 's Arrival Plus XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX about charges from XXXX. I immediately checked and did not recognize the series of charges. I reached out immediately and my card was shut down and I was told I would be issued a refund in 1-2 billing cycles. I was told I would have to pay the charges until the case was investigated or else I would be billed interest, so I paid my balance in full ( including the disputed charges ). 

Attached is a copy of the credit card statement listing the charges from XXXX which total {$780.00}. 

I do not think I was supposed to have to pay the disputed charges as I was told while the case was being investigated and it is taking longer than I was told to resolve the issue. 

I have still not been issued a refund and after calling today to find out the status of my case, I was placed on a 20+ minute hold that was supposed to be a couple of minutes while they " researched '' my case. Nobody ever came back on the line. 

I need help getting this company to return my funds. I have run into fraudulent charges before with other personal and business credit cards, and I have never had an experience like this. First, I have never been told I needed to pay the disputed charges. They were removed from my balance while being investigated. Second, the investigation never took anywhere near this long to resolve. The charges were always very easily identified as fraud. Since Barclay 's alerted me, I am sure they knew the charges were likely unauthorized and fraudulent.

_source.product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
_source.complaint_what_happened:
As stated in Section 602 ( a ) of the FCRA, there is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and respect for the consumer 's right to privacy. As a consumer, I have the right to protect my private information from being shared without my consent.

Under Section 6801 of the FCRA, it is the policy of Congress that financial institutions have an obligation to protect the privacy and confidentiality of their customers ' nonpublic personal information. As a " furnisher of information to credit agencies, '' Discover falls under this definition of a financial institution.

I want to bring to your attention Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) of the FCRA, which states that consumer reporting agencies may only furnish consumer reports with the written consent of the consumer to whom the report relates. I have not provided my written consent for Discover to furnish my information to consumer reporting agencies such as XXXX, XXXX  and XXXX. Therefore, all consent, whether verbal, non-verbal, written, implied, or otherwise, is hereby revoked.

Furthermore, under Section 6802 ( b ) ( c ) of the FCRA, financial institutions are required to inform consumers of their right to exercise a nondisclosure option. I was never informed by Discover of my right to opt out of having my information shared with consumer reporting agencies.

I also want to bring to your attention Section 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) of the FCRA, which prohibits consumer reporting agencies from reporting " any other adverse item of information '' without the consumer 's permission. By reporting this account without my consent, Discover is in violation of this law.

Moreover, Section 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the FCRA prohibits the furnishing of inaccurate information to consumer reporting agencies. If Discover knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information being reported is inaccurate, it is your responsibility to correct or remove it from my credit report.

Finally, according to 12 CFR 1016.7, I have the right to opt out of your reporting services at any time. I am exercising that right and demanding that Discover cease reporting my information to consumer reporting agencies.
_source.sub_issue: Reporting company used your report improperly

I wish to move my businesses to another bank that still uses tellers instead of a machine, and also the account has a horrible interest rate of just XXXX percent, and I can get much better rates elsewhere. A relative opened the accounts for my children and put my husband 's name on it as the adult. But since then, my husband has died. I have letters of administration in my name for the estate, and we were not divorced, nor in any way involved with any sort of custodial disputes ( as we were married and living in our house like normal people, etc., at the time of his death ) and I can provide the children 's birth certificates. The bank refuses to let me move the accounts without a court order showing I have guardianship ( of my own children, who have always lived in our house and have never been involved in any sort of custody dispute ). The court and attorney fees involved to get this unnecessary paperwork would almost be worth more than the value in the accounts. The folks I've spoken with at the courthouse do not understand why this is required. If this is a bank policy, it is poorly planned. I would like them to release the accounts without having to spend hundreds of dollars in court and lawyer fees, not to mention the time to show up for hearings. I have also filed a complaint with their corporate customer service line.

I am writing to bring to your attention a matter of utmost urgency regarding a dispute that requires immediate resolution. s : 1. _source.complaint_what_happened: Well per the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 ( a ) states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumer 's right to privacy. XXXX XXXX and XXXX as the consumer reporting agencies has decided to continue to violate my consumer rights and so has TD BANK USA/TARGET. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is supported by 15 USC 6801 which says " It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers ' nonpublic personal information. '' TD BANK USAXXXXTARGET is a financial institution by definition under that title. TD BANK USAXXXXTARGET has reported to XXXX XXXX and XXXX as a charge off which is a certificate of indebtedness which means is considered income and income can not be report on a consumer report. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that i quote " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' The consumer which is me, I did nor do not consent. TD BANK USAXXXXTARGET XXXX XXXX and XXXX the Consumer reporting agency do not have my consent to furnish this information. So again I am writing XXXX XXXX XXXX  and TD BANK USA/TARGET to inform them they do not have my consent whether verbal, non verbal, written, imaged, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states and i quote " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless- the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option " XXXX , XXXX and XXXX are definitely third parties. Now that's not lawfully. TD BANK USA/TARGET  never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. 15 USC1681 ( c ) ( a ) ( 5 ) says " Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account with TD BANK USA/TARGET is an adverse they are reporting without my permission which is hindering me the consumer and is against the law. You know like not lawful. 15 USC 1681s-2 says '' ( a ) Duty of furnishers of information to provide accurate information ( 1  ) Prohibition ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. '' These are the law not my words so i don't know if they don't know the law or just don't care about it. 15 U.S. Code 1681e - Compliance procedures ( a ) " Identity and purposes of credit users Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. '' XXXX XXXX nor XXXX definitely are not maintaining reasonable procedures. As I mentioned multiple times I am opting out per 12 CFR 1016.7 which says " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. 15 USC 1681n Civil liability for willful noncompliance they are all ignoring my request and not complying. The Privacy Act of 1974  5 US Code 552a has been violated as well along with them violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act. Then had the nerves to report it as a Charge Off knowing that's income because its a certificate of indebtedness but yet its on my consumer report. Well XXXX 's reporting 's appear to be different then the other 2 Reporting Consumer Credit agencies in this report. It appears as tho these 4 Companies don't know the rules or are saying XXXX XXXX and the law.

_source.complaint_what_happened: In the early hours of XX/XX/17 I was XXXX while at a bar on vacation in XXXX XXXX, when I woke up the next morning my phone, wallet, watch, and XXXX had been stolen. I called my financial service companies & cancelled all of my cards, BofA gave me difficulties in finding the nature of the transactions that took place as they would not verify me with a social security number but instead required the last 6 digits of my STOLEN card. They froze my account for future transactions but did not alert me to the charges that had been incurred until I went into the branch location on the following Tuesday ( Monday was a bank holiday ). In spite of this, the charges had not yet been posted so we contacted the fraud department at the physical branch and were able to open a claim on the charges. Bank of America then rejected the claim, stating that the information was either verified via SMS ( possible due to the stolen phone ) or by fraud agent ( which would be a massive security failure if true ). I was able to appeal the claim, to which BofA requested a copy of the police report and a statement from my phone provider showing the device was blacklisted as stolen & a new device reconnected to my phone number. I provided both of these things, and in addition provided a FTC, IRS, and FBI report on one of the individuals/accounts involved with the XXXX transactions . In spite of all of this, Bank of America advised they failed to stop the transaction process and since the other bank, XXXX, did not simply give the money back, they were stepping out of the situation entirely. I was advised any further action would require me to have the XXXX subpoena XXXX XXXX  in order to provide any further justification.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/2024, my PNC digital debit card within XXXXXXXX XXXX was charged, after providing merchant with another form of payment ( a physical card ) needed for a pre-authorization hold. The final payment was settled with that of payment from the physical card I provided. 
On XX/XX/2024, I noticed the charge on PNC online banking app and called in to discuss the issue and dispute. I was told to call back if and once charge had posted. 
On XX/XX/2024, I contacted PNC to dispute the posted charged from the merchant and advised I had used another form of payment. I also advised that the incident could have happened due to the merchants POS being sensitive and my phone was near when I was told I would need a physical card for the pre-authorization, however I was not informed by merchant that I was accidentally charged already. 
The call with the claims intake representative was disconnected on PNCs end and I was not contacted back. Without my knowledge my card was canceled and I was locked out of online banking and was not able to use telephone banking due to not having a pin. This caused a huge inconvenience in attempting call back into PNC. Another agent was then able to file another dispute. 
On XX/XX/2024 I sent an email to XXXX with the supporting documentation of proof of payment by another entity as advised by branch representative. 
In follow up, around the first week in XXXX I stopped at a PNC branch in XXXX NC and spoke with branch banker regarding dispute and at that time the banker made an internal call to claims were they confirmed my documents were received. 
On XX/XX/2024, I received a denial letter. 
On XX/XX/2024, I contacted PNC and was told the denial was due to failure to submit proof of another payment. 
PNCs lack of communication and initiative to follow & execute the claims process for a merchant dispute has caused me unnecessary distress and delays in dissolving banking relationship.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
In XXXX XXXX I called a First Horizon customer service representative to close my checking/savings account. During the conversation the customer service representative confirmed that my account was closed. However, the account was never closed. 

I started receiving bank statements in XX/XX/XXXX via email. Prior to this I had not received any communication, letters, emails or phone calls from First Horizon bank. I decided to go into a branch in XX/XX/XXXX to find out why I was still receiving bank statements when I closed the account in XXXX XXXX. During this meeting a branch manager told me that the account was charged off because the account had a negative balance applied to it in XX/XX/XXXX. I paid the balance to the bank and was given receipts of payment/the charged off amount. This was the first time I was notified the account was charged off. I was confused as to why I would have any charges associated with the account when I called a customer service agent, per the instructions by the bank, to close the account in XXXX XXXX. First Horizon does not allow you to close your account online. They require you to speak with a CSR to close an account. 

It concerns me that my credit with the banking systems was damaged by First Horizons action to charge off my account instead of not contacting me. I would like First Horizon bank to send me a detailed letter explaining why my account was not closed by the CSR in XXXX XXXX when I called to have it closed.

On XXXX, I opened a checking account using a promotional offer : They would give me {$450.00} if I had a qualifying direct deposit. 

I had my qualifying deposit on XX/XX/XXXX, and never got my promo code. I waited and nothing. 

Today, XX/XX/XXXX, I inquired about it and I was told that as my account was in negative, I didn't receive the {$450.00}. In first place, the negative balance was something with the charges they made for a service I didn't ask. In second place, the flyer said that the deposit was going to be made XXXX  days after the qualifying activity ( which is the direct deposit ). 

Then, the agent went to ask a colleague and was told that it is XXXX  days after the XXXX  day period of the account standing in good balance. 

I am attaching the flyer. It doesn't say that the {$450.00} will be deposited after XXXX  days of the XXXX  day period. It states that the deposit has to be made within XXXX  days, but nothing about posting the balance. 

They highlighted that " The Bonus will be paid to positive balance accounts '' My account was positive after the XXXX  days of the qualifying direct deposit ( XX/XX/XXXX ), so I should qualify for the promo. My account went to negative due to a charge they posted for a service i didn't ask for, but that's a different situation.

Last Friday, when I checked my Bank of America, checking account, which I opened here in XXXX, North Carolina, I noticed that the bank had cashed five checks from a gentleman named XXXX XXXX, totaling {$4100.00} ( check # XXXX for {$600.00} ; check # XXXX for {$930.00} ; check # XXXX for {$1300.00} ; check # XXXX for {$86000.00} ; check # XXXX for {$35000.00} ) At that moment, I called the bank to report it, and the Fraud Department is currently investigating the case. On Saturday morning, there were two more checks from the same person for {$1900.00} ( check # XXXX for {$530.00} ; check # XXXX for {$1300.00} ) which surprised me greatly since I had reported and requested an account cancellation the day before. 
Bank of America is investigating these fraudulent transactions, but I wanted to report to you because it is very likely that not only my financial information has been compromised but also my personal information. I will be taking the necessary steps with the Police of XXXX, the Fraud Section of the United States Department of Justice as well. 
I don't understand why Bank of America doesn't have a good financial security system and allows funds from my bank account to be used with checks that don't have my name or signature. I haven't even requested checks from Bank of America. Actually, what gives me the impression is a precarious system with few safeguards, which concerns me greatly because they have all my information, such as a copy of my green card, social security, and driver 's license. They request this information to open their customers ' bank accounts. 
I urge your assistance since I have not received any information in writing from the bank and I need my funds back. They mentioned that the process can take up to 90 days to have my money back. I hope you can help me to expedite my claim. 
Enclosed you can find print screen of checks and print screen of online statement. 
Thanks in advance,
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I had opened a First Progress Secured Credit Card on XX/XX/XXXX. Since having the card, I have had perfect payment history, as this card is advertised as a " great card for credit rebuilding ''. 
On XX/XX/XXXX I had used the card to make a purchase of {$510.00} ( I had a {$1000.00} limit ). 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I had used to the card to make a purchase of {$79.00}. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I made a payment to First Progress for the entire outstanding balance of {$590.00}. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, First Progress closed my account. They said they had sent me a letter asking for proof from my bank that I sent my payment ; a letter which I never received. They did not call me from customer service either. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I had called First Progress Customer Support, to inquire as to why they would suddenly close a " secured credit card '' account without notifying me. Their explanation was that " I didn't reply to their letter within the required period of time ( the letter which I never recieved ), and for " security reasons '', my account was closed. 
When I then inquired about the refund of my {$1000.00} deposit, they informed me that it would be mailed to me. They told me that this process takes up to XXXX weeks!!! I find this totally unacceptable for several reasons : First, this will negatively impact my credit score by lowering my age of credit, as well as 3 years of perfect payment history, Secondly, I no longer have this {$1000.00} of credit available, Third, taking XXXX weeks to refund my deposit seems almost " criminal '' to me, as I know that First Progress will be keeping my security deposit in an interest bearing account and making money and profit off me in an underhanded manner ; I asked for them to expedite the repayment of my security deposit and as told that I would have to contact their " back office '' as ask for them to expedite my repayment, however they did not guarantee in any decrease in this XXXX week wait for my refund. 
Lastly, this is going to negatively effect my credit by lowering my age of credit, available credit and overall payment history.
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

_source.complaint_what_happened:
We were rear-ended on XX/XX/year>, at XXXX XXXX. We immediately contacted USAA to report the accident. XXXX 's XXXX XXXX towed the car to their lot. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXX PM, we authorized USAA to move our car to an authorized USAA repair facility, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, to estimate and repair the damage. USAA contacted us via message to inform us that, based on their investigation of our loss, we had " 0 % liability. '' On Friday, XX/XX/year>, XXXX informed us that the repairs were more extensive than initially thought and that they were not equipped to handle the repairs the car might need. 

On XX/XX/year>, we found XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX in XXXX, North Carolina. We immediately contacted USAA 's XXXX XXXX XXXX at XXXX to inform them of the change in repair facilities. 

On XX/XX/year>, USAA towed the car to XXXX & XXXX XXXX. That same day, USAA issued a payment to XXXX in the amount of {$6300.00} ( for the original estimate - before they discovered further damage and alerted us to their inability to repair our car ). We called USAA and asked them to cancel the {$6300.00} to XXXX because the car was no longer at their facility. 

On XX/XX/year>, USAA redirected the {$6300.00} payment to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

On XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX provided USAA with an estimate for repairs ( Supplement of Record XXXX with Summary ) for {$31000.00}. 

On XX/XX/year>, USAA adjuster XXXX XXXX ( License Number : XXXX ) approved XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX supplemental claim. ( Estimated repair date : On ( or about ) XX/XX/year>. 

On XX/XX/year>. XXXX XXXX informed us that the car was a " total loss. '' On XX/XX/year>, we received a market valuation report for {$65000.00} to settle our loss claim. We contacted USAA to dispute the amount. After negotiations, we agreed to settle our claim for {$69000.00}. 

On XX/XX/year>, we received the updated " Settlement Agreement '' and signed in to " XXXX '' ( USAA title counterpart ) to sign the appropriate paperwork. XXXX informed us that USAA would release funds to our lien holder, and we would receive the amount above and beyond our pay-off after all paperwork was verified and completed. 

On XX/XX/year>, we contacted XXXX XXXX  XXXX to authorize the release of our car to XXXX. 

On XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX ( from USAA ) emailed us to inform us that XXXX was scheduled to pick up the car from XXXX XXXX XXXX  on Friday, XX/XX/year>. 

On XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX notified us that USAA would settle the outstanding lien with XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX for the car in their possession. However, due to a USAA accounting regulation, we are unable to obtain our share of the agreed settlement until USAA retrieves the payment made to XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX on XX/XX/year>, amounting to {$6300.00}. The timing of this remains uncertain.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Subject : Unauthorized Credit Reporting and Demand for Resolution Reference to Federal and North Carolina Laws Dear BARCLAYS BANK DELAWARE, I am writing to address a serious concern regarding the unauthorized reporting of information to my credit report, as protected by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) under Sections 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ), 1681c ( a ) ( 2 ), and 1681s-2 ( a ), North Carolina Identity Theft Protection Act, specifically Chapter 75A of the North Carolina General Statutes.

It has come to my attention that BARCLAYS BANK DELAWARE has engaged in unauthorized reporting to my credit report without obtaining my explicit consent. Federal law, as outlined in the FCRA, mandates that consumer consent is a necessary requirement for such reporting activities under Section 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ).

Furthermore, North Carolina state law, particularly Chapter 75A of the North Carolina General Statutes, reinforces the requirement for consumer consent for credit reporting. This legislation aims to protect individuals from identity theft and unauthorized use of personal information.

I assert with certainty that I have not provided consent for BARCLAYS BANK DELAWARE to report any information to my credit report. This lack of explicit permission constitutes a violation of my rights and could potentially damage my creditworthiness, in clear defiance of federal and state laws.

I demand that BARCLAYS BANK DELAWARE immediately ceases any further reporting of information to my credit report without obtaining my explicit consent, as mandated by Section 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ) of the FCRA and Chapter 75A of the North Carolina General Statutes. Failure to comply within the stipulated XXXX timeframe will be considered willful noncompliance, subject to penalties under applicable laws, including North Carolina identity theft protection laws.

Obtaining consent is not optional but a legal obligation under these specific sections of the FCRA and North Carolina state law. This is a demand for compliance with both federal and state regulations, protecting consumers like myself from unauthorized and damaging credit reporting.

I expect immediate attention to this matter and urge BARCLAYS BANK DELAWARE to rectify these violations promptly, respecting my rights under federal and state laws.

Done in good faith.
_source.issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

_source.complaint_what_happened:
This issue is with Marcus by Goldman Sachs bank savings account. This has been going on for the last 5 days, and is in regard to attempts to execute a wire transfer of $ XXXX to fund a closing of a XXXX  property valued at $ XXXX. With multiple attempts on the phone and with several transfers to higher up holds, we are told that the money is on hold and we will not be able to transfer it out until XXXX XXXX  of XXXX, 2024. This makes it total of 15 days of bank holding money. At this point in time, we are at the mercy of the bank to close the deal. Please see the chronological events bellow in detail and provide support. 

On Thursday XXXX, I started a transfer with an agent, the agent wanted a verification pin sent to a phone, but the agent could not accept any phone number listed in the account, nor other numbers, nor email, or drivers license ; my access was blocked ; and due to a delay in pin send to my phone, I lost my web access to the account. I was asked to call back 3 to 5 day later to try to verify the account some other way. 

On Friday XXXX, My wife used her access to the marcus account to move the funds to a third party account listed on the marcus transfer page. verification issues ensued, and later the transfer was reversed stating the funds can only be sent to the originating account. 

On Monday XXXX, I called to regain access to the account. The agent asked some verification questions such as address, previous address, account numbers, then unlocked the account. 

On Monday XXXX, An agent guided my wife to put forward a wire to originating account, but due to a misunderstanding the wire did not go through. Marcus agents tried to unblockk the wire but we were informed to check back next day to cancel and retry the transfer. 

On Tuesday XXXX, my wife was able to cancel the wire she started the previous day ; I then submitted the wire request from my side, it was accepted initially. 

On Tuesday XXXX, later in the day, I get a call to verify a pin they send again for the transfer ( accepted ), but says there is something another group wants to check with me. The new agent says she needs to verify the account again, but this time the phone # and gmail are not good enough to verify the account. There is no explanation for how this will get resolved. 

We are trying to move the funds back to the account which originally funded Marcus with $ XXXX back in XXXX. 

We are afraid that our funds are being held XXXX by the marcus by Goldman sachs while we have a deadline to close on a XXXX  property purchase. We appreciate your help.

I believe the account is invalid. USAA SVG BK needs to verify under oath that this claim is valid, free from any claims and defenses including but not limited to any breach of agreement, failure of consideration, or material alterations, and that the original lender provided value. Further, the alleged account was transferred in good faith and with the consent of all parties involved. If they are unable to provide under oath the previously listed item then I require the account to be removed from my credit & their records. USAA SVG BK XXXX
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

_source.complaint_what_happened:
In XX/XX/year> I applied to Discover for Discover IT Secured Credit card. Discover advertise that Discover It Secured credit card is for people that want to build their credit history and improve their XXXX credit score. Discover advertise that its secure IT credit card can help to improve credit score, build better and longer credit history and overall credibility. 
It also indicated that its secured card is for people with poor to fair score and short credit history and that despite presence of those negative factors applicants has high chance of approval. 
At the time of my application my XXXX score was XXXX - Good, The length of credit : Fair, Credit Mixt- Good, Credit payments : very good, Credit Utilization : Fair. 
Despite my good credit report and score and that this was Secured card application the Discover denied my application. Moreover, Discover in response to my application did hard pull inquiry with XXXX XXXX which lowered my score- they did not in their application that they would do hard pull inquiry. i did not authorize such inquiry and I consider it illegal. 
When I asked their representative about their motives of denial I was told it was due to my short length of credit history ( which was reported by XXXX as " fair '' ). I told their representative that they promise potential applicants for secure Discover It card to improve their credit aspect including length of credit and score and that their denial of my application is contrary to what they advertise on line. I have not received any logical justification of their decision. Besides when issuing this type of card the bank Discover would not be assuming any risk as secured credit cards are backed by applicant 's own funds paid as face value of the his/her own card. This is misleading consumers practices by Discover company. No written letter of explanation of the denial was ever sent to me, the denial appear at the end of my application without any reasons.
_source.issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Banks that issue general purpose credit cards defraud the public as follows : The banks charge extremely high credit card interest fees which is only one segment of this issue. 
Banks do not pay any form of interest however to credit card holders on overpayments or earned " cash back '' dollars that may be sitting in banks for long periods of time until the rewards are re-deemed. This is in fact simply more abuse by the banking system and it can be resolved easily. 
Remember I am only talking about earned rewards dollars that can ultimately be redeemed as cash from the bank. Generally speaking these are promotional incentives and sound like this, " Earn 3 percent back on all purchases '' or something similar. 
Certainly, banks should not have to pay interest such as what they charge for purchases however, they could pay the basic interest rate that is applicable for their savings account and this is in the range of 3-4 % these days. 
Thank you
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XXXX PNC bank added interest charge of {$170.00} to my credit card account. My account was at {$7400.00}. Credit limit was {$7500.00}. That put me over limit by {$120.00}. On XXXX I paid off card completely. On XXXX, unexpectedly I had to use card to pay {$2900.00} for wifes medical expense. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I received two letters in mail from PNC. Both dated XX/XX/XXXX, informing me that my credit limit was lowered from {$7500.00} to {$600.00}. 
My concern is how can my limit be lowered to {$600.00} after they accepted a {$2900.00} charge to it. And after I paid off both accounts on XX/XX/XXXX. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted PNC credit card for the first time. I explained my above situation and female said she would get back to me in XXXX hours. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, went into local PNC branch and met with XXXX XXXX who contacted credit card side again. Explained to her also what was going on. XXXX agreed with me, but it was a waste of both our times to contact credit card side. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I again contacted PNC credit card #. Got hung up on on first call after verifying myself. Called again. This time talked to XXXX. She took time to get all my information about why I was calling, eventually put me on hold to check out some information. And then I was hung up on again before she responded back to me. And I never received a call back even though she had my contact information. 
From what I have researched, for this particular card, PNC can not lower the limit to {$600.00}. It should be to nearest {$100.00} in account plus {$500.00}. The lowest they can lower would be {$3400.00}.
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

_source.complaint_what_happened: First national bank purchased my accounts from XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX in 2015 without my knowledge and transferred my XXXX accounts ( which at XXXX were non fee based ) into fee based accounts of which the balance didn't meet the minimum threshold to avoid fees. They then subsequently drafted the accounts down to nothing and closed them for insufficient funds. When contacted, they offered to move my miniscule remaining funds into non-fee based accounts. ( If that was an option, why weren't they transferred into those accounts to begin with? ) Regardless, they refused to make me whole and reimburse me for the funds stolen. In light of the news about the B of A finding and the trouble that XXXX has gone through with a very similar situation. I would like the CFPB to begin diligent investigation into FNB and realize they've stolen my money for no services rendered. I, not once, deposited, withdrew, or utilized any of their services. They simply transferred my money in, placed it in nonequivalent accounts, debited without my knowledge, and then closed my accounts, effectively stealing from me ... .all " legally '' of course. I reached out to many individuals giving them the ability to make it right, all, of course, falling on deaf ears. They acknowledge that they took the money in accordance with their fee schedules... .fee schedules that I never acknowledged or understood until it was too late... .I 'm still shocked this has been condoned by the company rather than apologies issues and restitutions paid... .simply stunning.

_source.complaint_what_happened: On XX/XX/XXXX, I discovered that Busey Bank was reporting a charged off account on my consumer reports which is in violation of under the Privacy Act of 1974. They agreed per there contract with me that they would not report my non public personal information to a non third party affiliate. It is evidenced on all of my consumer reports that Busey Bank breached there contract and violated there terms by reporting my non public personal information to third parties, namely XXXX, XXXX and XXXX pursuant to 16 cfr 313.3 and 313.7 ( 1 ). Pursuant to 15 USC 1681 ( b ) Creditors can not furnish consumers information without explicit consent. Additionally, Busey Bank was required to provide me with a purchase money loan pursuant to the Truth and Lending Act, 15 USC 1601 and regulation z which they failed to do. And Busey Bank is also still currently reporting transaction history which is illegal. Also, being that this account is charged off it is considered a certificate of indebtedness which constitutes income and is not to be reported on my consumer report.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a collection letter via USPS from National Enterprise Systems attempting to collect a debt that they claim dates back to XX/XX/XXXX. I have no knowledge or records of this debt, and I believe it is time-barred. The letter acknowledges that due to the age of the account, XXXX XXXX XXXX is unable to file a suit against me. 

Despite this, National Enterprise Systems is still attempting to collect the debt. I have never received any prior communication or billing statements related to this account, and I do not owe any money to XXXX XXXX XXXX. I believe this collection attempt violates the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) due to the misleading nature of trying to collect a time-barred debt. 

I request the CFPB investigate this matter to ensure that National Enterprise Systems ceases their collection efforts on this time-barred debt and verifies that it is not reported on my credit report in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

_source.complaint_what_happened:
In XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted Bank of America to initiate a partial transfer request for a security position held at another institution ( XXXX XXXX ). Bank of America sent me a form to complete, which I did complete a submitted. After not hearing from Bank of America for several weeks, I contacted them to inquire about the status. Bank of America instructed me they sent me, and I submitted the incorrect form, and the mailed me a different form to complete. Upon receipt of the form sent by mail, I completed it accordingly requesting a partial transfer of the same security. The form appeared to require notary signature. I took the form to the local branch in order to have it notarized, with the intention of mailing it back accordingly. At the branch a bank representative stated a notary was not required, and that they could handle submission of the request at that time. I instructed the representative to ensure that the form was completed accurately to initiate a partial transfer of the respective security as I did not want the account at XXXX XXXX to be closed. He stated that it would be handled accordingly. After leaving the branch I recieved an email confirmation that same afternoon ( XX/XX/XXXX ) that the transfer was initiated as a Entire Account Transfer transfer type and that they expected to have it completed by XX/XX/XXXX. I returned to the branch that same day to instruct the branch representative that it was incorrect, and to either request modification or have it cancelled. Upon notification that the respective incorrect transfer had been completed I contacted Bank of America to correct the the issue, I was told by the representative that the form they have on file instructed them to execute a full transfer. I stated that was incorrect, as the form I completed and signed, specifically section XXXX, was checked marked for Partial Transfer. The respective form is not in the secure vault within my respective account. The form I have explicitly instructed for a partial transfer The representative stated I would need to contact the sending institution in order to request the ACAT transfer be reversed. 

I followed up with several subsequent phone calls with both institutions, with the last call being w/ Bank of America where I was instructed to initiate a XXXX XXXX XXXX order to have the problem investigated and reconciled. I requested that a XXXX XXXX be initiated on that phone call and the representative stated he had initiated it and they would follow-up with me within XXXX hours. _source.complaint_what_happened: On XX/XX/XXXX, I filed a dispute with customer service over fraudulent charges to my account. They said it had been filed and I would need to go to the branch. I went to the local branch and the assistant bank manager ( whose name I can not remember ) said they had indeed filed the dispute but they missed on transaction so she filed the dispute on the XXXX charge. I asked when I spoke to customer service about my incoming deposit on the XXXX and was assured that I would be able to get the deposit out. I also asked the assistant bank manager who told me that I would be able to get the deposit as well. On the morning of the XXXX, I called the bank to make sure that I would be able to get the deposit and was told that the original dispute by customer service was never done and the over {$1400.00} I had in my account at that time was taken and applied towards the negative balance. I was also told that the deposit that I was assured I could get was also taken and applied to the negative balance. I had to refile the dispute on the 7 transactions of fraud again since it was never done to start with. The last lady I spoke to said she talked with another department to " try '' to expedite a refund of the over {$1800.00} deposit but it would take 24-48 hours before I would know anything. This isn't the first time I have had to change my debit card because of fraud. I have to change it ever 3-6 months because of their laxed security. They have put my family in a financial bind and we are at risk of losing everything because of this. I spent XXXX hours on the phone with the bank and nothing has been resolved.
